   Baby Benefits - top-up for all parents, flexible return to work program, continued benefits during leave
 


 APOLLO is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate and embrace our diverse, inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives to apply. We’re committed to developing and maintaining a culture rooted in our core values, that is supportive and respectful of all backgrounds and perspectives.



 APOLLO is committed to providing an accommodating recruitment process. If you require any accommodation, please email us at careers@apollocover.com and we’ll work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Title: BI & Data Analyst
Description:
Why join us? 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story. 

 At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

 We are looking for a highly motivated BI & Data Analyst to join the Financial Systems Team in Toronto. This role will report to the Manager, Financial Systems and be responsible for designing and validating management system reports (including Power BI, Power Query and Excel), performing data analysis using a wide variety of applications, and driving automation efforts within the Finance team (specifically focused on Robotic Process Automation). To succeed in this role, candidates will have a strong aptitude towards working with large volumes of data, experience in data analytics, ability to mine data, and understanding data flow & structure. This role requires strong attention to detail as well as the ability to multitask in a complex environment. The preferred candidate will have a strong focus on customer service and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups, financial team and IT department. 

 As a member of this team, you will be responsible for 
Work with financial and operational data from primary or secondary data sources 
Seek efficiencies in existing processes and execution of process improvement initiatives, including exploring and identifying potential new tools and technologies for enhancing reporting automation capabilities, including the use of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) 
Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in complex data sets 
Exploring large data sets and drawing meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs 
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues and follow data governance policies 
Work with management teams to prioritize business, analytics and information needs and understand project requirements 
Assist with the preparation and development of reporting, presentations and various materials for discussion at the executive level 
To succeed in this role, you have 
Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field. 
Have a minimum of 1-2 years of demonstrated experience in a similar role (e.g. Data Analyst or BI Data Analyst). 
Willingness to learn RPA and automated technologies, with a strong inclination to improve processes and not settle for ‘status quo’ (exposure to UI Path an asset). 
Advanced Excel knowledge (including Pivot Tables, Power Query, VBA Macros), and proficient in Power BI, and SQL. 
Experience and exposure to Hyperion Financial Management, Global Spreadsheet Server, and other BI Tools (e.g. Tableau) an asset. 
Strong eagerness to learn new tools, topics and explore opportunities to leverage technology to generate efficiencies and improve capabilities. 
Team oriented individual with strong communication skills, who is comfortable engaging with different groups within the organization (including non-technical audiences). 
Technical expertise in data mining and analysis, with an understanding of financial reporting concepts. 
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and innovative approaches for resolution. 
Strong project management and organizational skills and ability to work under pressure and manage high priority projects with multiple or competing deadlines. 


Our story:
 Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees. 

 For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com 

 OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

 Vaccination Policy 

 At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Title: Business Analyst/Consultant
Description:
Who we are: 
Quad Infotech Inc is the leading provider of cutting edge, world-class, integrated MES software solutions for steel industry. We are the No. 1 provider of MES systems in the long steel industry and our products are the new best in class standard in the North American steel manufacturing industry.
We are currently hiring for Business Analysts to participate as a part of SCRUM teams to help with design, development, commissioning and support of our advanced production management and analytics suite of software. Your main tasks will include performing detailed business and technical requirements gathering and analysis, documenting processes, performing user acceptance testing, conduct training, and support commissioning and roll outs. You will be a part of an Agile team of engineers, developers and designers.
To succeed in this role, you must be logic driven, analytical and a quick learner. You should be able to think outside the box and be able to prioritize tasks and deliver time-sensitive items.
Responsibilities: 

Working closely with external and internal stakeholders to evaluate business processes, technical and functional requirements, areas of improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.
Provide post-project implementation support
Providing front-end and back-end support to clients and analyzing, investigating, resolving client issues
Establishing root cause of application errors and escalating appropriately to the development teams
Performing analyses on software application functionality and suggesting improvements

Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Software Development or appropriate technical field
1 – 2 years of experience with data mapping, data conversion or data integration projects
1 – 2 years of experience with business and technical requirements analysis, modeling, verification and methodology development
1 year of experience with relational databases and SQL
Ability to work independently and display creativity, exercise sound judgement, demonstrate initiative, and possess excellent written and oral communication skills
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Understanding of project management concepts
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Extended health care
Paid time off

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Education:

Bachelor's Degree (required)

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
  Shopify’s mission is to make commerce better for everyone. From building a new product feature for our commerce platform, to helping a merchant troubleshoot an issue over the phone, we want to empower our ecosystem through our work.
 Having a unified vision, a north star, is vitally important to ensure that we are all headed in the same direction. No matter the size or experience, we want to power every merchant’s experience. This is why we’re all here.
 Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations across North America and Europe where Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere



 Job Description
  REMOTE - NORTH AMERICA
 About the team
 Within the Shopify Trust Team, the Commerce, Trust & Integrity Team is committed to making commerce better for everyone. Our work includes developing solutions to prevent, detect and mitigate bad actors as well as developing tooling to scale and streamline complex workflows. We collaborate with teams across Shopify to understand areas of risk and take steps to prevent it. Our mandate is challenging, varied and constantly evolving.
 To support our mandate we are looking to add a Senior Risk Data Analyst to identify risk vectors and leverage data creatively to figure out why they exist, and how best to address them. This role will collaborate closely with our Data Science team, as well as Product, Engineering and Operations partners to turn insights into effective risk mitigation solutions.
 Responsibilities:

 Develop and monitor key fraud & risk metrics in partnership with Product, Policy & Data teams
 Build monitoring and alerting to track the impact and continued effectiveness of platform controls
 Use data to quantify, prioritize and conduct root cause analysis of risk vectors through detailed analysis and testing. Report out on findings and recommendations
 Generate insights to inform targeted prevention & mitigation strategies across Product, Engineering, Data, Policy and Operations teams
 Work with Data Science in the development of models and analytics to detect bad actors
 Evaluate multiple data sets to surface patterns of fraud and risk




 Qualifications
  Requirements for the role:

 A Bachelor's degree in a related field, and/or commensurate work experience. Experience with fraud & risk management is strongly preferred
 Proficiency leveraging large datasets to drive business decisions
 Strong analytical and problem solving skills using data to identify gaps, and surface mitigation opportunities
 Advanced SQL, Python and experimentation experience
 Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, exemplified through effective data storytelling
 Ability to dive-in to day-to-day workings of multiple teams and understand the full scope of their functions and responsibilities
 Endless curiosity and an ability to think outside the box

 Additional Information
  Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is thisclose to what we’re looking for, consider applying. We know that diversity of thought makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.
 How to Apply: We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We’d love to hear about a time in any of your current or past roles when you helped make an operational process or system better and more efficient. Please respond in the “Notes to the Hiring Manager” section of the application.
 This posting will close on Monday, June 13th
 #LI-KO5 #LI-REMOTE

 Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.
 At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

 We are looking for a super Data Analyst that can be not only an employee of a great team but also a partner in our approaches. Title: Data Analyst - Cell Biology
Description:
Full-timeVancouver


 



 JUNE 21, 2022

 Job ID: 220029

 AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst, well-versed in the analysis of complex cell biology data, to join our dynamic Discovery team.
 The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between wet-lab scientists, bioinformaticians and software engineers, in a fast-paced and focused environment. The candidate is expected to be able to multitask, problem-solve, think critically and demonstrate scientific rigor. 
How you might spend your days:

Coordinating with different functional teams, with an emphasis on Discovery and Data Science, to develop strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation and interpretation
Building automated analysis pipelines for a variety of data types derived from medium- and high-throughput experiments, including flow cytometry, spectrophotometry, spectrofluorimetry and high-content imaging
Implementing and maintaining these analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness and clarity
Developing and implementing software solutions for improving data flow and maintaining data standards across multiple teams
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues and partners

We'd love to hear from you if:

You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment
You thrive in a collaborative environment
You enjoy bringing out the best in your teammates
You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment with multiple priorities
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver
You can effectively communicate scientific ideas across disciplines and levels of experience

Required qualifications and experience:

MSc in bioinformatics or computational biology with two or more years of related work experience, or BSc in a relevant field with five or more years of related experience
Proficiency in at least one programming language for analysis and data visualization (Python & SQL preferred)
Background in life sciences: Cell Biology, Immunology, or Molecular Biology preferred
Demonstrated ability to create flexible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others, such as:

Building and deploying user-friendly interactive data analysis applications, using tools such as Dash or R-Shiny
Designing standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial data
Designing data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources, using tools such as Redshift & Bigquery or Spark & Dask

Excellent communication skills, and the ability to identify key issues and succinctly describe them
Driven to learn and master new technical skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Impeccable attention to detail

Offers & benefits:

The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks of vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development

About AbCellera:
 At AbCellera, we’re solving tough problems and creating innovative solutions from the ground up - custom immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We’re revolutionizing how our scientists can explore antibodies and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.
 You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. We’re a growing company with a high-throughput pipeline and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn’t just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of visionaries and innovators. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We’re looking for someone like you to help us get there.
 To apply:
 Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 220029 in your cover letter. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-LC1 #LI-MS

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US
 SportsMEDIA Technology – (SMT) is the pioneer in sports technology, having re-imagined the fan experience 30 years ago. Since then, we’ve revolutionized how sports fans watch their favorite events, whether in the stands, livestreaming or on television. Through innovative real-time and wireless data and display systems, SMT’s impact is evident in every major international sport on the world’s stage, from football and soccer to tennis and golf. Along the way, SMT has grown to become the premier technology provider for pinnacle world-renowned events, including the tennis Grand Slams, golf majors, the Olympics, NHL, NBA, the New York City Marathon and CrossFit Games. SMT designed and developed the official scoring, statistics, and onsite live presentation systems for the NBA, the NHL, the PGA TOUR, NASCAR, the CrossFit Games, all four golf majors, and the four tennis slams.
 SMT services hundreds of major U.S and international sports events, as well as major sports broadcasters, teams and organizing bodies, resulting in a sports technology powerhouse unequaled in the industry. SMT continues to blaze the trail in sports technology with innovative biometrics and player and object tracking, mobile apps, analytics, video production services, wireless information systems, and on-site services. SMT’s products have become a regular part of the viewing experience for fans and an invaluable asset for clients. SMT's growth has led to the creation of several divisions, with divisions in Durham, NC, Fremont, CA, Jacksonville, FL, and Toronto, Canada.

 JOB PURPOSE
 The Data Analyst will work within the SMT multi-disciplinary team in growing the sports knowledge base using data collected by SMT and third parties, by running novel analyses and producing useful reports to be shared with internal stakeholders and SMT clients. The Data Analyst will specialize on statistical graphic designs and displays.

 ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

 Prepare automated reports and data displays in consultation with our front-end engineering and design teams.
 Consult with project stakeholders, including league and broadcast partners, on the best ways to present insights across multiple platforms.
 Detect repeatable features and patterns in cleaned high-throughput data as inputs to more sophisticated models and measurements.
 Design, build and evaluate descriptive and predictive numerical models to gain insights into player and team performance, development, and trends over time.


 REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

 Bachelor’s degree or higher in a data-science-focused program (e.g. statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, economics) or a bachelor’s degree in any subject with commensurate work experience.
 Experience writing automated reports or building interactive dashboards for information display (e.g. RMarkdown/Shiny, Django, Tableau)
 Design statistical graphical displays for real time consumption (D3.JS and similar programs)
 Minimum 1 year experience with statistical computing software (R with dplyr/tidyverse strongly preferred; Python, Julia, Matlab and similar are acceptable) – academic experience sufficient.
 Minimum 1 year experience in statistical and/or machine learning modelling, such as: generalized linear/additive/hierarchical models, mixture models, model averaging, Bayesian computation, bagging/boosting, random forest models, time series/survival models, clustering and classification – academic experience sufficient.


 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 Experience dealing with large data sets (ex. > 1 GB)
 Experience with cloud computing environments.
 Experience with project management frameworks (e.g. Scrum) and shared development tools (Jira, GitHub, etc.)
 Experience with presentation of results in a public/semi-public setting (conferences, publications/blogs) and with presentation of technical ideas to nontechnical team-members.
 Experience playing/watching/analyzing hockey, baseball, soccer, basketball, or other sports.


 BENEFITS

 Two Medical Plans – Premier and Basic
 Dental Insurance
 Vision Insurance
 Long-term and short-term Disability plans
 Life & AD/D Insurance Plan
 401(k) Plan
 Ten Paid Holidays
 Generous Paid Time Off/PTO plan.
 Confidential employee assistance program
 Sporting event tickets



 Are you ready to join the SMT Team and be a Game Changer?


 Apply Now!



 SMT is an equal opportunity employer.


 Final candidates are subject to criminal background checks.


 SMT participates in E-Verify.

Title: Data Engineer (Business Analyst)
Description:
POSITION LOCATION: Ottawa, ON

 POSITION TITLE: Data Engineer  


POSITION REPORTS TO: Practice Director, Enterprise Analyses

 DEPARTMENT/UNIT NAME: Enterprise Analyses

 JOB SUMMARY:

 The Data Engineer will build and operationalize data necessary for enterprise data and analytics initiatives. This role will build, manage and optimize data architecture and pipelines in accordance with industry standard practices and using industry standard tools, and will move these data pipelines effectively into production for data and analytics use cases across the organization. The incumbent will ensure compliance with data governance and data security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing these integrated and reusable data pipelines and analytical models that will support and promote self-service analytics. Will occasionally provide support to end users on the use of data visualization solutions. Responsible for maintaining and making recommendations to enhance technology as the needs of our client’s change.

 ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:


 Data and Analytics


 Design, build and maintain data pipelines (i.e. data flow from data sources to integration to consumption for specific use cases).
Develop data models (conceptual, logical and/or physical) as required.
Manage metadata using data preparation, integration and AI-enabled tools and techniques.
Drive automation in data integration. Recommend and lead the implementation techniques and architectures to automate the most-common, repeatable and tedious data preparation and integration tasks partially or completely to minimize manual and error-prone processes.
In collaboration with functional leaders, identify the company’s inefficiencies, inaccuracies, missed opportunities, other issues and report on the recommended improvements to the executive team.
Provide technical leadership for Athena (analytics platform) by directing and prioritizing the work of others on the team related to Athena.
Act as a subject matter expert for the Athena platform.



Business Analysis 



Assist cross-functional groups, other Business/Process analysts, and other stakeholders to gather, define and refine their data requirements for various initiatives.
Propose appropriate (and innovative) data ingestion, preparation, integration and operationalization techniques in optimally addressing these data requirements.
Assess ways to further leverage existing systems and recommend methods for streamlining data flow and data integration.
While identifying and evaluating new projects or requests for enhancements, work with the functional leader to determine the project cost, timeline, goals and feasibility and then support the project through completion.



 Data Compliance and Governance


 Work with corporate leadership to manage and promote compliance with the corporate data strategy
Collaborate with data stewards or appropriate stakeholders to develop policies to ensure the responsible use of data by data users and consumers. 
Lead the development and maintenance of documentation and the data catalog for Alimentiv data assets.
Promote the available data and analytics capabilities and expertise to business unit leaders and educate them in leveraging these capabilities in achieving their business goals.
Ensure data or software solutions continue to meet customer needs by capturing changes in requirements and making corresponding updates to existing software or data analytics.



 QUALIFICATIONS:

 Applicants should have a minimum of an undergraduate degree in relevant field of study (preferably in Computer Science, Information System) and 4-6 years of relevant experience + strong analytical training . The successful candidate should be well experienced with Data Management architectures such as Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Catalogue and the supporting processes such as Data Integration, Governance, Metadata Management. Strong experience with Microsoft Azure, and popular database programming languages including SQL. Proficient in PowerBI. Demonstrated success in working with both IT and business while integrating analytics and data science output into business processes and workflows. Experience in data management disciplines including data integration, modeling, optimization and data quality. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team and meet important deadlines. Understanding of enterprise and company systems. Facilitation skills and business process mapping and analysis experience preferred. Statistical analysis skills are an asset.

 WORKING CONDITIONS:

 Home-based


 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request

Duties:  Reporting directly to the Manager, Foresight and Analysis, the Associate Data Scientist sources, compiles, analyzes and interprets data sets for the department to provide data-driven insights in alignment with department and government objectives and priorities. The incumbent provides leadership in developing and implementing the department’s data management, stewardship and governance policies/guidelines to ensure appropriate data standards and processes are in place to assure data consistency, quality, and security. Description:

job description
 Innovate. Grow. Contribute. Make an impact with us.
As a co-op/intern student within the ITSM team at The Bay, you will have the opportunity to be heard, keep growing and make a difference. You will be part of our campus program to gain the skills and knowledge needed to take on roles similar to the description listed below. 
Your day to make an impact

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders
Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc operational reports, and dashboards
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations
Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., incidents, services, functional teams, users, banners)
Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues
Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the ITSM strategy and stakeholder needs
Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics; may include delivery of training to audiences
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed


 
How will you strive

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science or equivalent
The ability to thrive in a team and collaborative setting, contribute and share ideas and work to ensure the success of the team
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across diverse organizations and teams
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, with a desire to learn on the job in a rapidly changing environment
The ability to meet deadlines and produce high quality output
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data scrubbing, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Excel, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, Power BI
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or work experience


 
What you can expect

Innovate. Rewrite the rules of retail to help Canadians live a colourful life.
Grow. Our high-performing team members will challenge you to learn and grow everyday.
Contribute. You’ll get hands-on experience while collaborating with industry leaders.
Ability to make an impact with us
Network and build relationships with students from diverse backgrounds from across Canada
Participate in social activities and development workshops to help build your career tool kit while enjoying a work-life balance
Associate discount up to 40% including top brands


 
Learn more about our program
https://www.linkedin.com/company/thebaydigital/life/universityrelations/ 
About The Bay
As Canada’s oldest startup, The Bay is a digital-first, purpose-led retailer. Our mission is to help Canadians live their best style of life.
The Bay is on a high-growth trajectory to become one of the largest digital retail businesses in Canada through TheBay.com and its Marketplace. If you are looking to join an iconic brand, create impactful change and be recognized for your work, we want you to join our team.
At The Bay, smart, high-performing team members will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value ambitious work and great ideas grounded in data and insights. We are looking for talented people who love a fast-paced environment, embrace change and are looking to make an impact with groundbreaking ideas.
We are a digital-first company and brand for a diverse world and we need a diverse team to reach our potential. come and join a winning team that supports collaboration and demonstrates innovation, energy, creativity and vision every day.


Interested in Social Media?
Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram

Title: Environmental Data Analyst - Flow Monitoring
Description:
Incorporated in 2008, AMG Environmental Inc. provides storm water and sewer flow monitoring services for clients such as municipalities, water districts and housing development companies. AMG offers specialized technical field services, flow monitoring data collection and data management services in order to provide its clients with essential data used to identify and resolve sewer capacity and flow issues. AMG Environmental also partners with engineering firms to develop customized sewer solutions based on the data collected and analyzed by the AMG team.
Description
The Data Analyst, under the direction of the Manager of Environmental Data Services, is responsible for the quality of environmental monitoring data. Primarily, the Data Analyst will use internal web-based analysis tools such as hydrographs, time series data plots, scatter graphs and field reports to analyze trends and interpret results of environmental flow monitoring projects. They will also be required to perform necessary data repairs and schedule field crew maintenance on equipment. Prior experience with flow monitoring, inflow/infiltration studies, open-channel flow hydraulics or wastewater systems would be beneficial. The Data Analyst must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and three years of related experience.
Job Duties

Assist in collection and tracking of data from a variety of different sensors (depth, velocity, temperature, pH, H2S, turbidity, DO, rain gauges etc.)
Daily review and processing of data using web-based statistical software – analyzing trends and interpreting the results
Perform daily data evaluation, maintenance and data repairs (i.e. after sensor calibrations)
Prioritize and efficiently schedule field crews for routine site maintenance
Create and submit work orders with a high degree of accuracy and professionalism
Interact with field personnel, production personnel, engineers, and clients on scheduling and data quality related issues
Act as a technical consultant and provide customer service through various means including telecommunications, internet research and database systems
Prepare reports, research papers and educational texts
Generate flow balancing spreadsheets and other related documents as needed for assessing data quality
Actively participate in company quality management systems and QA/QC procedures; including internal audits, root cause analysis and corrective actions
Contribute to the development of new projects and ideas
Maintain a safe working environment

Job Requirements

Degree or diploma in environmental studies or a related field
Three years of related work experience is considered an asset
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and Microsoft Outlook
Ability to understand and accurately interpret data quality
Proven ability to analyze complex information and conduct relevant research to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts
Knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information System) and other statistical software is considered an asset, but not required
Experience with SQL databases is considered an asset, but not required

Competencies

Detail oriented
Strong organization & time management skills
Project coordination
Excellent problem-solving skills
Effective communication & listening
Ability to work individually as well as part of a team
Commitment to Health and Safety
Continuous Improvement

Work Conditions

Nearly always work indoors
Safe ergonomic operation of desktop computer and peripherals
Attendance and participation in training
Use of required personal protective equipment

Equal Opportunity Employer
AMG Environmental Inc. is committed to providing a barrier-free work environment in concert with the Accessibility for Ontarian's with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. As such, AMG Environmental Inc. will make accommodations available to applicants with disabilities upon request during the recruitment process.
AMG Environmental Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, AMG Environmental Inc. will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.
AMG Environmental Inc. seeks to fully integrate the principles of Employment Equity and will ensure the full participation and advancement of members of historically disadvantaged groups (i.e., members of visible minorities, persons with disabilities, women, and aboriginal peoples). AMG Environmental Inc. will achieve this by ensuring that its hiring process is fair and equitable for all persons.
AMG Environmental Inc. strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, AMG Environmental Inc. will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout the course of employment.
Job Type: Full-time

Work from home

Title: Junior Business Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Posting

Come start your career here!

 Our Internship program offers paid 18-month internships for new grads interested in a career in municipal public service. The program provides training, development, and on-the-job experience for candidates that have graduated within the last 24 months.
    
 We are inviting applications for the 
    18-month term position of Junior Business Analyst Intern in Parks and Recreation.
    
 The Intern Program is designed to provide experiential learning and maximum professional exposure to interns in their chosen field of study while exploring the benefits of working for the municipality. Over the course of the internship, candidates will learn about government policy, operations, administration, services, and planning in a collaborative and supportive environment. Interns make a difference in our community and organization!
    
 Halifax Regional Municipality (HRM) is committed to reflecting the community it serves and recognizing Diversity and Inclusion as one of the Municipality’s core values. For this position preference will be given to candidates who self-identify as African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Women in occupations or positions where they are underrepresented in the workforce, Indigenous/Aboriginal People, Persons with Disabilities and 2SLGBTQ+ Persons. Applicants are encouraged to self-identify on their electronic application.
    

POSITION SUMMARY:
 Under the direction of the Coordinator, Parks & Recreation, the Junior Business Analyst intern will support the documentation of processes and workflow to help capture corporate knowledge. This will include data collection, documentation of process steps, review shared drive filing practices, and support a review and refresh of the Parks & Recreation Intranet webpages. The intern will collaborate with staff, internal clients, and other business units.
    

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Collect data to document and analyze current operational and administrative work processes
 Document existing/current state work practices and procedures
 Provide business analyst support to various performance excellence projects
 Identify and recommend areas for operational improvements to drive workflow efficiencies
 Assist with the identification of direct and indirect departmental savings
 Support development of performance measures, policies, and procedures
 Identify and consult with stakeholders to understand business operations and challenges
 Collect data on existing shared network drive folders and support improvements
 Support review and revisions of Parks & Recreation Intranet pages
 May perform other related duties as assigned


 QUALIFICATIONS


Education & Experience:

 Undergraduate degree in Business Administration or a closely related field
 To be eligible for the internship, candidates must have graduated within the last 24 months or be confirmed to graduate in June 2022 from a recognized or legally authorized university or community college
 Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada at time of application and maintain this status for the duration of 18-month term
 We value non-traditional experience and candidates are encouraged to outline in their application any student leadership, volunteering, extra-curricular, or community-based experience they possess
 Certification in Business Analysis considered an asset
 Experience with Process Management Tools (Lean Six Sigma) considered an asset
 Parks & Recreation knowledge/experience considered an asset
 Preference will be given to those candidates who have demonstrated an interest in public policy or government administration
 Preference will be given to those candidates who have demonstrated experience/interest in process reengineering, document management or data analytics through academic work

 Technical/Job Specific Knowledge and Abilities:

 Demonstrated skills in process documentation and improvement
 Demonstrated project management skills and experience implementing and delivering projects
 Strong communication skills and abilities in relationship management
 Developing effective and efficient solutions to diverse and complex business problems
 Translating business needs into technical requirements and solutions
 Strong written and oral communication skills
 Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
 Strong skills in Microsoft business applications
 Ability to work both independently and collaborative as part of a team

 Security Clearance Requirements: Applicants may be required to complete an employment security screening check. You will be provided with more specific information during the recruitment process.
    

COMPETENCIES: Valuing Diversity, Analytical Thinking, Organizing & Planning, Communication, Customer Service, Organizational Awareness, Teamwork & Cooperation, Value & Ethics 
    

WORK STATUS: Term 18 months, Non-Union position
    

HOURS OF WORK: Monday Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 35 hours per week
    

SALARY: $50,000 per year
    

WORK LOCATION: 40 Alderney Drive, Dartmouth
    

CLOSING DATE: Applications will be received up to 
    11:59 pm on Sunday, July 3, 2022.


Please note: We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
    
 During the recruitment process, applicants have the right to request an accommodation. Applicants invited to participate in an assessment process (such as an interview or testing) and who require accommodation, should discuss their needs with the Recruiter when invited to the assessment process.
    
 HRM takes the health and safety of its job applicants and employees seriously. All recruitment activities are being conducted in adherence with current Covid-19 Public Health protocols.

    Project Management & Business Analysis

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
By joining Mitsubishi HC Capital Canada, you will be part of an exceptional team offering flexible and adaptative commercial Equipment Financing solutions to Canadian businesses. Whether it’s leasing, factoring, inventory finance or asset-based lending, our teams are dedicated to offer the best service to our customers.
 Collaboration, empowerment, open-mindedness and a respectful work environment are at the very heart of our day-to-day activities. This is key to our success!
 With a specialized team for sustainable development and a committee focusing on giving back to the community, we strive to make a difference in societal improvement.
 Join us as IT Business Analyst specialized in process optimization and corporate functions and become a part of Mitsubishi HC Capital Canada’s success story.
 About IT Business Analyst:
 As part of the Information Technology team, you will be responsible for enhancing the quality of IT products and services, analyzing data to inform business decisions, and finding technological solutions to business needs, among other duties.
 Your main responsibilities will be:

 Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
 Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies as well as conducting insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
 Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems
 Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
 Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
 Working with management to prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements as well as with IT management to allocate resources and maintain cost efficiency
 Effectively communicating your insights, plans and results to cross-functional team members and management
 Monitoring deliverable, ensuring timely completion of projects and ensuring solutions meet business needs
 Ensuring procedures are updated, implemented and maintained

 The profile we are looking for:

 A minimum of 8 years of experience in business analysis or a related field
   
 Experience with origination and financial systems, ideally within the Commercial/Business Financing & Leasing industry
 Experience in business process optimization and improvement initiatives and projects

 A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or and MBA
 Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, including facilitation, presentation, and documentation.
 Ability to adapt quickly in a rapidly changing dynamic environment
 Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills

 What we have to offer:

 Full time position
   
 37.5-hour work-week, Monday to Friday

 Hybrid work environment (working from home and the office) with options to work from offices in:
   
 Burlington/Toronto, Ontario
 Calgary, Alberta
 Montréal, Québec

 Compensation plan including bonus based on your individual performance as well as the Company’s results
 Competitive benefits package including:
   
 Vacation, sick and personal days given on day one
 Collective insurance including long-term disability, life insurance, medical, dental and vision care as well as virtual healthcare
 RRSP
 Range of wellness initiatives including Employee and Family Assistance Program and virtual health and development platforms

 Professional growth opportunities through our internal postings and online learning platform

 Don’t think this position is a great fit for you, but still want to join us? Click here: https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=b3ef4f03-f8ff-4ded-80c8-6dd5c5a224f7&ccId=9200144510729_2&lang=en_CA
 We would like to thank all applicants in advance. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be contacted directly. Mitsubishi HC Capital Canada values diversity and is committed to accessibility. Should you require accommodation due to disability, please notify the Human Resources Recruiter.
 The use of the masculine is a default reference and includes all potential applicants.

Title: Data Analyst - Cell Biology
Description:
AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst, well-versed in the analysis of complex cell biology data, to join our dynamic Discovery team.
 The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between wet-lab scientists, bioinformaticians and software engineers, in a fast-paced and focused environment. The candidate is expected to be able to multitask, problem-solve, think critically and demonstrate scientific rigor. 
How you might spend your days:

Coordinating with different functional teams, with an emphasis on Discovery and Data Science, to develop strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation and interpretation
Building automated analysis pipelines for a variety of data types derived from medium- and high-throughput experiments, including flow cytometry, spectrophotometry, spectrofluorimetry and high-content imaging
Implementing and maintaining these analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness and clarity
Developing and implementing software solutions for improving data flow and maintaining data standards across multiple teams
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues and partners

We'd love to hear from you if:

You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment
You thrive in a collaborative environment
You enjoy bringing out the best in your teammates
You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment with multiple priorities
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver
You can effectively communicate scientific ideas across disciplines and levels of experience

Required qualifications and experience:

MSc in bioinformatics or computational biology with two or more years of related work experience, or BSc in a relevant field with five or more years of related experience
Proficiency in at least one programming language for analysis and data visualization (Python & SQL preferred)
Background in life sciences: Cell Biology, Immunology, or Molecular Biology preferred
Demonstrated ability to create flexible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others, such as:

Building and deploying user-friendly interactive data analysis applications, using tools such as Dash or R-Shiny
Designing standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial data
Designing data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources, using tools such as Redshift & Bigquery or Spark & Dask

Excellent communication skills, and the ability to identify key issues and succinctly describe them
Driven to learn and master new technical skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Impeccable attention to detail

Offers & benefits:

The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks of vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development

About AbCellera:
 At AbCellera, we're solving tough problems and creating innovative solutions from the ground up - custom immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We're revolutionizing how our scientists can explore antibodies and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.
 You'll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. We're a growing company with a high-throughput pipeline and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn't just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of visionaries and innovators. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We're looking for someone like you to help us get there.
 To apply:
 Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 220029 in your cover letter. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-LC1 #LI-MS

Title: Software Business Analyst
Description:
Software Business Analyst
DataFix is a small company, but as a team we have played major roles in the successful delivery of many large projects and have had a huge impact on voting in Canada. Our customers appreciate our ability to move quickly and to deliver superior solutions and customer service. We are a close-knit group, and we take great pride in our flexible and adaptable working environment.
Located at the corner of University and Wellington in Toronto, DataFix is within walking distance for people living in the downtown core. Our office is just steps from the St. Andrew subway station and is a short walk from Union Station.
What we are looking for
DataFix is a leader in elections software and data management solutions. In business for over 25 years, our customers include some of the largest private and government organizations in Canada. With our VoterView product, DataFix offers one of the most sophisticated elector list management and electronic poll book solutions in North America. DataFix has a proven track record delivering high quality services under tight time constraints.
DataFix is looking for a talented, Software Business Analyst to join the team in our downtown Toronto location. The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to grasp new situations quickly, working in a fast- paced, deadline-driven work environment.
The primary responsibility of the successful candidate will be bridging the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to management and business partners. The successful candidate willbe expected to work independently, with multiple priorities but will have supervisory assistance and guidance.
Who you are: 
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) to interact with various project team members including test & development team, project management and business partners
Able to multitask
Able to work collaboratively and independently
What you will be doing: 
Help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to customers
Work with peers on project intake activities, requirements gathering, user story creation, defect triage and analysis, backlog management - among other BSA-related duties.
Qualifications: 
At least 3 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role
Strong written and oral communication
Ability to translate customer requirements into technical solutions
Solution focused, takes initiative to work effectively within established guidelines
Ability to multi-task and flourish in a fast- paced, deadline-driven work environment
Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment
Assets: 
You are comfortable speaking with a wide range of stakeholders in different business departments
You have strong documentation skills for reporting, tracking and resolving user issues with the software applications
You have experience testing software applications, bug tracking, regression testing, and documenting defects
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $45,000.00-$80,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision care
Work from home

Schedule:

8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We will work with the potential candidate to discuss working remotely and or a hybrid model of coming into the office occasionally for meetings etc.

Title: Junior Data Support Analyst
Description:
Looking for a new team member to help us continue to provide quality data service and support our clients come to rely on. 
This position requires advanced Excel, MS Access and the ability to analyze and manage data sets.
 This is an in-office position, pending all local regulations.
 We are centrally located in the Don Mills area with access to the TTC. We offer the opportunity to gain experience working on a series of projects and work in a small team to gain access to a variety of deliverables. 
Note – this is a junior position for someone looking to gain experience. Please ensure to evaluate along with the skill set requirements before applying.
 We support various marketing and membership programs on behalf of our client. The Data Support Analyst position is ideal for someone looking to gain experience with program management, working to support us in building our capabilities in the information and analysis areas for these services. The position also allows you to enhance existing process and reports and includes potential for CRM development.
 Description: Provide support to business analysis, records management and data operations through queries, report and application design and maintenance in MS products including Excel, CRM 2011, MS Access, SQLServer, C# and VBA.
 Location: Don Mills
 Ideal Candidate: This position is best suited to those who have 1-2 years of office experience and have completed a post-secondary data/application diploma or degree.  
Requirements

 Skilled in MS Excel (macros, pivot tables, formulas and charts), MS Access (create/modify tables, forms, queries and reports)
Some experience within SQL Server, MS CRM , .Net would be helpful
One year of hands on experience in a data support, programming or application development role.
Highly developed analytical skills and a sound understanding of computer programming principles including Web, SQL and Application Development.
Application development experience including Visual Basic or C# using Visual Studio another asset

 Responsibilities: 

Monthly report generation and maintenance
Maintain, create and modify all process documents
Write, modify, and test routines, queries and macros 
Identify and develop standard import and bulk data transfer and transformation routines 
Review and maintain the quality of data and lists in MS Access and SQL Server
Provide systems, software and application development support for internal systems and web 
Liaise with rest of team to provide updates on routine reports, identify any issues/anomalies and work to enhance any processes to document any ad hoc reports or exceptions
Work to improve marketing automation processes
Record maintenance of in-house and on-line incentive programs
Other duties as required including ad hoc reports and process improvements

Title: Business Analyst IAM
Description:
Company Description
  Talan Canada is growing and looking to strengthen its team with a Business Analyst IAM for the Montreal office, who will be interested in working with clients from multiple industries.



 Job Description
  The main tasks are:

 Support / Onboarding:
   
 Be Single Point of Contact to onboard application on IAM solutions (SSO + IAM)
 Capture the requirements of users that ease the adoption and push it to the Product Owner
 Ensure of the stability and availability of the services/tools for IAM
 Ensure to operate the services in compliance with the security rules
 Communicate on incidents

 Participate to reduce the online support activity by:
   
 Promoting the Self service
 Enhance the existing documentation
 Identify automation of recurrent tasks

 Spread the knowledge
   
 Liaise with teams in Bangalore and Paris
 Contribute to the documentation and spread the good usage of the tools
 Promote the SSO solution of the group by holding presentation session
 Animate Hands-on session with applications.





 Qualifications
  Technical Skills:

 Desired: IAM, AD/LDAP, OIDC, SAML2, basic network, API, Git, Unix
 Plus: Python or any language, ELK stack, SQL
 A curiosity on security field is mandatory.

 Soft Skills:

 Practical sense: the candidate must suggest pragmatical solutions to fit the need of the user while respecting the quality standards.
 Analysis and synthesis: be able to understand complex problems involving multiple IT teams or users.
 Organisation and planning: be able to manage his working time autonomously and have a strong sense of priority
 Perseverance and result oriented: Demonstrate self-exigence. Perseverance to find a solution, despite the difficulty. Stay positive. Focus on the outcome.
 Oral and written communication: adapt your message to capture the attention of your audience. The candidate should able to communicate with developer, business analyst or manager.
 Client centric and sense of service: To identify needs, the candidate must understand the reasons and motivations of the users of the platforms. He must direct his tasks according to their work habits, while helping them to evolve.
 Cooperation and Team Spirit: He must work in good agreement with the members of the IAM teams all around the world and other teams like security and infrastructure team.

 Languages: English (mandatory), French (nice to have)
 Experience needed:

 3 years experience in support, business or developer analyst and be knowledgeable on Identity Access Management domain.

 Educational Requirements:

 Bachelor of computer science or other related university degree

 You must live in Montreal or be willing to relocate rapidly from anywhere in Canada and possess a valid work permit.
 Additional Information
  Talan is a consulting firm specializing in digital innovation and transformation. For over 20 years, Talan has been advising, supporting, and implementing transformation projects for businesses and public authorities, in France and abroad. With operations on five continents and nearly 5,000 consultants, the group anticipates a revenue of 600 million euros in 2022 and expects a turnover of 1 billion euros by 2024. The group places innovation at the heart of its development strategy and is involved in areas of technological change affecting major corporations, such as Big Data, the Internet of Things, Cryptocurrencies, and Artificial Intelligence.
 Joining Talan also means:

 Joining a Canadian group with more than 500 consultants, working in an agile and pragmatic way with large companies (Finance, Insurance, Telecommunications, Services, Distribution, Public sector) by combining consulting services / technological expertise / innovation / ability to deliver and deploy projects
 Joining dynamic teams, where the role of the employee is at the center of attention, with the desire to create spaces allowing everyone to flourish
 Participating in different communities to contribute to development and to innovate, all with a strong team and entrepreneurship spirit

 Talan is a great playground, it's up to you!

Title: Business Analyst
Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst (Temporary Full-time) Posting # 2022-69 
____________________________________________________
Department: Prince Edward – Lennox & Addington Social Services
Location: Napanee
Supervisor: Supervisor/Manager as determined by the Director of Social Services
Hours of Work: 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday to Friday
Salary Range: $61,570.60 to $72,017.40 per yearDuration: Up to 12 Months with possibility of extension
Closing Date: July 4, 2022
Prince Edward - Lennox and Addington Social Services, a dynamic and progressive organization dedicated to strengthening communities through the delivery of Ontario Works, Children’s Services and Housing Services, is seeking a highly motivated, experienced professional to assist in the research, analysis, program development, implementation and evaluation of the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care System for Prince Edward-Lennox & Addington Social Services.
QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE: 
· Post Secondary Education (College Diploma or University Degree in Business/Public Administration or in a related field (e.g. Human Services Management). Knowledge of the early years and child care sector and community engagement/planning would be considered an asset.
· Minimum two years experience with business and data analysis, or a related field
· Strong foundation in research, analytical, program planning and policy development, implementation and project planning
· Strong knowledge of budgeting, business accounting, financial processes/management and business planning.
· Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills
· Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as in a team environment
· Ability to prioritize, manage multiple issues and deliverables
· Proficient with computer software applications and advanced use of Microsoft Office Suite
· Possess a valid driver’s license with access to a personal vehicle
RESPONSIBILITIES: 
The successful incumbent will operate within the legislative and regulatory standards as set out in the applicable provincial and municipal acts, and within the County of Lennox & Addington local policies, procedures, guidelines and regulations. The initial principal emphasis is to conduct research and policy analysis, local policy development, financial and reporting frameworks to support the local implementation of the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care System.
The primary duties include, but are not limited to: 
· Provide high-level financial funding forecasts and provide recommendations for service system management using Ministry funding allocations and guidelines
· Lead projects to develop and implement new and existing Child Care and Early Learning initiatives, including the local implementation of the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care System
· Develop local policies, processes, guidelines, accountability tools and child care provider resources and tools to support the implementation of the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care System
· Research analyze and seek out subject matter expertise through regional/provincial/national colleagues as well as working with consultants, as required.
· Prepare formal reports and proposals; develop templates and manage lengthy documents
· Review financial and service data
· Assist with Ministry submissions, service contracts and reports
· Support and provide training for the child care operators on the implementation of the Canada Wide Early Learning and Child Care System
· Attend meetings, prepare minutes, create and distribute correspondence
· Maintain records management systems
· Handle and/or prepare material containing sensitive or confidential information
· Support the capacity to respond to information needs
· Any other duties or special assignments as requested by the reporting Supervisor or the Director of Social Services
Other functions or duties may be assigned on a permanent or temporary basis within the same classification. All aspects of this position are subject to change.
For more information or to apply, please visit our website at: https://www.lennox-addington.on.ca/employment
Note: you are able to apply using a mobile phone but we are working on improving the service
Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act for the purpose of applicant selection. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Resumes received after the closing date will not be considered.
Please note that accommodations are available upon request to support the participation of persons with disabilities in applying for jobs and during the interview and assessment process. If you require an accommodation, please call the County’s Human Resources Department at 613-354-4883 to discuss. We will work with you to meet your needs

Employee assistance program
On-site parking

French not required

Monday to Friday

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Req Id: 378109

 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

 Bell Mobility Supply Chain is the entity responsible for the efficient flow-through of product from vendor to customer. As a result of trying to achieve effective product turnover, key supply metrics are required to shed light on the overall performance of sales and distribution. As the SAP/SAS/Oracle Super User, writing code to pull out pertinent information will be required. Duties are to develop and capture raw data from the system and manipulate it into tangible information for making business decisions relevant to supply chain.
 
They must be familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices and procedures. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Will perform a variety of complicated tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. This position requires autonomy and a high degree of initiative and decision-making.
 
Job Duties / Accountabilities

 Own the relationship with the channel primes to determine requirements and support with desired reporting
 Create and maintain reports and tables to allow the business to make the best decisions for their portfolios
 Produce exception dashboards to highlight key metrics
 Create methodology to support the key sales period inventory replenishment model
 Work closely with the Senior Managers of corporately owned channels to identify gaps and provide reporting to support
 Support Inventory Planners with metric reporting to support teams goals and objectives
 Any other duties as required


 SAP & SAS reporting

 SAP & Oracle Super User
 Gather weekly raw data and manipulate it into meaningful reports
 Transfers report findings into meaningful power point decks and presents to senior executives
 Continually looking for ways to improve reporting processes and communicate back to the Sr. Leadership
 Report daily / weekly / monthly KPI’s
 Development of SAS reports that can be utilized by Inventory teams on a daily basis
 Organize business requirements into final reporting solutions
 Manage database and maintain relationship with BI Team to ensure continued upkeep 
In conjunction with BI Team, create data cubes as required

 
System Improvements 

Point person for any system related changes that impact inventory and replenishment for corporately owned stores (Corp & The Source)
 IBP – Integrated Business Planning
 Perform testing with IT, internal and external teams as required


 Essential qualifications and requirements

 Bachelor Degree (Computer Science, Business Systems) or equivalence
 High degree of accuracy and detail for communications both verbal and written
 3 years previous working experience in Reporting / Logistics Management
 3 years practical experience working with ERP systems
 Advanced knowledge of SQL, SAS, Python, SAP and Microsoft Office Tools
 Advanced knowledge in VB Script, VBA
 Medium to Advanced knowledge of SFTP / FTP / SSH / PGP protocols and processes
 Previous systems development experience
 Ability to take business requirements and build database reporting solutions


 Work conditions

 Availability to work some evenings and weekends as required


 #EmployeeReferralProgram

 Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Title: SENIOR STATISTICAL RESEARCH ANALYST
Description:
Are you passionate about data? Do you like explaining to others what the data telling them? Join the team in the Child Care Quality Assurance and Licensing Branch to lead and coordinate efforts in analyzing our inspection and compliance data to assist our regional teams in targeting and using risk-based approaches and help to determine ways to align our resources to focus on preventing and addressing the issues that matter most.
  
 What can I expect to do in this role? In this role, you will:
  

Design and carry out statistical modelling and analysis, data collection, and research and evaluation initiatives, in support of the ministry's commitment in aligning our activities with Ontario's Regulator's Code of Practice
Collaborate with I&IT partners and regional teams in developing analysis, dashboards, reports and advice that supports management and staff with risk-based operational decision-making.
Provide technical guidance and leadership to team members, and other divisional and ministry policy and program areas on analyzing and interpreting inspection and compliance data.

 How do I qualify?
 Research and Analytical Expertise:

You have knowledge of research and statistical analysis techniques to design and conduct research projects and to interpret statistical information
You have knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research and analysis methodologies to undertake analysis of trends, system modelling and evaluation of best practices, options, costs and impacts
You have knowledge of statistical software packages and tools (e.g. Power BI, Excel, Microsoft SQL Server, SSAS, SSIS, Oracle)

 Project Management Skills:

You have experience in working with multi-discipline teams in planning and leading research and evaluation projects
You have knowledge of project management techniques and tools to coordinate project activities and track progress

 Communication, Presentation and Consultation Skills:

You have effective oral and written communication and presentation skills to communicate complex information clearly in a variety of formats (e.g. presentations, reports, briefing materials)
You can interpret and translate data, statistics and modelling into meaningful reports and recommendations for senior management and regional teams
You have consultation and facilitation skills to provide leadership and expert advice and recommendations to senior management and regional teams
You possess a drive to inform inspection and compliance teams what the data means, can work cooperatively with project teams in crafting proposed approaches and provide expertise in measuring impacts of inspection and compliance interventions


 OPS Commitment to diversity, inclusion, accessibility, and anti- racism:

 We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
