Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Job Category: 
Software 
 
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! 

The opportunity 

Reporting to a Technical Product Manager, we need a Business Analyst (BA) who wants to play an integral role in delivering our cloud offerings. We need a BA who is committed to seeing things through at every step; a subject matter expert and trusted advisor with the vision to create innovative solutions to complex problems. We want someone with strengths in the end-to-end process from gathering requirements to creating user stories and collaborating with Developers and Product Managers. 

What’s in it for you 

Influence. You want to work across multiple products, collaborating across the organization, and helping build out our move to the cloud. You want the chance to work in a truly Agile environment where your voice will be heard. You will be given the hands-on opportunity to make a difference as you develop an understanding of how the technologies and solutions work with each other, what the limitations are and how to implement and release cloud features. 

Exposure. You want to be part of a company that is forward-thinking and setting the standards in an industry. As Altus builds out our cloud offering and the products that take our thousands of global users along different paths in the PropTech sector, you will gain exposure to tools, technologies, and people as you work on projects that fulfill our vision. 

Growth. We are building strength on strength as an organization. As we acquire new companies and develop new products, you will increase your presence at the leading edge of a technical and services space. Your career opportunities will increase as we continue to scale, a prime example being the career path of the Head of Design who five years ago started as a QA Analyst and has rapidly worked her way up. 

Here’s what our new Business Analyst will do: 

Start conversations and probe for details. You can efficiently elicit and validate requirements. 
Support solution designs. You can produce functional and non-functional specification documentation incorporating text, mockups, and wireframes for any and every level of audience. 
Analyse. You can gather relevant data, perform an analysis based on specifications, and create reports for the product and development teams. 
Create. You can piece together logical user stories and workflows based on user information, requirements, and your understanding of both the processes and the technology. 
Drive. You investigate issues thoroughly and create practical solutions that solve problems and open up new opportunities. 
Research. You are always looking for ways to improve processes and efficiency. 
Collaborate. You enjoy working with other BAs and across departments as part of a cross-functional team. 
Own it. You take pride in ensuring that the product delivers real value to our customers and satisfies all criteria. 


So, how do we know you are the next Business Analyst? You have: 

The right combination of education and experience. You have experience working as a BA - you know how to break needs down into user stories and how to translate and give directions to ensure we build to specifications. 
A genuine interest in new tools and technology. You learn new software quickly without documentation or hand-holding. You want to grow your exposure to cloud technology. 
A winning communication style. You have a way of speaking that engages your audience and instills confidence and credibility. You know how to leverage communication tools and methodologies. 
A high standard of thoroughness. Your attention to detail guides you. 
A true sense of obligation and responsibility. You love what you do. This isn’t a job. This is a career. You are invested in satisfying the needs of our clients – your clients- and you work hard to do it well, on spec, and on time. 
A solution-focused drive. You investigate issues thoroughly and create effective solutions that solve problems and open up new opportunities. 
A commitment to clarity and efficient processes. You are always looking for ways to improve processes and you always ensure your communications have been received and are clearly understood. 
A team-oriented personality. Your commitment and focus influence those around you to do better. 


What you can expect for our interview process 

1-hour MS teams video interview with the Technical Product Manager & Senior Business Analyst where we get to know you and discuss domain specific technical questions and you will have the opportunity to ask questions and learn more about the company and the team. 
Take-Home Assessment where you will have 2 days to complete it 
1-hour MS teams video interview with a Technical Panel comprising of Technical Product Managers 


Come realize your potential at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
About Us:



   Teleperformance is a worldwide leader in customer experience management and contact center business process outsourcing. Our company employs around 300.000 people working in over 265 dialects and languages, in 80 countries, operating across all business sectors and all continents on behalf of major international companies.
  


   Teleperformance Canada, with more than 1200+ employees, part of the fortune 25 and certified with Great Place to Work, is looking for a group of highly-skilled professionals.
  


 Our Work Culture:



   At Teleperformance, we remain true to our core values of integrity, respect, professionalism, innovation and commitment.
  


 Autonomous - We encourage and trust your decision making skills.
 Progressive work environment- If you have skills to prove we have all ladders for you to grow
 Flexible - We believe in results
 Innovative - All ideas matters
 Inclusive - Everyone is Included and everyone wins
 We work hard and party even harder.



 Qualifications:


 Ideally six sigma certified (yellow belt minimum, green or black belt preferred)
 Background in a sales support environment
 Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets - pivot tables, conditional formatting, vlookups, etc...
 Experience in statistical analysis
 Responsible for putting together reporting framework and business review presentations from a data perspective
 Responsible for managing integrity and accuracy of data sources used regularly to measure bonus/incentives/sales performance
 Has worked in Business Process Outsourcing and is used to a very fast paced environment.
 SQL coding experience
 Familiarity with MS Access



 Responsibilities:


 Preparation of WBR, MBR, QBR data points for all departments including QA, Training, Operations, Administration
 Trendline and correlation analysis to draw insights and projections/forecasts
 Quartile analysis to aid in tactics and strategies employed for performance management
 Standard deviation analysis and root cause analysis to provide ongoing insights to Operations leadership
 Data Dashboard buildout through Google Data Studio
 Creation of data capture mechanisms through Sheets, Forms or Data Studio
 Launch and implementation of new processes to streamline workflows
 Collaboration with BA team Globally to implement new tools and workflows


 Expected start date: 2022-01-31

Title: Observability IT Business Analyst
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.











     About the role
     










Intact Financial Corporation (IFC) is the largest provider of property and casualty (P&C) insurance in Canada and a leading provider of specialty insurance in North America. The IT component of this success is associated with an increasingly complex and innovative technological landscape.
The ability to effectively establish the state of core systems and services, prevent and resolve problems, assess performance and user experience across the IT ecosystem and up to the end user is both challenging and essential. The Observability Center of Excellence plays a leading role in the enablement and achievement of this objective.
As Business Analyst for the OCoE, you’ll actively contribute to the conception, evolution and revision of the Observability governance and associated processes. Moreover, you will play a key role in developing and documenting the Center’s public and private knowledge bases for the benefit of the internal community.
You will collaborate closely with the members of the OCoE, the product owner, the architecture departments, management and the various IT groups and clients.
The ideal candidate will have a comprehensive understanding of IT governance, processes, and familiarity with IT monitoring
Responsibilities:

Analyze, conceive, and modify processes in function of expected results and value
Gather data and analyze the needs and requirements of the business and users
Redact, review and recommend modification to the OCoE’s documentation
Facilitate user onboarding and new process integration through detailed material
Maintain constant alignment and deep understanding of the OCoE’s direction and of the associated ressources

Description:
Position Title: Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations
 Position Type: Temporary - Full-Time 
Position Location: Florenceville Main
 Grade: 00
 Requisition ID: 17288

 
As Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations, you will be responsible for building and maintaining systems to support our environment and resource efficient operations strategy.

 You will support and collaborate with various internal teams within McCain to:

 Develop data integration, visualization and analytics for decision making
 Manage sustainability data with a focus on environmental compliance, CO2 emissions, energy efficiency, water usage and waste
 Manage sustainability data gathered from various business functions and utilize platforms to analyze data to support efficient resource usage, visualization and management


 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Working in close collaboration with global SMEs, the regions and supporting external consultants this person will execute the following tasks:

 Environmental Performance Measures
   
 Maintain and improve data collection systems to track environmental performance
 Develop approaches to replace manual data collection with automated data retrieval processes
 Maintain and improve global greenhouse gas inventory, and support internal and external verification
 Provide environmental performance data as required

 Scope 3 Emissions
   
 Work with agricultural, procurement and supply chain teams to build streamlined data collection processes to be able to efficiently and effectively report on Scope 3 emissions
 Support these teams as they develop carbon reduction roadmaps to ensure that we have the data collection tools in place to effectively measure and report on the improvements

 Life Cycle Analyses
   
 Leverage existing organizational data to develop product level life cycle assessments to provide to customers in support of Scope 3 emissions reporting using Life Cycle Analysis Software such as GaBi

 Environmental Management System
   
 Support the Manager, Global Environment to build an effective environmental management system that provides visibility to risks, incidents and continuous improvement efforts throughout the organization






 Support internal and external audits as required - work with multiple data sources, platforms and software, including SAP, Intelex, OSI PI and Power BI.


 Assist Manager, Resource Efficient Operations and Manager, Global Environment as required
 Additional responsibilities as required

Experience and interest in managing large datasets


 Strong influencing skills and the ability to:


 work with resource constrained internal teams to help them achieve results; and
 work and succeed in a matrixed organization, flexing and modifying approaches as necessary
 Ability to work effectively as part of a multicultural team
 Excellent communication skills in multicultural, multi-lingual environments

 Well organized and structured
 Ability to use initiative, prioritize, multi-task, and work well under pressure to meet deadlines and deliver results


 Technical capabilities in the areas of:


 Strong technical and analytical skills
 Clear and systematic thinking that demonstrates good judgment and problem solving competencies
 Computer programming would be an asset
   
 Structuring data relationships and working with databases
 Understanding of databases, and how to structure data relationships
 Business Analytics software such as Power BI would be advantageous
 Exposure to the concepts of Life Cycle Analysis



 Proven analytical and problem solving skills are required, as well as excellent attention to accuracy and detail
 Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in other languages are an asset

 Collaborates – Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives

Title: Observability IT Business Analyst
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.











     About the role
     










Intact Financial Corporation (IFC) is the largest provider of property and casualty (P&C) insurance in Canada and a leading provider of specialty insurance in North America. The IT component of this success is associated with an increasingly complex and innovative technological landscape.
The ability to effectively establish the state of core systems and services, prevent and resolve problems, assess performance and user experience across the IT ecosystem and up to the end user is both challenging and essential. The Observability Center of Excellence plays a leading role in the enablement and achievement of this objective.
As Business Analyst for the OCoE, you’ll actively contribute to the conception, evolution and revision of the Observability governance and associated processes. Moreover, you will play a key role in developing and documenting the Center’s public and private knowledge bases for the benefit of the internal community.
You will collaborate closely with the members of the OCoE, the product owner, the architecture departments, management and the various IT groups and clients.
The ideal candidate will have a comprehensive understanding of IT governance, processes, and familiarity with IT monitoring
Responsibilities:

Analyze, conceive, and modify processes in function of expected results and value
Gather data and analyze the needs and requirements of the business and users
Redact, review and recommend modification to the OCoE’s documentation
Facilitate user onboarding and new process integration through detailed material
Maintain constant alignment and deep understanding of the OCoE’s direction and of the associated ressources
Be a liaison between with the user community and other departements
Act as a reference on the topics of Observability and associated governance
Ensure the continuous improvement of the OCoE’s processes
Create detailed business analysis outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions for the business
Provide cost analysis and forecasting
Produce extensive reporting
Identify and resolve project issues
Evaluate and address the impacts and implications of changes
Ensure requirements are met, reviewed and validated over the course of initiatives












     Qualifications
     










Qualities:

Excellent oral and written communication skills
Interpersonal and consultative aptitude
Effective facilitation
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Organizational skills
Process modeling
Understanding IT stack, monitoring, observability and SRE

Skills

Solid understanding of high availability principles, system observability and incident management
Aptitude with financial analysis
Understanding IT security considerations
Understanding of key SRE terms: SLA / SLO / SLI, error budget etc.
Demonstrable expertise of Project Management fundamentals
Good knowledge and acumen of IT Technology fundamentals and solutions
Proficiency with collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA Agile, Teams, Yammer, Confluence)
Outstanding communication, presentation and faciliation skills
Excellent organizational and meeting coordination skills
Analytical and synthesizing skills
Ability to create dashboards/reports in tools (PowerBI, Grafana, Jira)
Ability to produce documents that are clear, concise, and well structured
Ability to prioritize activities in the face of competing demands
Experience working across organizational boundaries on a local and global basis
(Asset) Experience with Observability and monitoring solutions (Dynatrace, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Prometheus, InfluxDB, Grafana, Microfocus, …)
(Asset) Experience with JIRA, Confluence and similar tools
(Asset) Good understanding of software and infrastructure architecture
(Asset) Good knowledge of Data & Analytics

Title: Marketing Research Analyst
Description:
Maplesoft Group is currently seeking a Marketing Research Analyst for one of our clients in the National Capital Region.
 
 The following responsibilities are associated with the “Statement Of Work” but are not limited to:
 
 The Marketing Research Analyst service provider will have the following responsibilities:
 


Review and perform quality assurance on research instruments (surveys & interview guides)



Prepare sample lists and upload them into EDC’s customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).



Create and test survey distributions in EDC’s customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).



Program surveys in EDC’s customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).



Test programmed surveys in EDC’s customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).



Code Open end responses: hundreds of verbatim, open-ended comments (non-structured data) from survey responses, code them into themes using Qualtrics and help generate insights



Load customer survey results manually into EDC’s CRM



Create dashboards in EDC’s customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).



Conduct some analysis in SPSS



Put together small reports from SPSS analysis into PowerPoint



Review and perform quality assurance on reports



Participate in meetings

 Specific Project Requirements
 


Possess a minimum of 2 years of experience in marketing research.



Demonstrated experience in statistical methodologies and proven knowledge of the tools and techniques to capture, analyze, and disseminate actionable customer insights.



Experience programming online surveys and manipulating data in a research platform



Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis including; coding open ends into themes, conducting frequencies and crosstabs



Experience using Microsoft Office, MS Excel, and SPSS



Strong attention to detail



Security clearance

 Skills
 
 Top Skills Required:
 


Market research skills, including experience in analyzing quantitative data by coding open ends into themes, conducting frequencies and crosstabs.



Online survey programming skills using a research platform like Qualtrics or Survey Monkey



Ability to prepare & review insights summaries, reports or presentations

 Other Skills Required:
 


Software such as Microsoft office, Excel, and SPSS, research platforms (like Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, etc.)



Good communication skills and attention to detail



Ability to collaborate with other researchers and marketing members



 Assets:
 


Familiarity with customer research platform such Qualtrics Experience Measurement Platform



Familiarity with Agile methodologies



College certificate or degree in marketing research and intelligence




 Maplesoft Group prides itself on its distinct corporate culture and recognizes that success is a direct reflection of our most valuable asset - our people. Therefore, attitude and ambition are key personality traits we seek out, along with skill and aptitude, in potential employees.
 
 Maplesoft Group is committed to having a diverse, representative workforce and continuing to build an inclusive environment. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Maplesoft Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants irrespective of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal peoples or any other legally protected factors.
 
 All employment decisions are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications.
 
 We are committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and a work environment that supports our diverse workforce. Please let us know if you require accommodations at any stage of the recruitment process. We can be reached at Maplesoft Info at info@maplesoftgroup.com.
 
 We thank you for your interest in Maplesoft Group and wish to advise you, that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Why Fraser Health?: 
 
   Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
 


 Effective October 26th, 2021 all staff for all positions across Health Care require full COVID 19 vaccination. All positions, require that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and there are no exceptions.
 


 Position Highlights


   We are currently looking to fill an exciting 
  Full Time position as a 
  Business Analyst at Central City Tower located in 
  Surrey, BC.



 Valued Benefits


   A career with Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to be a part of a dedicated team of professionals in a dynamic and rewarding health care environment. We offer a competitive compensation and benefit package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
 

 We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends and family as a phenomenal place to work! We value diversity in the work force and aim to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.
 


 Find out what it’s like to work here. Like us on Facebook(@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram(@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights!
 

 Detailed Overview: 
 
 Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:


   The Business Analyst provides leadership and support by applying expert knowledge in business intelligence, data analysis, data mining, and performance reporting to provide evidence-based review of service utilization, health interventions, technology assessments and performance analysis. The Business Analyst plans and develops reporting requirements by engaging with healthcare stakeholders across the organization, reviewing clinical, financial, human resource and operational data and by applying knowledge in performance measurement and benchmarking methodologies to develop BI analytical reports.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Collaborates with business units and stakeholders for identifying reporting needs, analyzing current procedures, identifying opportunities, reducing redundancies and ensuring reporting processes support business objectives.
 Works on and/or leads projects to improve dynamic reporting through report automation, and the adoption of emerging analytical methodologies, and BI tools and technologies.
 Develops interactive business intelligence reports and participates in the design, development and testing of performance reporting solutions using PowerBI.
 Conducts performance reporting benchmarking/best practices research and makes recommendations for improvement.
 Develops and seeks continuous improvement of performance reporting processes including developing performance reporting tools used to automate and coordinate report inputs, analyses and distribution.
 Ensures data is effectively gathered, mined and leveraged to support effective decision making in support of corporate strategies and provide quality assurance and a value-added review of reporting inputs to promote high standards for quality and insight.
 Prepares strategic business cases and supporting documents, briefing papers, strategic and tactical reports for an assigned area and/or portfolio for submission to Fraser Health Executive, Board of Directors and other stakeholders.
 Works collaboratively with members of the department, senior management, staff of various organizational units and other internal and external stakeholders in support of the mission, philosophies and goals of Fraser Health.
 Qualifications: 
 
 Education and Experience

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field, plus five (5) to seven (7) years of related experience in decision support, business analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Experience with T-SQL and PowerBI is preferred.
  

Skills and Abilities


 Demonstrates the LEADS capabilities of Leads Self, Engages Others, Achieves Results, Develops Coalitions and supports Systems Transformation.
 

 Professional/Technical Capabilities


 Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the health care system
 Demonstrated ability to analyze clinical, administrative and financial data
 Demonstrated understanding of the relational multidimensional database concepts
 Knowledge of other health care disciplines and their role within healthcare
 Ability to operate related equipment including applicable software applications
 Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently
 Ability to plan, organizer and prioritize work and deadlines
 Working knowledge of healthcare analytics and statistics
 Working knowledge of PDSA, Lean, Six Sigma and other flow process improvement concepts
 Physical ability to perform the duties of the position

Title: EDI business analyst
INVENTORY ANALYST
Description:
About us
Sky Window Technologies specializes in highrise window manufacturing and installation throughout the GTA. We are a dynamic company with exciting opportunities ahead.
ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE RELEVANT EXPERIENCE IN A MANUFACTURING ENVIRONMENT.
REPORTING
As Inventory Analyst you will report directly to the President.
RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Create and distribute PO’s for all materials.
Approach vendors for price savings when appropriate and negotiate with said vendors
Manage the supply chain and plan inventory forecasts for project specific materials for manufacturing (mainly aluminum extrusions)
Coordinate supply chain with production schedule
Act as administrator of our Inventory Management Software
Correct technical issues or data inconsistencies with our Inventory Management Software
Aid employees in their use of our Inventory Management Software
Adjust costs of items as required in inventory system
Add or remove products as required in inventory system
Enter inventory consumption into Inventory Management Software on a daily basis as reported from the Production Department
Receive materials in Inventory Management Software with signed packing slips
Reconcile differences and correct as required.
Track back ordered items and items received in damaged condition for use by our production or service department to complete orders.
Coordinate and enter periodic inventory counts into Inventory Management Software. Investigate discrepancies as required.
Monitor and analyze the inventory levels to ensure orders are placed on time
Export relevant information from Inventory Management Software into Excel models to predict supply side inventory movement
Prepare and analyze excel models and suggest order dates, quantities, frequencies, and verify with other employees
Arrange and participate in periodic inventory counts


Create and provide inventory reports to management as requested
Work with suppliers on the availability of product, production planning and raw material lead times
Build and maintain strong relationships with vendors
Provide recommendations for the development and implementation of supply chain network changes and processes. Make effective decisions independently
Communicate effectively with Plant Manager
Collaborate with others as a part of a team
Review and approve invoices from vendors as required.
Maintain machine maintenance log
Opportunity to become involved in quality control if you have a suitable skill set

QUALIFICATIONS

College Diploma / University Degree / Supply Chain Certificate
Strong knowledge of Excel
5+ years of experience in inventory management
Possess exceptional organizational and problem solving skills
Computer proficiency in word processing and data management programs
Mathematical skills are strongly preferred
Must be comfortable in a warehouse environment
Industrial engineering degree is an asset

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those applicants who are qualified will be contacted.
Only apply if your skill sets are within our set salary range.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $60,000.00-$75,000.00 per year
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:Masks are optional. Ample space in the office to maintain distance.
Application deadline: 2022-06-29Expected start date: 2022-06-27

Title: Data Management Analyst
Description:
Company Overview 
Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home. 

We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters. 
 Department Overview Data Management Analyst - At Motorola Solutions we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems. 
  Job Description 
As a Data Management Analyst, you will collaborate closely with a diverse group of stakeholders including manufacturing, engineering, purchasing, project management and product managers. In this role, the candidate will review, validate and be responsible for assuring all required setups in SAP are done properly in a timer manner across all sites for a successful launch in all sites. 

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to: 

Coordinating cross-functional teams to ensure accurate and timely creation and maintenance of item data in SAP and Agile enterprise systems 
Performing data validation, analyzes, and data mining analysis between PLM, ERP and other systems. Analyzing master data, identifying inconsistencies, recommending and driving the implementation of corrective actions 
Design, construct, modify, integrate, implement and test data models and database management systems 
Supports manufacturing, supply chain, engineering, product management and customer facing teams as needed 
Data integrity support of pre-production builds in manufacturing 
Conduct research and provide advice to others regarding the selection, application and implementation of database management tools 
Review BOM, AML/AVL and change orders in SAP and Agile system ensuring accuracy and effectiveness. 
Research, develop, document, and implement data administration policy, standards and models 
Strong analytical skills for Pre-Load and Post-Load validations and analysis (Use of Microsoft Excel, standard SAP reports and SAP queries) 
Provide master data training to operations employees 
Other duties as identified by Management 


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: 

Strong analytics skills 
Undergraduate degree or certification in a relevant discipline (manufacturing, mechanical or electrical engineering, procurement, inventory management); 
Minimum of two years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment; 
CMII an asset 
Excellent organization, time management, and follow-up skills 
Excellent English communications skills, both written and verbal. 
Self-motivated person who enjoys challenges and working in a fast-paced environment with a daily sense of urgency. Taking initiative to solve problems and deliver results. 
Working knowledge of SAP and Agile within a manufacturing environment is a benefit 
Ability to work in teams, maintaining a high level of communication and interaction. 
Strong business acumen, a passion for structured problem solving 
Understanding of Configuration Management processes 
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, CM tools and Report Generators. 
Experience in SAP Material Management – Material Master, Inventory Management, Purchasing (Purchasing Info-Records, Purchasing Requisitions, Purchasing Orders) 
Understanding of circuit board manufacturing processes and cera like mechanical assembly processes including work order management in ERP 
Excellent understanding of change management processes; 
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools, ERP (SAP preferred), and PLM (Agile preferred) systems. 
Possess strong communications and interpersonal skills while able to work with multiple internal stakeholders to drive positive business results. 

 Basic Requirements 

Undergraduate degree or certification in a relevant discipline (manufacturing, mechanical or electrical engineering, procurement, inventory management); 
Minimum of two years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment;

Title: Sales Operations Analyst
Description:
Our team is expanding...Join us at Citron as a Sales Operations Analyst!
At Citron Hygiene, we know that great companies start with great people.
Citron Hygiene has spent the last 45 years earning the trust of the world’s most prestigious clients, one customer at a time.We provide solutions that encompass washroom and workplace hygiene
products and services to ensure building owners and managers can address their facility’s needs. Our global reach, expanding network of world-class partners, product and service breadth, training, and experience make us a valued partner for companies of all shapes and sizes. Join us and be part of our vision to help create an elevated washroom experience that enhances and preserves business' brand!
Position Overview: 
Reporting to the Head of Sales Enablement, this role is primarily responsible for gathering and analyzing data to improve the effectiveness of the sales organization and communicating the results to management. The incumbent manages large data sets from multiple sources to provide analytical insight into sales performance. This role will develop key performance analytics for the management team, develop new reporting methods and continuously improve existing tools and models which provide additional visibility on sales performance.
Responsibilities: 

Develop and reconcile Salesforce CRM report with the system generated reports.
Measures individual sales rep results and provides insight into performance such as the impact of tenure and performance by country.
Conducts sales performance reporting and analysis at the branch/region/country level and monitors trends highlighting areas for sales focus.
Provides customer contract penetration analysis and contract renewal activity reports,
Conducts profitability analysis at a customer level to ensure desired targets are achieved
Assists with the calculation and processing of the Sales commission process (monthly and quarterly)
Administers and maintains sales data accuracy within the Salesforce (CRM) tool
Updates both sales territory information and account manager books of business in Salesforce Creates ad-hoc reports as required

Qualifications: 

Experience extracting information from Salesforce and building customer Dashboards
Strong analytical combined with innovative problem-solving skillset
Good knowledge transferring skills with an ability to present findings in a logical & relevant format (verbal & written)
Good understanding of object-oriented databases and logical relationships
Strong mathematical and statistical skills (data sets , variance, hypothesis testing)
Expert attention to details and accuracy, able to conduct root-cause investigations
Strong business modelling and information management skills
Hands on and detail oriented and able to work well with multiple priorities
Strong time management and ability to meet deadlines
Results oriented with a sense of urgency
Customer oriented – strives to exceed internal customer expectations
Clear consistent and reliable communicator
Comfortable in a fast-paced dynamic environment

Requirements: 

1- 2 years experience with data analysis and reporting (including sales data, sales performance, commission calculations, pricing etc.)
Good understanding of compensation plans and programs
Pricing analysis experience is a plus
Experience or knowledge in using Salesforce
Advanced level of knowledge in MS Excel, VBA and Access and experience of MS Office Suit, Excel, and Access, PowerPoint
An in-depth understanding of data reporting tools and methods
Education equivalent to a bachelor’s degree in commerce and/or business studies preferred, or the equivalent in related work experience.
Must be legally entitled to work at the specified location/region without requiring any sponsorship
Fully vaccinated

Citron Hygiene welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
To be considered in the final step, successful Citron applicants will be asked to present their proof of full- vaccination status unless there’s an approved religious or medical exemption.
We move fast here at Citron and we aim to give our candidates a pleasant and expedited hiring process!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Additional pay:

Bonus pay

Benefits:

Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care
Wellness program

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

Do you have experience conducting sales performance reporting and analysis at the branch/region/country level and monitoring trends with Salesforce.
Do you have experience with the calculation and processing of the sales commission (monthly and quarterly)

Experience:

Salesforce: 2 years (required)

Title: Business Systems Analyst III
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
 We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
 TD Business Systems Analysis covers a mandate that includes (but isn't limited to) proposing technical systems to accomplish business requirements enterprise-wide. These experts build relationships with business partners and other groups of diverse subject matter experts and stakeholders (both internal and external) to: 

Plan + Elicit + Analyze + Document + Communicate +Manage system requirements;
 Assess client needs and recommend the right technology; and
 Offer operational and process-related analysis and support.

 There's room to grow in all of it.



Job Description

About This Role
 We are looking for someone to provide support and produce detailed system requirements and technical and functional specifications that align with standards and frameworks. You will work in close partnership with our ambitious business and technology partners, project teams and stakeholders to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.
 Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:

 Work with technology partners (e.g. Solution Designers and Architects) to research and analyze current state system capabilities and define technology solutions options and recommendations.
 Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, taking into account non-functional requirements.
 Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
 Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
 Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
 Work closely with stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
 Provide operational and process-related analysis and support.
 Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
 Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services.
 Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements
 Coach new or less experienced colleagues and serve as a reference point throughout requirements management life cycle.




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have: 

Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate.
 3-5 years relevant experience.
 Commitment to applying advanced knowledge of business technology delivery practices and standards, including design, development, testing and project management.
 Sound to advanced knowledge of system analysis process and techniques, as well as system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules.
 Ability to perform work on all aspects of the system analyst process from end-to-end (on projects of moderate to high complexity), under minimal supervision.
 Experience and comfort level acting as a reference for Business Systems Analyst roles. 




Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:

 Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
 Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, 




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

    Business Systems Analysis 
   


Job Category - Primary

    Technology Solutions

Hours

    37.5

    Corporate

    Regular

    Canada

    Ontario 
   


City (Primary)

    Toronto 
   


Work Location

    TD Centre - North - 77 King Street West
