     Our Company
    
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
    
 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   


 The Sales Operations team is responsible for helping define the strategy and operations of a best-in-class sales force for Adobe, and support superior execution by the sales organization. Reporting into the Sales Operations team for DX; you drive sales strategy, analytics, systems and programs that impact the entire Americas business. As a Sales Operations Manager (SOM), you are able think analytically and drive data and insights critical to the business. You would be a trusted business advisor that serves as a critical member of our field organizations, driving operational rigor, go-to-market planning and execution. The ideal candidate will have a background in data & analytics, building complex Excel models and leveraging BI reporting while being able to effectively communicate with executive leaders to inspire change and performance to company targets.
   

     What You'll Do
   

 Work as a key member of the field leadership team, providing timely sales analytics including weekly pipeline analysis, forecasting, and sales results
 Drive business change by developing a keen understanding of the business, identifying core focus areas through data driven insights, and building trust with business partners
 Partner with the field to craft and establish GTM strategy, own the modeling and implementation of sales territories and quota setting
 Actively identify operational issues and design solutions to make business flow better for the sales teams
 Work closely with other SOMs to share knowledge, methodologies and facilitate standardization across the field organization


     What You Need To Succeed
   

 Bachelor's degree in business, finance, data science or related field
 Strong strategy, planning, organizational and multitasking skills; Systems thinker
 Solid mathematical aptitude and ability to turn data into insights & actions
 A problem solver with the ability to identify solutions to complex business issues
 Must be self-managed, responsive and able to work in a virtual team environment
 Advanced Microsoft Office skills required, especially Excel & PowerPoint
 Intellectual curiosity, hands-on mentality, and phenomenal attention to
 detail


     Bonus Points
   

 Internship experience at a B2B software company
 Familiarity with the technology industry including direct-to-consumer and/or business-to-business models
 SQL, MS Analytics, Statistics, or Applied Economics


     At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
   

     If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Title: FP&A Analyst
Description:
Job Advert: 
 
 Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (FP&A Analyst) – Asset Management Division

 (Montreal, Quebec; Toronto, Ontario, New York, NY)
 The Role
 Reporting to the divisional Director of FP&A, this position will support our monthly reporting, annual budget cycle and ad hoc analysis. The role will also support the implementation of system and process improvements focused on data management, reporting standardization, and automation. This position will frequently collaborate with the Finance Business Partnering team, the Accounting team, and Central Finance.
 This is a remote work position however preference will be given to applicants located in Montreal, QC; Toronto, ON & New York , NY)
 Management & Sales Reporting

 Manage comprehensive data sets across different systems to produce periodic reports on financial and operating KPIs
 Ensure reporting is robust, flexible to accommodate changes, and foolproof to minimize errors
 Track changes and transfers within the operating budgets
 Work with Finance Business Partners and FP&A Managers to monitor, analyze, and explain results against budget or forecast
 Manage sales data for monthly reports and commission calculations
 Support ad-hoc reporting requests from within the Division, or from Central Finance

 Financial Planning and Strategy

 Support the Divisional monthly reforecasting process and the annual budget process 
Maintain files/systems that drive forecasting and commissions
 Contribute to system implementations (Finance and BI/MI systems), improvements, and integrations
 Assist the Business Partners in measuring department performance on a team/individual level
 Work with Accounting to ensure complex accounting judgements are correctly reflected in planning assumptions 

Requirements

 A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in analytical and/or reporting roles in finance/accounting
 University degree in Finance or Accounting
 CPA or Finance designation an asset


 
Your Behavioral Competencies


 Superior attention to detail and accuracy
 Concern for order and quality, and process
 Proactive with strong work ethic
 Ability to multitask, collaborate, and communicate effectively with colleagues to build structure in an ambiguous environment
 Creative and relentless prioritization mindset to constantly reduce manual processes

 Knowledge & Skills

 Synthesize large amounts of disparate data into insightful reports 
Ability to identify data/reporting risk and integrate strong controls and mitigating checks
 Advanced ability working withing Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and the full Microsoft Suite
 Adaptive/Anaplan, Netsuite, Tableau/PowerBI, and/or Xactly experience is a big plus
 Specific knowledge of and interest in financial markets would be an asset

 About Euromoney Institutional Investor


 Euromoney is a global B2B information-services business. We provide actionable data, analysis, intelligence, and access through three divisions (Financial & Professional Services, Fastmarkets, and Asset Management) in markets where information and convening participants is valued. 
We have customers in more than 160 countries and over 2,500 employees located in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. 

Our purpose is to provide clarity in opaque markets to help our customers compete successfully.
 Our goal is to be a fast-growing, high-margin, 3.0 information-services subscription business.
 Our customers are financial institutions, those involved in the extraction, trading and use of commodities, professional and technology service providers, and corporations.
 Our people are creative, action-oriented, close to their customers, passionate about their brands and knowledgeable about the industries they serve.

 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC (www.euromoneyplc.com) is listed on the London Stock Exchange and is a member of the FTSE 250 share index. 



About the Division
 The Asset Management segment includes our brands and businesses that serve the global asset management industry; BCA Research, Ned Davis Research and Institutional Investor. This segment provides independent research that enables our clients to make informed investment decisions; runs networks and conferences that bring asset allocators and asset managers together in an effective and efficient way; and provides editorial content and data that are critical for the industry to stay informed and make deals.


 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Evidence Management Analyst (10-month contract)
Description:
Our organization:

  The Alberta Securities Commission is the industry-funded regulator responsible for administering the province's securities laws. It is entrusted with fostering a fair and efficient capital market in Alberta and with protecting investors. As a member of the Canadian Securities Administrators, the ASC works to improve, coordinate and harmonize the regulation of Canada's capital markets.
  
 The Enforcement division enforces Alberta securities laws by investigating and prosecuting breaches of those laws to prevent and stop current and future misconduct. The Evidence Management team helps ensure that information and evidence are properly managed throughout the investigation and litigation process.
 
The opportunity:

  Reporting to the Manager, Evidence & Legal Technology, this position will provide expertise in tracking, processing, digital analysis, categorizing and disclosure of evidence through the course of investigations and litigation.
 
Key responsibilities include:

  Managing the processing of investigative information (digital, paper-based and other physical format) throughout the case lifecycle.
   Meeting with investigators and litigators to discuss, strategize, train and assist with:
   Secure and defensible evidence collection
   Appropriate evidence handling and tracking processes
   Early case assessment, culling, evidence categorization and quarantining
   Data analytics and technology assisted review
   Database management
   Disclosure and hearing documentation
   Training and assisting with the categorizing and tagging of documents for disclosure (and non-disclosure).
   Preparing documents for disclosure in a context-appropriate format and in accordance with governing rules or panel directions.
   Organizing and preparing documents for hearings and/or trials as appropriate for the type of case, hearing forum and format needed (digital or physical).
   Establishing and documenting work flows to support efficient document reviews.
   Tracking and overseeing the movement of original evidence (paper and electronic) in and out of the Evidence Room.
   Liaising with law firms and others in regard to database and document issues.
   Providing technical and functional support and training on evidence tracking, document management, database searching, review, tagging and disclosure.
   Assisting with document scanning, electronic discovery processing and software.
   Assisting the Office of the General Counsel and Records and Information Management staff as necessary to prepare documentary responses to Enforcement-related FOIP requests and criminal or court production orders. 
   In collaboration with colleagues, reviewing and enhancing procedures, systems and software.
 
The ideal candidate will possess:

  A Legal Assistant certificate or diploma, or equivalent education or experience. 
   Five or more years of litigation support or records management experience, preferably working in a legal or regulatory environment. 
   Five or more years of experience working with electronic litigation support databases, e-discovery software, or comparable information management systems.
   Strong problem-solving, time-management, task prioritization and communication skills.
   Strength in documenting and providing training on processes and best practices.
   The ability to work well as part of a team.
   Excellent attention to detail and the ability to follow precise written and verbal instructions.
   Working knowledge of e-discovery and other search software and databases.
   Experience using Technology Assisted Review and/or other automated document analysis tools.
   Experience in privilege and relevance review is preferred.
 
To apply:

  Click the Apply For This Job button to submit your resume, cover letter and salary expectations by July 8, 2022.

Title: Senior Analyst, Ask GPS
Description:
Requisition ID: 155195  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Reporting to the Manager, Ask Global Procurement Services (GPS) the Senior Analyst will contribute to the overall success of Global Procurement Services department serving the global enterprise ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. They ensure all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

 Accountabilities:


 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
 Applies knowledge of procurement best practice and general business practice to respond to inquiries related to Procurement Policy and Procedures, and other related policies.
 Provides frontline support for all complex user requests and issues related to Procurement Technology (Icertis, SmartBuy, etc.).
 Operates the Bank’s issue ticket management system to log, review and resolve complex Level 1 and 2 support issues related to Procurement Technology.
 Provides guidance and training to users as required. Interacts with employees and suppliers for P2P platform onboarding, catalog set-up & maintenance, training and support for sourcing events, payment inquiry, and initial purchase order issuance.
 Reviews, recommends for approval, and follows Standard Operating Procedures documentation to ensure data quality and consistent delivery of service according to established Operating Level Agreements (OLAs).
 Reviews, recommends for approval, and follows prepared Problem Resolution Procedure (PRP) documentation to resolve common problems.
 Escalates issues to Manager, suppliers, or other internal stakeholders and tracks to resolution.
 Prepares reports that monitors operational KPIs and recommends process improvements
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
 Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
 Assist in the training and on-boarding of new team members.
 Analyze root cause issues from service desk operations and propose solutions.
 Contribute and lead or assist in cross-functional initiatives


 Education and Experience:


 College Diploma or University Degree in related field
 3+ years of project management, business administration, business analysis, data analysis, business process improvement, and/or business help desk, operations experience
 Spanish is an asset

Title: Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics
Description:
Requisition ID: 143018  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is and we continue to evolve on what it can be, using technology to create innovative, forward thinking banking solutions with our clients’ needs in mind.
 We are made up of high performing, curious, energetic and collaborative individuals who thrive in our high trust agile environment to deliver best in class solutions for our customers. We believe in giving people hands-on challenges and the responsibilities that come with them, allowing them to grow, evolve and create opportunities to build their career.
 Are you ready to make the change and become part of an established disruptor with the backing of a highly engaged team? If so come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 Department Summary:

 The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.

 Role Purpose:

 The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics reports to the Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics. The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics is responsible for defining, investigating, and developing solutions to support the systems used in the Tangerine FIU (including but not limited to the Transaction Monitoring, Name Screening and Case Management systems). Additionally, the role will be leading and participating in initiatives to identify and action opportunities for local improvements to productivity, decision effectiveness, and the user experience.
 The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with IT, Business Intelligence, AML Operations/FIU, and the Tangerine AML to ensure successful delivery of objectives.

 Role Accountabilities:
 Responsibilities to support strategic and tactical deliverables


 Support the ongoing and periodic evaluation of existing and new FIU Systems tools and solutions to address changing business needs and emerging threats.
 Perform ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions.
 Perform the monitoring and maintenance of FIU strategies to address evolving trends.
 Institute and manage a disciplined change process for regular testing and deployment of FIU rules.
 Perform analytics and reporting to generate an accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and volume.
 Drive robust processes to enhance FIU Systems performance.
 Maintain thorough understanding of FIU Systems capabilities, gaps and opportunities.
 Provide analytic support in the development and implementation of FIU strategic plans.
 Ensure accuracy and effectiveness of FIU systems and drive periodic enhancements as needed.
 Execute a variety of technical testing including Business Acceptance Testing and User Acceptance Testing
 Assist the team in proposing, creating and presenting communications to management, stakeholders, and other departments on changes introduced as a result of new initiatives
 Maintain a thorough understanding of AML/ATF and sanctions system capabilities, gaps and opportunities
 Other duties as assigned


 Tangerine FIU Project Responsibilities:


 Support the Manager, FIU Strategy and Analytics to manage requirements-related activities and deliverables throughout the project life cycle (e.g. change requests, issues, risks, schedules, status reporting etc.)
 Conduct data mining and analyses to generate insights and intelligence to support initiatives and commitments
 Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and workflow analysis
 Write requirements / specifications using standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely
 Assist in the development of Test Plans and documentation to support testing
 Identify, anticipate, assess, manage and resolve issues and risks related to requirements' activities and deliverables
 Assess project issues and identify solutions to meet productivity, quality and goals
 Participate in regular status meetings with all stakeholders, to review project deliverables and deadlines, keeping the stakeholder’s needs and requirements continuously in view
 Produce high quality artifacts through effective business analysis, process mapping, and requirements generation


 Minimum Qualifications:

 Education/Experience

 University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
 Minimum 3-5 years of work-related experience within the Financial Services industry
 Minimum 2-year experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
 Experience in consumer banking products (credit, deposit and cards)

 Professional Certification

 ACAMs certification is considered an asset
 International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) certification is considered an asset

 Specialized Knowledge

 Knowledge of Compliance and AML/ATF systems and troubleshooting experience


 Technical Skills

 Strong and proven analytical skills
 Strong working knowledge of data mining tools
 Strong working knowledge of programing languages (Visual Basic, SQL)
 Strong technical solution management experience and skills
 Demonstrated experience using the MS Office Suite, in particular MS- Excel, MS- Word and MS-Visio
 Strong business analysis skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
 Experience with statistical modeling and data science methods
 Experience in business intelligence and analytics platforms 

Abilities

 Ability to work autonomously under tight timelines
 Ability to work in a dynamic environment where processes and procedures are consistently refined
 Strong presentation, facilitation, analysis and problem solving skills
 Strong capability to work with senior business leaders
 Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously 

Attributes

 Strong verbal, written and communication skills
 Strong attention to detail and organizational skills


 Working Conditions:
 The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
By joining Mitsubishi HC Capital Canada, you will be part of an exceptional team offering flexible and adaptative commercial Equipment Financing solutions to Canadian businesses. Whether it’s leasing, factoring, inventory finance or asset-based lending, our teams are dedicated to offer the best service to our customers.
 Collaboration, empowerment, open-mindedness and a respectful work environment are at the very heart of our day-to-day activities. This is key to our success!
 With a specialized team for sustainable development and a committee focusing on giving back to the community, we strive to make a difference in societal improvement.
 Join us as IT Business Analyst specialized in process optimization and corporate functions and become a part of Mitsubishi HC Capital Canada’s success story.
 About IT Business Analyst:
 As part of the Information Technology team, you will be responsible for enhancing the quality of IT products and services, analyzing data to inform business decisions, and finding technological solutions to business needs, among other duties.
 Your main responsibilities will be:

 Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
 Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies as well as conducting insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
 Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems
 Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports
 Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
 Working with management to prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements as well as with IT management to allocate resources and maintain cost efficiency
 Effectively communicating your insights, plans and results to cross-functional team members and management
 Monitoring deliverable, ensuring timely completion of projects and ensuring solutions meet business needs
 Ensuring procedures are updated, implemented and maintained

 The profile we are looking for:

 A minimum of 8 years of experience in business analysis or a related field
   
 Experience with origination and financial systems, ideally within the Commercial/Business Financing & Leasing industry
 Experience in business process optimization and improvement initiatives and projects

 A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or and MBA
 Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, including facilitation, presentation, and documentation.
 Ability to adapt quickly in a rapidly changing dynamic environment
 Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills

 What we have to offer:

 Full time position
   
 37.5-hour work-week, Monday to Friday

 Hybrid work environment (working from home and the office) with options to work from offices in:
   
 Burlington/Toronto, Ontario
 Calgary, Alberta
 Montréal, Québec

 Compensation plan including bonus based on your individual performance as well as the Company’s results
 Competitive benefits package including:
   
 Vacation, sick and personal days given on day one
 Collective insurance including long-term disability, life insurance, medical, dental and vision care as well as virtual healthcare
 RRSP
 Range of wellness initiatives including Employee and Family Assistance Program and virtual health and development platforms

 Professional growth opportunities through our internal postings and online learning platform

 Don’t think this position is a great fit for you, but still want to join us? Click here: https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=b3ef4f03-f8ff-4ded-80c8-6dd5c5a224f7&ccId=9200144510729_2&lang=en_CA
 We would like to thank all applicants in advance. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be contacted directly. Mitsubishi HC Capital Canada values diversity and is committed to accessibility. Should you require accommodation due to disability, please notify the Human Resources Recruiter.
 The use of the masculine is a default reference and includes all potential applicants.

Title: Business Analyst - Procurement
Description:
Job Posting

6436BR Business Analyst - Procurement Intern


Come start your career here!

 Our Internship program offers paid 18-month internships for new grads interested in a career in municipal public service. The program provides training, development, and on-the-job experience for candidates that have graduated within the last 24 months.
    
 We are inviting applications for the 18-month term position of 
    Business Analyst- Intern in Procurement, Finance and Asset Management.
    
 The Intern Program is designed to provide experiential learning and maximum professional exposure to interns in their chosen field of study while exploring the benefits of working for the municipality. Over the course of the internship, candidates will learn about government policy, operations, administration, services, and planning in a collaborative and supportive environment. Interns make a difference in our community and organization!
    
 Halifax Regional Municipality (HRM) is committed to reflecting the community it serves and recognizing Diversity and Inclusion as one of the Municipality’s core values. We have an Employment Equity Policy and we welcome applications from African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Women in occupations or positions where they are underrepresented in the workforce, Indigenous/Aboriginal People, Persons with Disabilities and 2SLGBTQ+ Persons. Applicants are encouraged to self-identify on their electronic application.
    
 Under the direction of the Inventory Management Team Lead and Procurement Practices Consultant. With a focus on performance excellence, the Business Analyst-Procurement provides expert advice and support in the operation of Procurement. Halifax Regional Municipality has a municipal budget of $1.1 billion – including $925.7 million in municipal expenditures and $180.2 million in provincial mandatory contributions – as well as a capital plan of $318.9 million for the 2022-23 fiscal year. Inventory Management, a department within Procurement, is responsible for $5M of stocked inventory holdings at six storeroom locations, distributing $16M annually; purchasing non-stocked vehicle parts valued at $1.5M annually; salt and fuel inventories, and quoting materials for standing offers.
    
 The Business Analyst-Procurement leads service improvement initiatives and is responsible for the implementation of re-engineering initiatives that result in quantifiable business improvements. The Business Analyst-Procurement will baseline all current processes and develop strategies for eliminating inefficient processes and improving customer service. The Business Analyst-Procurement will develop robust internal processes that will lead to improvements in staff workloads and resource usage.
    

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Research and Benchmarking

 Collect and analyse data and develop data collection protocols for tracking and compiling data.
 Research best practices in both private and public sectors.
 Conduct meetings with management, staff, vendors, and internal service providers to identify opportunities (business improvements, or technology) that align with business strategy.

 Procedure Development
 Develop new and expand on existing process maps and/or work instructions with respect to:
    
 Procurement processes
 Inventory management processes
 Identify and implement best practice.

 Improvement

 Consult with HRM’s Information and Technology (IT) division as required to develop improvements including the movement of multiple data source Excel reports to an automated software reporting process.
 Leverage available IT resources to maximize operational effectiveness.
 Provide options for operational improvement, by way of identifying increased service and/or potential savings.


 QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience:

 University degree in business administration, public administration, Industrial Engineering, or Computer Science required.
 Excellent proficiencies in current versions MS Office; advanced skills in Excel and experience in Business Intelligence Tools are required.
 Project Management and Lean Six Sigma education or certification considered an asset
 Education and experience associated with analytical thinking, problem solving and multi-tasking.
 To be eligible for the internship, candidates must have graduated within the last 24 months or be confirmed to graduate in June 2022 from a recognized or legally authorized university or community college.
 Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada at time of application and maintain this status for the duration of 18-month term.
 We value non-traditional experience and candidates are encouraged to outline in their application any student leadership, volunteering, extra-curricular, or community-based experience they possess.
 Preference will be given to those candidates who have demonstrated an interest in public policy or government administration


 Technical / Job Specific Knowledge and Abilities:

 Strong analytical aptitude
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Experience with the following business systems: SAP (or other ERP system), Asset Works (or another asset management system) is considered an asset.
 Experience with Power BI is preferred


 Security Clearance Requirements: Applicants may be required to complete an employment security screening check. You will be provided with more specific information during the recruitment process.
    

COMPETENCIES: Analytical Thinking; Communications; Organization and Planning; Organizational Awareness; Valuing Diversity
    

WORK STATUS: Term 18 months, NON-UNION
    
HOURS OF WORK: Monday-Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 35 hours per week
    
SALARY: $50,000 per year
    
WORK LOCATION: 40 Alderney Drive, Dartmouth, NS
    
CLOSING DATE: Applications will be received up to 11:59 pm on July 3, 2022
    

Please note: We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
    
 During the recruitment process, applicants have the right to request an accommodation. Applicants invited to participate in an assessment process (such as an interview or testing) and who require accommodation, should discuss their needs with the Recruiter when invited to the assessment process.
    
 HRM takes the health and safety of its job applicants and employees seriously. All recruitment activities are being conducted in adherence with current Covid-19 Public Health protocols.
   



Job Category

    Project Management & Business Analysis

Title: Business Unit Analyst
Description:
Posting Period
From June 17, 2022 to July 08, 2022


Country or region
Canada


Location

Montréal, Québec 



Business Unit
Plant Care


Department
Accounting / Finance


Entry date
As soon as possible 


Job Status
Permanent - Full time 


Minimal required work experience
1 to 3 years 


Minimal education level required
Bachelor's Degree 


Salary
Based on experience 


Benefits
Competitive social benefits 






Business Unit Analyst
Main Functions
 Reporting to the Business Unit Controller, your main responsibilities will include operations, accounting and reporting. You will assist the Business Unit Controller in the day-to-day accounting & operations activities, results analysis, budgets and preparation of ad-hoc documents / ad-hoc projects. With many innovative new product launches and strong business unit growth expected over the next few years; this will truly be an exciting and rewarding opportunity for a finance professional who is passionate and wants to learn in an international environment!
 At Lallemand Plant Care, we encourage autonomy, innovation, collaboration; routine is not part of our vocabulary! As we grow, we offer career and professional development opportunities locally and internationally. If you are looking for a challenging job where your opinion is valued and you feel you can make a difference, both in your work and to the environment and society, you have come to the right place.
 Tasks associated with this position also include, but may not be limited to:

Developing and automating standardized reports (Example, P&L report by sales representative, cost reports, production variances).
Analysis of trends and results pertaining to sales, operations, SG&A expenses, customers, products, financial ratios;
Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports & dashboards.
Inventory and Plant variances reconciliation and analysis.
Assisting accounting tasks and support for the different entities within the business unit, accounting questions, audit process and governance file.
Special assignments and projects as the business grows and evolves.

Technical skills
 Required

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, finance or other related field.
1-2 years of experience with Data Analysis/Finance/Accounting.
Experience with cost accounting, standard costs and production variances analysis.
Advanced MS Excel knowledge.

An asset

Knowledge of IBM Cognos BI & Power BI.
Experience in project accounting.
Experience with a multi-currency and inter-company/inter-division transactions.

Personal abilities

Good team player.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Knowledge of French, Spanish, Portuguese, German is an asset.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and have good problem-solving skills.
Strong analytical skills, organized and reliable; able to juggle multiple streams of work, keep things on track and consistently meet deadlines for processing work, with a strong attention to detail.
Self-aware, reflective, and able to learn from mistakes. Shows an ability to learn quickly while on the job.
Not afraid to speak up and make suggestions for areas for improvement.
Desire to learn continuously.

General criteria
 Required

Valid passport.

Other

Travel: Occasionally (10% of the time per year).
Excellent work ethic.
Honest.

Organization
 Lallemand is a privately held Canadian company founded in the late 19th century, which develops, produces, and markets microorganisms for various markets. The administrative offices of the parent company are in Montreal, Canada. Today, Lallemand employs more than 4,500 people working in more than 45 countries on 5 continents.
 Yeasts, bacteria, fungi: microorganisms have always lived in harmony with plants since their origin and are now recognized for their multiple agronomic benefits. As a world specialist in microorganisms, Lallemand Plant Care carefully selects strains for agricultural use, to improve the nutrition, health, and productivity of plants.
 Lallemand Plant Care is a growing business unit and offers many opportunities for career development and professional development on a local and international scale. Joining the Lallemand Plant Care team means collaborating with people who work passionately to develop sustainable, efficient, and clean solutions for agriculture professionals, horticulture, green spaces, and the forestry sector. We regularly recruit new talent from around the world to support our growth and our sales, logistics, marketing, production and research and development efforts.
 Please take note that accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Science
Description:
Description 

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

 Air Canada Customer Data Intelligence team is looking for a Senior Analyst that will help discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data and help Air Canada make smarter decisions. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, building high quality prediction systems integrated with the business needs and implementing the outcome in the current business processes. 
 

KEY FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Work closely with the branch departments to understand their Data and Analytics needs and prioritize the requirements 
 Establish a strong relationship with relevant stakeholders to better understand their needs 
 Familiarize and master the database/Management information/IT tools used at Air Canada 
 Actively participate in strategic projects/initiatives that require in depth analysis of data 
 Play a part in shaping the business's data infrastructure, inclusive of data-warehousing, reporting, and analytics platforms. 
 Identifies, communicates, and endeavors to resolve data gaps that impact the fulfillment of the business's functional requirements 
 Build and operationalize processes that ensure timely data processing and maintain accuracy and relevance of data used within the branch 
 Work in a multi-disciplinary environment with specialists in machine learning, data engineering and design and provide acquired expertise in these areas 
 Develop the appropriate ML models to address the business questions using the appropriate tools and models 

Qualifications 

 Undergrad degree required in a relevant field. M.Sc. preferred. 
 5+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical modelling, and machine learning techniques. 
 Expert SQL skills and/or Python. PySparks experience a plus. 
 Experience with Azure, Snowflake and Databricks an asset. 
 Very strong analytical skills, able to handle and manage large amounts of data to synthesize into decision variables. 
 Able to establish and maintain effective relationships throughout the organization. 
 Attention to details, excellent analytical, problem-solving, and trouble-shooting skills. 
 Responds resourcefully and shows nimbleness when faced with new challenges and demands. 
 Team player, who can work in an autonomous setting. 
 Proven organizational and planning skills. 


Conditions of Employment:

 Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position. 
 Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required 


Linguistic Requirements

 Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates. 
 

Diversity and Inclusion

 Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success. 
 
 As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.
 

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Are you excited about the prospect of joining a startup organization on the ground floor? Interested in being a part of the changing skies in Canada and beyond? Want to work with world-class leaders who have extensive industry know-how? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! 
We are seeking a Pricing Analyst for our Commercial division to join our rapidly expanding, dynamic team!
 WHO WE ARE:
 Lynx Air is Canada’s newest ultra-affordable airline, on a mission to make air travel accessible for all. With airfare sky-high in Canada, we give value-seeking travellers an affordable, safe and customer-first flying experience.
 Lynx has taken to the skies, piloting our brand-new fleet of Boeing 737 MAX planes to select Canadian destinations. Our mission is to bring safe, affordable, low-cost air travel to millions of Canadians and we are excited to be building our team that will help us get there!
 Backed by significant financial investment from a group of prominent Canadian and American investors, we are poised to change the Canadian airline landscape. Combining the financial strength of our talented partners with the skills and energy of Canadians like you, we can bring the best practices of the aviation industry to Canada!
 WHAT THE ROLE ENTAILS:
 Reporting to the Revenue Manager, the Pricing Analyst is responsible for the development of short and long-term pricing strategies for fares and ancillary products for the airline. You will be developing competitive, revenue-optimizing strategies for the airlines’ fares and ancillary products across the entire network, including bags, seats, fees, product bundles, etc. as well as management of the revenue forecast and ancillary revenue and pricing systems.
 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:

 Develop competitive fare and ancillary revenue initiatives and programs to maximize revenue and provide industry-leading product solutions
 Analyzes demand and customer behavior related to fares and ancillary products and implements pricing strategies
 Manage and administer the process of implementing fare filings in ATPCO
 Reviews reports of market historical performance and advance booking information to isolate areas of need and opportunity
 Examines changes in market conditions such as new competition, merchandising platforms, and selling dynamics to develop appropriate responses to ancillary programs
 Oversight of tactical and strategic pricing actions and monitors and reacts to competitive pricing actions
 Analyzing booking patterns using data analysis, modeling research optimization, and other optimization parameters, identifying trends, outliers, and/or additional revenue opportunities in constantly evolving market conditions
 Implements business processes and revenue improvements by creating procedures for measurement, upkeep, and revision of priced products
 Tracks ancillary performance and reports revenue trends to senior management
 Coordinates cross-department planning and execution for ancillary revenue fees, product pricing, and policies with key stakeholders 
Works to continually improve the customer experience in shopping/purchasing for ancillary products 
Constantly monitors competitor websites for fares and other competitive programs

 A high degree of motivation, commitment, and adaptability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, changing environment
 Experience with Airline Pricing and Revenue Management tools (ATPCO, PROS, etc) is considered a strong asset
 Presentation skills and solutions design delivery, translating ideas into reality
 High proficiency in Excel as well as knowledge of all other MS office suite products

 Industry competitive salary 
The chance to be part of building something from the ground up. Aggressive growth plans of the organization mean there is no limit to how far you can grow your career with the organization
 An environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance
 Open and collaborative work environment. You bring your great ideas, and we will put them to action 
Comprehensive benefits and HSA

Title: ServiceNow Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Who we are
 

   Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.
 

   We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.
 

   Connect. Impact. Grow. Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.
 

 What you'll do
  
 Leads the design of technology solutions by collecting and/or analyzing business requirements, working with developers and users to design and document functional solutions. Creates and maintains platform and project artifacts including solution documents, user interface designs and wireframes, data mapping, user and system workflows, reporting, etc.
  
 Uses subject matter expertise on the platform to provide support and consultation for end users, business and project teams
  
 Provides project management for various projects and change requests
 

   What you bring
 

Work with business groups to elicit, and review requirements.
Analyze and translate the business requirements into functional requirements for the platform, always keeping in mind the optimal user experience.
Support the day-to-day portal platforms support team where required.
Effectively communicate the designed changes to both business and technical groups to ensure a common understanding. This requires working directly with QA and software development teams to ensure what is developed and tested meets the business requirements, and working with the business groups to present how the solution fulfills their needs.
Viewed as a subject matter expert for the platform, provide input into the feasibility and reasonability for the requested changes. Analyze the changes and provide viable options to accomplish the change.



   Must-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
 

Bachelor's degree required; or equivalent work experience
Minimum 5 years of experience working as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience working with web based applications
Proficient in reviewing, analyzing, writing, and maintaining documentation
Experience leading small to medium scale projects


   Nice-to-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
 



     Proficiency in payment systems and the merchant acquiring business is an asset
   



   What you get
 



     The chance to be part of one of Canada’s top employers and leader in FinTech
   


     Competitive pay and annual bonus program based on individual performance and productivity
   


     Emphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a few
   


     RRSP matching & defined contribution pension plan
   


     Flexible benefits package starting from day 1
   


     Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model - including a tech peripheral rebate!
   


     Extensive learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning and Udemy courses!
   


     Lots of opportunities to advance your career – 30% of Moneris' roles are filled internally
   


     EAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition Program
   


     Employee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors!
   


     Get involved in one or many of our Moneris Committees and Employee Resource Groups - Inclusive Workplace Council (IWC), Black Employee Network, just to name a few
   


 Who you'll work with
 

   Our Technology team's goal is to connect ideas and technology to create solutions that shape the way people pay. Connection is in our DNA, and we are a team enabling our merchants, business partners, and each other with the tools we need to thrive. We're a team of over 400+ people, broken into six functions, who oversee all technology aspects at Moneris, including software, infrastructure engineering, cyber security, data analytics, and project management.
 


 Learn more about how Moneris is striving to be at the forefront of Fintech!
  



   Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

Title: Business Analyst - Capital Markets
Description:
Dawn InfoTek Inc. is a professional IT consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. We have been dedicated in delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of IT positions for our clients.
We are currently seeking competent individuals to fill the role of Business Analyst on our dynamic team for our client, one of the big five banks
Contract Duration: 6 monthsExtension: PossibleFTE: Possible
Typical Day in Role: 

Research, formulate, and perform data-driven analytics using SQL and/or other tools such as Elastic Search, Postman, and Kibana.
Regular deliverables include creation of source to target mapping
Assist in resolving complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the system needs of the Institutional Equity Trading Desks and their internal and external customers, by applying your business and technological knowledge to perform analysis, reconciliations, defining user requirements, design and implementation of system enhancements/solutions.
Support, liaison, and gather requirements from senior stakeholders and clearly articulate business requirements to technical teams.
Building relationships with vendors to allow for regular communication for needs and adequate time to implement changes
Working with technology and business partners and stakeholders to do data mapping, data analysis, order and trade data mapping from federated systems (TT and Tradebook data is being mapped into a consolidated data model).
Test, validate, and deploy solution to production environment
Create artifacts required for deployments
Working with data platform team and connect with other teams from data governance, etc. to deploy solution from one environment to another.
Work with raw data from developers to reroute data to different topics (understanding of NiFi is required)
Working primarily with institutional equities
Analysis of business needs (trading, regulatory, etc.) resulting in the creation of requirement
Build relationships and work with key stakeholders to quickly deliver value added solutions.
Produce conceptual interface designs through iterative wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, conceptual diagrams and provide detailed specifications to the development team
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, perform under pressure, and change priorities as needed.

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills: 

5+ years’ experience in a relevant capacity as a technical BA
2+ years’ experience within capital markets data (trade lifecycle, securities, doing reconciliations, vendor management, equities post-trade processes, institutional equities, etc)

o in-depth knowledge of Capital Markets data analysis, data mapping, data publication/consumption and business

Understanding of how FIX Protocols work, professional experience in this realm
Strong data driven analysis knowledge, ability to write SQL queries
Seeking candidate with strong hands-on experience in at least two of the following (in order of preference): Kafka, NiFi, Elastic Search, and/or Kibana
SDLC, data/business analysis experience
Documentation skills (ability to produce conceptual interface designs through iterative wireframes, mock-ups, user flows, conceptual diagrams and provide detailed specifications to the development team)

Nice-To-Have Skills: 

Experience with other ETL tools to understand how flows work
Ability to work with third-party APIs, Postman, and other API/data tools.
Knowledge/experience with reporting tools/platforms such as Business Objects, Power BI, Excel Macros/Pivots, and other similar tools.
Hadoop/Big Data experience to analyze and help develop solutions
Vendor application and federated trading platforms experience with products such as Duco, Fidessa, Bloomberg, etc
Prior experience with Jira, Confluence, and ServiceNow.

Soft Skills: 

Great communication (verbal and written) required
Ability to prioritize, produce plans, and deliver on deadlines

Best vs Average: Ideal candidate would have in-depth data driven analysis experience and ability to communicate with stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. A candidate with previous Scotia experience within capital markets or middle office reconciliation experience would be able to adapt to the role quickest. Experience with the full lifecycle is useful (front/middle/back office). Understanding of stream processing is required to adapt to this role.
Degrees or certifications: 

Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
Financial education (relevant courses, CSC, CFA…) will be considered as an asset.

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $80.00-$105.00 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

     Our Company
    
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
    
 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   


 The Sales Operations team is responsible for helping define the strategy and operations of a best-in-class sales force for Adobe, and support superior execution by the sales organization. Reporting into the Sales Operations team for DX; you drive sales strategy, analytics, systems and programs that impact the entire Americas business. As a Sales Operations Manager (SOM), you are able think analytically and drive data and insights critical to the business. You would be a trusted business advisor that serves as a critical member of our field organizations, driving operational rigor, go-to-market planning and execution. The ideal candidate will have a background in data & analytics, building complex Excel models and leveraging BI reporting while being able to effectively communicate with executive leaders to inspire change and performance to company targets.

 Work as a key member of the field leadership team, providing timely sales analytics including weekly pipeline analysis, forecasting, and sales results
 Drive business change by developing a keen understanding of the business, identifying core focus areas through data driven insights, and building trust with business partners
 Partner with the field to craft and establish GTM strategy, own the modeling and implementation of sales territories and quota setting

 detail

 SQL, MS Analytics, Statistics, or Applied Economics


     At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.
   

     If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Title: Analyst, Commercial Real Estate
Description:
Job Category: 
Commercial Property Valuation 
 
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is currently seeking a candidate in the position of an Analyst based out of our Calgary, Alberta office to join our Research, Valuation, and Advisory division. The selected individual will work within a dynamic team gaining experience in (but not limited to) land valuation, appraisal methods, building inspections, and data analysis. 

The Analyst will be responsible for the collection, analysis and organization of industrial to commercial real estate data, which is to be used for property assessment and valuation consulting services. In addition, the role will work closely with senior staff providing research and consulting support for key assignments. 

Key Responsibilities: 

Prepare accurate analysis or portions of appraisal reports using the latest market information obtained from various internal / external partners. Extensive senior co‐worker review is anticipated 
Develop cash flow projections to be used in the appraisal process, using industry standard software such as Excel, Argus DCF, Argus Enterprise, Argus Developer or other appropriate software. Extensive senior co‐worker review is anticipated 
Conduct research and collect data from both internal database and third party sources with respect to market rental rates, comparable building transactions and general market knowledge 
Ensure data collected as part of on‐going assignments is entered accurately into the company database in a timely fashion 
Conduct market surveys and research by calling various market participants (e.g. brokers, developers, property managers, leasing agents, municipalities, City Planners, etc.) 
In partnership with the Sr. Analyst, Consultant, Sr. Consultant, Associate Director, Director, or Sr. Director, perform building inspections 
Continuously upgrade the level of knowledge regarding market and industry trends 
Accurately complete time sheets on a daily basis ensuring non billable time and recoverable expenses are clearly outlined 
Become a Candidate with the Appraisal Institute of Canada. Maintain Candidate status by completing requirements outline by the AIC, e.g. completing minimum of one (1) of the required courses towards designation per year 


Position Requirements: 

University degree, preferably in Commerce, Economics, or Finance or related experience in commercial appraisal/real estate valuation 
Excellent communication skills – written, verbal, and oral presentation 
Valid driver’s license with the ability to work flexible hours and travel locally for building inspections 
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Outlook, Excel (vlookup, if statements, pivot tables, etc.) 
Basic skills in creating financial models (i.e. Excel, Argus, etc.) 
Excellent research, quantitative and analytical skills 
Ability to work in a team and independently 
Excellent time management skills and ability to manage multiple deadlines 
Ability to take initiative and be resourceful 
Self-motivated with a high degree of integrity, honesty, and ethics 
Candidate for the Appraisal Institute of Canada (AIC) designation is considered an asset 
Real estate experience is considered an asset 

Come realize your potential at Altus Group! 

Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Consultant
Description:
About Project X
 The heart of what we do is drive for unique and innovative solutions that solve our customers problems. We are trusted advisors who create data and analytics solutions for complex client problems. We do this through collaboration, creativity and an innate need to solve tough data problems. Data runs deep in our veins and is what makes up who we are, individually and as a team, allows us to do the work we’re passionate about. We think differently.  Role Summary
 The Consultant, Business Systems Analyst works with internal and external stakeholders including the technology and business teams to develop and implement data solutions tailored to a project’s requirements. The nature of the projects varies from Waterfall to Agile and technology varies from legacy to cutting edge. They are involved throughout the project lifecycle by capturing and documenting requirements, test strategy/plans, test cases, execution of testing, sign off and implementation into production. They are supported by team members and the Practice Manager.
 This position does not have any direct reports.  Major Areas of Responsibility

 Deep, multilayered understanding of the business issues and the data challenges of the clients’ organizations and their industries.
 Ensure requirements are clear and complete, eliminating uncertainties and ambiguities.
 Establish quality solutions and validation against the requirements.
 Participate in the development of project plans to establish appropriate workload expectations and schedules.
 Communicate clearly with project team members, identify/resolve issues, and escalate when required.
 Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of, and adopt, relevant market trends and practices.
 Gather project requirements and develop a requirement matrix to identify gaps
 Create a detailed, functional/non-functional requirements documents, review and obtain sign off from key stakeholders.
 Provide ongoing updates and review throughout the project lifestyle.
 Create test strategy/plans and execute test cases.

 Nice to Have:

 Analytics / Business Intelligence tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau, Cognos, Looker)

 Required Education and Experience:

 Around 3-5 years’ experience on technical projects including three as a Business Systems Analyst
 Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Software or Computer Science/Engineering fields or related industry experience or acumen
 Experience in Data Warehousing, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Cloud Projects (AWS, GCP, Azure) or Big Data (Hadoop, Hive, Impala)
 ETL experience
 SLDC methodologies, specifically Agile and Waterfall
 SQL, Teradata, or Oracle
 MS Project (or similar project management tool)
 Data analysis (i.e., data quality, data migration, data processing and data manipulation)
 Leadership and integrity
 Open Communication
 Level-headed decision making and ability to think on your feet
 Innovation, creative, solution-based approaches to solving problems
 Time management, prioritizing effectively while delivering high quality work

 Why Join Project X: 
Project X Ltd drives success by focusing on building teams of incredibly talented, fun, dedicated people. We reward hard work and forward thinking with recognition and a fun company culture. We offer the following incentives:

 Competitive Salary
 Health and Dental benefits package
 Additional Health and Wellness Benefit - (i.e., bikes, fitness classes, health / fitness club memberships)
 Opportunities to advance your career
 Employee Referral Bonus

 In our commitment to promote fair and equitable treatment of all employees and applicants, Project X Ltd. provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of age, sex, disability, race, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sexual orientation, marital status or any other ground as described in the Ontario Human Rights Code. In addition, accommodation will be provided during the hiring process.
 Project X is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
 Due to the current COVID 19 Pandemic:

 Interviews are conducted online

Technical Business Analyst



    Mississauga

Job Description and Requirements

    Are you a problem solver who enjoys getting to the bottom of difficult situations? Do you have a drive to take existing processes to the next level? Are you a collaborative team-player who considers trust and respect important in building real partnerships? If so, we’re looking for you!
    

About Us
 TC Transcontinental has close to 8,000 employees globally, 41 operating facilities, and revenues at $2.6 billion for fiscal 2021. TC strives to drive growth and innovation and optimize the creation of sustainable solutions for our customers. Following the transformational acquisition of H.S. Crocker, TC Transcontinental has broadened the packaging solutions portfolio in the food sector and expanding pharmaceutical and medical expertise in advanced coatings product offering. With our 3 business segments in Print, Packaging and Media we continue to optimize, transform, and grow while making impressions that count!
    
 This position will be part of our Premedia team. Our Premedia team is the largest division of its kind in Canada. With over 500 talented employees in our group, we are proud to provide our national retail and CPG customers with key services ranging from creative, photo/video, language services, production, packaging and technology solutions. You will join this very passionate and dynamic team, in an exciting environment that is second to none!
    

About this opportunity
 Reporting to Director of Technology, Solutions and Development, Technical Business Analyst will primarily be supporting TC’s proprietary digital platform by actively collaborating with clients, development, QA, design, and product teams. Successful candidate will be required to participate in daily standup meetings, lead discovery sessions, coach team members, provide feedback and contribute with process improvements. Heavy focus will be put on building and translating business and technical requirements for existing platform and helping in its overall evolution.
 Responsibilities: 

 The incumbent will be responsible for but not limited to:
    
 Working with the business and clients to gather requirements for TC’s proprietary digital platform and transform them into detailed functional and technical specifications
 Collaborating with the development, product, QA, PM and design teams to ensure requirements are understood, concise and ready for implementation
 Working with project managers to identify change management requirements (e.g., communication, training, workflows etc.) and ensure that they are executed successfully
 Collaborating with other internal teams and external vendors to ensure that reciprocal business needs or limitations are considered throughout all stages of the project
 Provide on-going support for current implementations
 Guides QA through testing objectives and assist with analysis of testing results if needed
 Functions as a liaison between the business and the project team. Walks stakeholders through requirements and manages expectations regarding scope


 Qualifications:

 Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Business, Information Technology, or related field
 4+ years of experience as a business systems analysis in software development
 Experience within system implementation projects
 Experience with business process mapping and data mapping
 Excellent communication skills across a range of forums, channels, and stakeholders
 Experience with JIRA or related software
 Excellent documentation and presentation skills
 Strong analytical, problem solving, decision making and negotiating skills
 High attention to detail and ability to learn and adapt to high paced environment 
Ability to work well in a team environment and under tight deadlines is a must
 Maintain knowledge of software development, methodologies and information technology trends through training, appropriate literature, and other means
 BABOK, CBAP, CCBA, or equivalent certification is an asset
 Experience in print/digital marketing is considered a strong asset
 Experience with Adobe suite is a strong asset (InDesign)
 Agile Certification (CSM, CPO) is an asset
 Project management certification is an asset
 Experience in working with projects based on Agile or Waterfall methodologies

 What makes you technical:

 Broad exposure/experience of software development life cycle typically 2-3 or more years of related experience
 Excellent in-depth knowledge of SQL, .NET technologies, APIs, Azure/AWS infrastructure, C#, XML data structures and different operating systems/browser environments
 Experience in development of multi-tier web and API solutions


 What we have to offer

 Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career;
 Development opportunities where your input makes a difference. Competitive compensation package, pension and flexible benefits that are customizable to you and your family needs;
 Employee perks such as discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The Business Banking Data Governance & Analytics group is responsible for the overall management of data requirements for Business Banking, including the development and implementation of a data strategy in line with enterprise standards & policies.  The group supports Business Banking operations, product and sales teams in the areas of data engineering, reporting, and analytics.  The group also develops and executes policies, practices and procedures that properly manage the business's data needs and adhere to data governance standards as set out by the Office of Chief Data Officer.  Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence & Reporting, the Senior BI & Reporting Analyst will provide specialized end to end reporting & analytics for Business Banking products and services, including loans, lines of credit, deposits & cash management services.




Job Description


Job Description
 The successful candidate’s accountabilities and responsibilities will include:
     


Create complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards and perform data/business analysis using various internal data sources to support the understanding of Business banking customers, business drivers and the financial results.
Communicate analysis and ideas clearly, concisely and effectively with business partners and internal team.
Liaise with Business stakeholders to conduct effective discussions on project requirements, data specifications, priority and timeline to ensure timely and accurate delivery.
Create and maintain detailed documentation on all projects/requests.
Produce specialized reporting packages, dashboards & scorecards to understand objectives and deliver insights and commentary that can inform and shape product design and development, customer engagement, account management and business decision making,
Lead the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
Conduct analysis to provide enhanced BI to inform management leadership team
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in the Reporting Packages and Dashboards
Develop meaningful and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing reporting packages.
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop value-added reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Adopt, implement and effectively evolve report automation standards






Job Requirements


Job Requirements


Undergrad in a quantitative discipline (Computer Sci, Math, etc)
5+ years experience in ETL development, data analysis and working with large volumes of data, ideally within financial services.
5+ years Experience in Software engineering (SQL, Python/pyspark/SAS)
Project and time management skills
Knowledge of one or more of the TD’s systems would be an asset, e.g. Loans, DAS, CIF, Term and EDW, Akora.
Experience using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Analytical thinker with ability to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
Well organized, high attention to detail, results-oriented.
A solid team player, with strong interpersonal skills.






Inclusiveness

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve.
