Title: Senior Business Analyst, Payments
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our PRESTO, Payment Processing Office is seeing a Senior Business Analyst to represent business requirements to internal and external stakeholders and stay involved during deployment to identify 
efficient and cost-effective changes to optimize functionality of systems solution by tracking performance and mitigating implementation risks on significant projects. 
What will I be doing? 

Develops a thorough understanding of the business goals, practices and processes to translate into system functionality requirements and user stories that define project scope and specifications 
Work closely with the Product Owner to champion the product vision, develop roadmap, and manage product backlog 
Support the Product Owner from product development to launch that includes design/testing, client/business enablement, go-to-market activities, and on-going performance 
In partnership with business leaders, develops strategies for the application of technology; leads or participates in the development of business cases 
Facilitates dialogue and discussion between the business and internal and external providers to assist with prioritizing between competing objectives 
Assists the business to prepare business cases, understand scope limitations, and manage expectations during project implementation 
Proactively identifies opportunities for new technology/automation or streamlining of business processes and workflows 

What skills & qualifications do I need? 

Minimum six (6) years’ experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the transit, payment technology, and/or banking industry 
Passionate about digital space, technology innovation, and customer centric design thinking 
Post-secondary degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business Process Improvement, or a related discipline – or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent 
Experience leading teams to successfully deploy technology solutions in transport, payment, banking, or Telecommunications industry is an asset 
Experience with computerized quantitative and analytical tools (e.g. data modeling, workflows, and business process analysis) and with MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project, etc.) 
Interpersonal, oral/written/presentation communications skills to document and present business needs, specifications, reports, project documents, and implementation plans 

Accommodation: 
Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance. 
Application Process:  All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application. 
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. 
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Title: Business Analyst - Procurement
Description:
Job Posting

6436BR Business Analyst - Procurement Intern


Come start your career here!

 Our Internship program offers paid 18-month internships for new grads interested in a career in municipal public service. The program provides training, development, and on-the-job experience for candidates that have graduated within the last 24 months.
    
 We are inviting applications for the 18-month term position of 
    Business Analyst- Intern in Procurement, Finance and Asset Management.
    
 The Intern Program is designed to provide experiential learning and maximum professional exposure to interns in their chosen field of study while exploring the benefits of working for the municipality. Over the course of the internship, candidates will learn about government policy, operations, administration, services, and planning in a collaborative and supportive environment. Interns make a difference in our community and organization!
    
 Halifax Regional Municipality (HRM) is committed to reflecting the community it serves and recognizing Diversity and Inclusion as one of the Municipality’s core values. We have an Employment Equity Policy and we welcome applications from African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Women in occupations or positions where they are underrepresented in the workforce, Indigenous/Aboriginal People, Persons with Disabilities and 2SLGBTQ+ Persons. Applicants are encouraged to self-identify on their electronic application.
    
 Under the direction of the Inventory Management Team Lead and Procurement Practices Consultant. With a focus on performance excellence, the Business Analyst-Procurement provides expert advice and support in the operation of Procurement. Halifax Regional Municipality has a municipal budget of $1.1 billion – including $925.7 million in municipal expenditures and $180.2 million in provincial mandatory contributions – as well as a capital plan of $318.9 million for the 2022-23 fiscal year. Inventory Management, a department within Procurement, is responsible for $5M of stocked inventory holdings at six storeroom locations, distributing $16M annually; purchasing non-stocked vehicle parts valued at $1.5M annually; salt and fuel inventories, and quoting materials for standing offers.
    
 The Business Analyst-Procurement leads service improvement initiatives and is responsible for the implementation of re-engineering initiatives that result in quantifiable business improvements. The Business Analyst-Procurement will baseline all current processes and develop strategies for eliminating inefficient processes and improving customer service. The Business Analyst-Procurement will develop robust internal processes that will lead to improvements in staff workloads and resource usage.
    

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Research and Benchmarking

 Collect and analyse data and develop data collection protocols for tracking and compiling data.
 Research best practices in both private and public sectors.
 Conduct meetings with management, staff, vendors, and internal service providers to identify opportunities (business improvements, or technology) that align with business strategy.

 Procedure Development
 Develop new and expand on existing process maps and/or work instructions with respect to:
    
 Procurement processes
 Inventory management processes
 Identify and implement best practice.

 Improvement

 Consult with HRM’s Information and Technology (IT) division as required to develop improvements including the movement of multiple data source Excel reports to an automated software reporting process.
 Leverage available IT resources to maximize operational effectiveness.
 Provide options for operational improvement, by way of identifying increased service and/or potential savings.


 QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience:

 University degree in business administration, public administration, Industrial Engineering, or Computer Science required.
 Excellent proficiencies in current versions MS Office; advanced skills in Excel and experience in Business Intelligence Tools are required.
 Project Management and Lean Six Sigma education or certification considered an asset
 Education and experience associated with analytical thinking, problem solving and multi-tasking.
 To be eligible for the internship, candidates must have graduated within the last 24 months or be confirmed to graduate in June 2022 from a recognized or legally authorized university or community college.
 Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada at time of application and maintain this status for the duration of 18-month term.
 We value non-traditional experience and candidates are encouraged to outline in their application any student leadership, volunteering, extra-curricular, or community-based experience they possess.
 Preference will be given to those candidates who have demonstrated an interest in public policy or government administration


 Technical / Job Specific Knowledge and Abilities:

 Strong analytical aptitude
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Experience with the following business systems: SAP (or other ERP system), Asset Works (or another asset management system) is considered an asset.
 Experience with Power BI is preferred


 Security Clearance Requirements: Applicants may be required to complete an employment security screening check. You will be provided with more specific information during the recruitment process.
    

COMPETENCIES: Analytical Thinking; Communications; Organization and Planning; Organizational Awareness; Valuing Diversity
    

WORK STATUS: Term 18 months, NON-UNION
    
HOURS OF WORK: Monday-Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 35 hours per week
    
SALARY: $50,000 per year
    
WORK LOCATION: 40 Alderney Drive, Dartmouth, NS
    
CLOSING DATE: Applications will be received up to 11:59 pm on July 3, 2022
    

Please note: We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.
    
 During the recruitment process, applicants have the right to request an accommodation. Applicants invited to participate in an assessment process (such as an interview or testing) and who require accommodation, should discuss their needs with the Recruiter when invited to the assessment process.
    
 HRM takes the health and safety of its job applicants and employees seriously. All recruitment activities are being conducted in adherence with current Covid-19 Public Health protocols.

Title: Evidence Management Analyst (10-month contract)
Description:
Our organization:

  The Alberta Securities Commission is the industry-funded regulator responsible for administering the province's securities laws. It is entrusted with fostering a fair and efficient capital market in Alberta and with protecting investors. As a member of the Canadian Securities Administrators, the ASC works to improve, coordinate and harmonize the regulation of Canada's capital markets.
  
 The Enforcement division enforces Alberta securities laws by investigating and prosecuting breaches of those laws to prevent and stop current and future misconduct. The Evidence Management team helps ensure that information and evidence are properly managed throughout the investigation and litigation process.
 
The opportunity:

  Reporting to the Manager, Evidence & Legal Technology, this position will provide expertise in tracking, processing, digital analysis, categorizing and disclosure of evidence through the course of investigations and litigation.
 
Key responsibilities include:

  Managing the processing of investigative information (digital, paper-based and other physical format) throughout the case lifecycle.
   Meeting with investigators and litigators to discuss, strategize, train and assist with:
   Secure and defensible evidence collection
   Appropriate evidence handling and tracking processes
   Early case assessment, culling, evidence categorization and quarantining
   Data analytics and technology assisted review
   Database management
   Disclosure and hearing documentation
   Training and assisting with the categorizing and tagging of documents for disclosure (and non-disclosure).
   Preparing documents for disclosure in a context-appropriate format and in accordance with governing rules or panel directions.
   Organizing and preparing documents for hearings and/or trials as appropriate for the type of case, hearing forum and format needed (digital or physical).
   Establishing and documenting work flows to support efficient document reviews.
   Tracking and overseeing the movement of original evidence (paper and electronic) in and out of the Evidence Room.
   Liaising with law firms and others in regard to database and document issues.
   Providing technical and functional support and training on evidence tracking, document management, database searching, review, tagging and disclosure.
   Assisting with document scanning, electronic discovery processing and software.
   Assisting the Office of the General Counsel and Records and Information Management staff as necessary to prepare documentary responses to Enforcement-related FOIP requests and criminal or court production orders. 
   In collaboration with colleagues, reviewing and enhancing procedures, systems and software.
 
The ideal candidate will possess:

  A Legal Assistant certificate or diploma, or equivalent education or experience. 
   Five or more years of litigation support or records management experience, preferably working in a legal or regulatory environment. 
   Five or more years of experience working with electronic litigation support databases, e-discovery software, or comparable information management systems.
   Strong problem-solving, time-management, task prioritization and communication skills.
   Strength in documenting and providing training on processes and best practices.
   The ability to work well as part of a team.
   Excellent attention to detail and the ability to follow precise written and verbal instructions.
   Working knowledge of e-discovery and other search software and databases.
   Experience using Technology Assisted Review and/or other automated document analysis tools.
   Experience in privilege and relevance review is preferred.
 
To apply:

  Click the Apply For This Job button to submit your resume, cover letter and salary expectations by July 8, 2022.

Title: Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations
Description:
Position Title: Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations
 Position Type: Temporary - Full-Time 
Position Location: Florenceville Main
 Grade: 00
 Requisition ID: 17288

 
As Analyst, Environment and Resource Efficient Operations, you will be responsible for building and maintaining systems to support our environment and resource efficient operations strategy.

 You will support and collaborate with various internal teams within McCain to:

 Develop data integration, visualization and analytics for decision making
 Manage sustainability data with a focus on environmental compliance, CO2 emissions, energy efficiency, water usage and waste
 Manage sustainability data gathered from various business functions and utilize platforms to analyze data to support efficient resource usage, visualization and management


 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Working in close collaboration with global SMEs, the regions and supporting external consultants this person will execute the following tasks:

 Environmental Performance Measures
   
 Maintain and improve data collection systems to track environmental performance
 Develop approaches to replace manual data collection with automated data retrieval processes
 Maintain and improve global greenhouse gas inventory, and support internal and external verification
 Provide environmental performance data as required

 Scope 3 Emissions
   
 Work with agricultural, procurement and supply chain teams to build streamlined data collection processes to be able to efficiently and effectively report on Scope 3 emissions
 Support these teams as they develop carbon reduction roadmaps to ensure that we have the data collection tools in place to effectively measure and report on the improvements

 Life Cycle Analyses
   
 Leverage existing organizational data to develop product level life cycle assessments to provide to customers in support of Scope 3 emissions reporting using Life Cycle Analysis Software such as GaBi

 Environmental Management System
   
 Support the Manager, Global Environment to build an effective environmental management system that provides visibility to risks, incidents and continuous improvement efforts throughout the organization






 Support internal and external audits as required - work with multiple data sources, platforms and software, including SAP, Intelex, OSI PI and Power BI.


 Assist Manager, Resource Efficient Operations and Manager, Global Environment as required
 Additional responsibilities as required

 KEY QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCES:

 A Bachelor’s Degree is required. A degree in Engineering, Environmental Science, Computer Science, Business or other technical field is preferred
 You must have a passion for environmental and sustainability initiatives 
Experience and interest in managing large datasets


 Strong influencing skills and the ability to:


 work with resource constrained internal teams to help them achieve results; and
 work and succeed in a matrixed organization, flexing and modifying approaches as necessary
 Ability to work effectively as part of a multicultural team
 Excellent communication skills in multicultural, multi-lingual environments


 Strong project management skill:


 Well organized and structured
 Ability to use initiative, prioritize, multi-task, and work well under pressure to meet deadlines and deliver results


 Technical capabilities in the areas of:


 Strong technical and analytical skills
 Clear and systematic thinking that demonstrates good judgment and problem solving competencies
 Computer programming would be an asset
   
 Structuring data relationships and working with databases
 Understanding of databases, and how to structure data relationships
 Business Analytics software such as Power BI would be advantageous
 Exposure to the concepts of Life Cycle Analysis



 Proven analytical and problem solving skills are required, as well as excellent attention to accuracy and detail
 Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in other languages are an asset


 KEY COMPETENCIES:

 Ensures Accountability – Holding self and other accountable to meet commitments
 Collaborates – Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
 Courage – Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what need to be said.
 Customer Focus – Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
 Drives Engagement – Creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives. (People Managers only)
 Being Resilient – Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations
 Drives Results - Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances


 OTHER INFORMATION


 Key internal relationships: Director, REO, Environmental Teams, Engineering teams, Operational leaders, CSR teams, Global Engineering team, Global IT team
 Key external relationships: Supplier, Consultants, Contractors
 Travel: limited international travel may be required
 Job is primarily performed in a standard office environment.

Title: Business Consultant, TBS Sales Business Intelligence
Description:

Description




Join our team

Title: Transportation Pricing Analyst
Description:
Radiant offers a complete range of industry-leading transportation and warehousing solutions to businesses around the globe by leveraging our extensive network of carrier partners across all modes. Radiant provides customized logistics solutions that create value and increase profitability for our customers.
Radiant Canada is a learning environment in which passion, dedication and a commitment to getting the job done are valued. That’s what being on our team is all about. It’s where you can gain valuable skills and experience, which also helps Radiant grow. If this sounds like the kind of company you are looking for, we would love to hear from you!
We are currently looking for a Pricing Analyst to join Radiant and be part of our dynamic team.
HYBRID WORK MODEL: Work in the office at 1280 Courtneypark Drive E, Mississauga every Monday and Wednesday. Work from home Tuesday, Thursday and Fridays. 
What You’ll Do: 

Coordinate the RFP process including registration, review of documents, identifying areas of concern, assignment of tasks and upload of final submission.
Coordinate with the Pricing team to translate partner rate proposals into desired customer RFP format, add margin as instructed and upload final product to bid tools.
Analyze trends in customer data and identify opportunities to maximize profit, minimize costs, improve service, recommend value-added business solutions, and determine potential areas for improvement and growth.
Perform strategic transportation network analysis to develop cost effective solutions that meet the customers’ business goals.
Provide strategic data analysis on new transportation opportunities.
Provide carrier rate impact analysis on current business: base rate, accessorial charges, and fuel surcharge.
Collaborate with internal teams (i.e. Sales, Operations) to develop and deliver effective pricing strategies, cost impact analysis and changes to customer rates and accessorial programs.
Gather customer bill rates and quotes and provide to customers as requested.
Request and obtain required supply chain data from customers to support strategic objectives.
Pre-process and filter the data, check for inconsistencies, and seek clarification to perform analysis. Repair and advise on corrupted data.
Assist in uploading and maintaining the Company’s database of freight rates, fuel surcharge(FSC), rate tariffs and accessorial programs, both carrier and customer, within the TMS, ensuring accuracy of content.

What You Bring to the Role: 

College Diploma / University Degree in Business, Statistical Analysis or related discipline.
CCLP and P. Log are assets.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in supply chain analysis and optimization. Transportation analysis with focus in 3PL is preferred.
Complete understanding of the North American transportation industry including over the road highway (domestic and cross border), intermodal and warehousing.


Advanced computer skills required in Excel and Access (i.e., charts, formulas, pivot tables, queries, database management).
Advanced knowledge of industry leading procurement software (i.e. Jaggaer, Coupa)
Advanced knowledge of industry standard rating methods, CWT, CZARLITE, fuel scales, cube and density calculations
Working knowledge of Visio, MapPoint and Project are assets.
Working knowledge of transportation management software is an asset.

Perks You’ll Get: 

Health, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance
RRSP Contribution Matching
Birthday Day Off
Paid Sick Days
Learning & Development Opportunities
Employee Discounts
Access to an Employee Assistance Program for services including counseling, financial and legal consultation
Wellness Program
A Supportive and Positive Work Environment

The Fine Print: Radiant is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.
We thank all candidates for applying, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Casual dress
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift

Salary Expectations

Experience:

RFP: 1 year (preferred)
Transportation analysis: 2 years (preferred)

Title: Senior Analyst, Case Mix
Description:
Category


    Data Analysis
   




City


    Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada
   







Job Description


    Senior Analyst, Case Mix 
    
 Who we are
    
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
 CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
 At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include

 HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)
 Retirement Planning Program
 Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
 Work-life balance
 Career Planning Program
 Learning and Professional Development Program
 Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts



 Why is this role important?
     Working as a part of the Case Mix team, the Senior Analyst will carry out a range of activities that contribute to the development, maintenance and enhancement of methodologies and products that support health system and population health decision-making. Major responsibilities include leading data analyses, incorporating new data sources, conducting quality assurance activities, and communicating analyses to internal and external audiences. In addition, the Senior Analyst will coordinate projects, prepare and contribute to reports and documentations, and assist with other project activities such as supporting the use of the CIHI products. The Senior Analyst will be working with a range of data sets from the hospital, primary care, mental health, residential care, and home care sectors. 
    
 What you'll do
     1. Performs qualitative and quantitative analyses using data across multiple healthcare settings to understand population health and analyze the patient journey
    
 2. Leads analytical activities related to the ongoing development and evolution of case mix grouping methodologies 
    
 3. 
     4.
    


 5. Provides analytical support to additional ad-hoc requests and special studies as required. 
    
 6. Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of the case mix methodologies and CIHI data holdings used to produce outputs.
    
 7. Prepares related documentations as required; presents work progress, findings, summaries to internal and external audiences.
    
 8. Develops and maintains relationships by working in collaboration with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
    
 9. Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by following policies in privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives. 
    
 What you'll bring to the table
    
Undergraduate degree in epidemiology, statistics, mathematics, economics, health services research, health administration or other relevant field. Masters degree is considered an asset.

3-5 years experience working in a health care research/information environment involved in the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products.

Advanced SAS programming skills. Experience with R or Python is considered an asset.

Strong analytical skills, with experience using predictive modeling to manipulate and draw insights from large datasets.

Strong interpersonal, presentation, verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology.

Project planning, time management and organizational skills.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Existing knowledge of CIHI clinical databases is an asset. 

Fluency in both official languages is an asset. 

Ability to meet minimal travel requirements. 

 Closing Statement
    
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
 We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


 Employment Equity
    
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.





Analyste principal, Groupes clients 
    
 Notre organisation
    
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
 Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
 L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants : 

une structure salariale concurrentielle
 un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
 l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
 un programme de planification de la retraite
 un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
 un programme de planification de carrière
 des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel



 Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
     Au sein de l’équipe des Groupes clients, l’analyste principal effectue un éventail d’activités contribuant à l’élaboration, à la mise à jour et à l’amélioration de méthodologies et de produits qui orientent la prise de décisions relatives aux systèmes de santé et à la santé de la population. Il est principalement appelé à diriger des analyses de données, à intégrer de nouvelles sources de données, à mener des activités d’assurance de la qualité et à diffuser les résultats des analyses à des publics internes et externes. L’analyste principal coordonne des projets, participe à la préparation de rapports et d’autres documents, et prend part à d’autres activités de projet comme le soutien à l’utilisation des produits de l’ICIS. Il travaille avec une variété d’ensembles de données provenant des hôpitaux et des secteurs des soins primaires, de la santé mentale, des soins en hébergement et des services à domicile. 
    
 Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
     1. Effectuer des analyses qualitatives et quantitatives à l’aide de données provenant de divers milieux de soins afin de mieux comprendre la santé de la population et d’analyser le cheminement des patients.
    
 2. Diriger les activités d’analyse liées à l’élaboration et l’évolution continues des méthodologies des groupes clients
    
 3. Offrir au besoin un soutien analytique dans le cadre d’autres demandes et études spéciales. 
    
 4. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie des méthodologies des groupes clients et des banques de données de l’ICIS utilisées dans la production des rapports.
    
 5. Préparer des documents connexes au besoin; présenter des rapports d’avancement des travaux, des résultats et des résumés à des publics internes et externes.
    
 6. Cultiver des relations de collaboration avec divers intervenants internes et externes.
    
 7. Respecter le droit à la vie privée et protéger la confidentialité de l’information en suivant les politiques sur le respect de la vie privée et la confidentialité de l’information sur la santé de l’ICIS ainsi que les procédures et directives connexes. 
    
 Que mettriez-vous à profit ? 
    
Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle en épidémiologie, en statistique, en mathématiques, en économie, en recherche sur les services de santé, en administration de la santé ou dans un domaine connexe. Maîtrise, un atout.

3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine de l’information ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la programmation SAS. Expérience des langages de programmation R ou Python, un atout.

Excellentes aptitudes pour l’analyse et expérience de l’utilisation des techniques de modélisation prédictive afin de manipuler des données et de tirer des enseignements à partir de grands ensembles de données.

Entregent, excellentes aptitudes pour la présentation et la communication verbale et écrite, dont la capacité de vulgariser des concepts complexes.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la planification de projets, la gestion du temps et l’organisation.

Capacité manifeste à travailler seul ou en équipe.

Connaissance des bases de données cliniques de l’ICIS, un atout. 

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout. 

Capacité à répondre aux exigences minimales de déplacement. 

 Declaration
    
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
 Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
 La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.
 L’utilisation dans le présent document de la forme masculine ou féminine, selon le contexte, a pour seul but d’alléger le texte.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Sales and Operations Enablement (SOE) Team
Description:
Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Barrie, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Calgary, AB, CA 
    







     Req ID: 25773 
    







     Jobs by Category: Operations 
    







     Job Function: Planning and Analysis 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Join our team

 The Sales and Operations Enablement (SOE) team of the Customer Experience Operations & Enablement (CEOE) organization is looking for a dynamic, enthusiastic and driven Senior Business Analyst, to join our team to deliver on complex, transformational systems projects. If you are interested in building IT solutions that drive the achievement of operational goals – this is the role for you!

 How will you drive business success? The SOE team members are the product owners for consumer pre-sales systems, which include field sales support tools, fibre drop management applications, and more. The capabilities we deliver are on platforms such as the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), mobile apps and Salesforce.com. Through strategic projects with agile development we ensure systems capabilities work seamlessly end-to-end and perform optimally so that our channel and operational partners can serve our customers in an efficient and cost-effective manner. Our goal is to reduce operational costs and improve revenue & yield.

 Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 As a Senior Business Analyst you will be the Product Owner accountable for maximizing business value delivery for our pre-sales systems and improving sales outcomes through projects focused on fibre drop and inventory data improvement initiatives, ultimately driving operational efficiency and increasing revenue. You will challenge the status quo and collaborate on finding the best way to deliver systems functionality with the user experience at the forefront of consideration. You will be accountable for the overall success of your project portfolio and your performance will be measured by the successful realization of your portfolio’s targeted business case benefits.






 Qualifications




Here’s how



Lead the development and implementation of system changes for project launch, including: 
      
requirements elicitation and user story definition
business case development
risk assessment / mitigation
stakeholder update presentations
user interface and processes design
test strategy development and testing

Be accountable for timely resolution of post-launch support issues engaging required technical experts
Develop a broad understanding of systems architecture and integration points to guide solution direction
Liaise technical subject matter experts and business stakeholders on cross-functional implementation activities to meet deliverables and influence decision making
Proactively identify and assess opportunities to deliver value to stakeholder teams
Ensure open & ongoing communication to support change management.
Ensure that business impacts are accurately captured and communicated to stakeholders while providing input, expertise and guidance to project teams on potential impacts the projects have to the Customer Experience
Track and measure post-implementation benefits to validate value has been delivered


 
You’re the missing piece of the puzzle and what you will bring



Passion for business analytics and systems analysis
Enjoy project work with cross functional team members
Proven track record in managing multiple projects from start to finish
Ability to quickly learn new technology and applications
Outcome focused, forward thinking, and willing to try new ideas
Creative mind and the drive to initiate your own projects
Thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment
Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Confidence in handling conflict and difficult conversations
Strong competency in the Google and Microsoft (MS) Office suite of productivity applications
Graduate Certificate or Degree in Management Information Systems, Business Analysis or equivalent experience

Title: MES Business Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Junior to Intermediate Business/Validation Analyst to assist the implementation of a number of shop floor systems on a new pharmaceutical facility. The project includes the implementation and validation of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) and Data Historian System (DHS) with interfaces to a plant wide control systems and small equipment.
The Business Analyst who will under the supervision of the MES project lead, support the implementation and validation of the MES and DHS systems within a dedicated infrastructure.
Deliverables (not limited to the following): 

All documentation deliverables consistent with Corporate methodology and generally accepted industrial standards.
Meet with the project leads at least weekly to review deliverables, confirm expectations, and address issues / concerns.
Ensure changes are approved and documented as per project change control, and shall execute all tasks based on the project plan / validation plan
Ensure that the solution being provided follows standard pharmaceutical industry practices (e.g. GxP)
Report incidences having potential impact to security, IT services, health / safety, and GxP.
Adhere to code of ethics and other Corporate policy related to transparency and good corporate citizenship.

(Must Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications: 

Engineering degree and 2+ years of experience in an IT or automation environment
Good technical writing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work in a challenging and fast paced environment
Experience working with wide range of stakeholders (customers, end users, sponsor, vendor, project team, extended team, etc) to develop relationships, identify and define requirements/gaps, and educate users.
Demonstrated ability to deal with and report to different stakeholders, build relationship, host project meetings, deal with tension, deliver projects on time and on budget (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Good understanding of the IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies
Strong understanding of risk analysis
Excellent analytical, prioritization, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
Strong team player, transparent, open, honest, confident (must provide reference contacts to verify)
Ability to adapt to changes and various paces within a project
Working experience with all the MS Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project, etc.)

(Nice to Have) Skills, Experience, and Qualifications: 

Prior experience in Werum PAS-X or another MES system
Prior experience with SAP and interfacing with other systems
Prior experience with OSIsoft PI or another data historian
Experience using electronic document management systems (such as Documentum or SharePoint)

Note:  This position requires to work onsite 90%. Therefore, applicant from Greater Toronto Area only.

Salary: $40.00-$60.00 per hour
Benefits:

On-site parking

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

OSISoft PI: 1 year (preferred)
SAP: 1 year (preferred)
Pharmaceutical industry: 1 year (preferred)
GMP or GXP: 1 year (preferred)
technical documentation: 2 years (required)
working with wide range of stakeholders: 2 years (preferred)

Business Analysis Certification (e.g. IIBA or CBAP) (preferred)

Title: Solution Consultant, Business Intelligence
Description:
Resolver operates as a hybrid workforce with the option to work at home, in the office, or a mix of both.  As a Solution Consultant, Business Intelligence you live to delight customers by solving business problems with technology. You are a customer advocate, who will support Resolver’s SaaS implementations through building dashboards, visualizations and overall data analytics for our ever-expanding customer base.   You will be one of the first Consultants at Resolver to take on this function, so a keen eye for process development and integrations will be key for success. You’ll collaborate daily and your voice will contribute to a great organization (that’s us by the way!)  Your day to day - let's break it down!
 Project Delivery (100%) Measures of success: customer feedback (NPS, references), peer feedback, utilization, and project margin 
You’ll enable customers to take maximum advantage of our software by leading and participating in the delivery of end-to-end software implementations.
 Consultation & Requirements Gathering

 Consult with customers on the best ways to configure data models, financial reports, etc., and integrate data from customer systems in an automated manner where possible.
 Educating customers on what’s required for successful implementations
 Gathering and documenting customer functional and technical requirements
 Creating design recommendations and securing agreement on designs that satisfy customer requirements and reflect industry best practices

 Project Management

 Establishing a shared vision of project success during project initiation and confirming a common understanding of project scope, delivery approach, task ownership, and deliverables
 Controlling and communicating project scope, schedule, budget, and risk to customers and management
 Leading regular project discussions with customers and project teams to review work plans, risks, actions, issues, and decisions that drive projects to completion and minimize “time to value”

 Configuration

 Configuring our no-code software based on the solution design, performing quality assurance to minimizing rework (no coding required)!
 Design and develop BI reports and dashboards that enable customers to make better informed decisions through risk intelligence.

 Customer Training

 Delivering administrator, train-the-trainer, and end-user training sessions, and authoring training materials as required (including documents, decks, videos, etc.)

 People who Excel:

 5+ years of prior experience in delivering enterprise off-the-shelf software or incident management solutions
 Experience with Visio, MS Project, MS Office, and CRM’s such as Salesforce
 Proven track record with business intelligence (BI) tools, extra points for Tableau! Exposure to SQL query is a must.
 Strong ability to interpret, consult and translate data into meaningful dashboards for Executive level review.
 Experience within Risk Management, Internal Audit, and Regulatory Compliance Management or Corporate Security is a bonus but not a must have!
 You love to make customers happy regardless of any obstacle!
 You’re a go-getter with an excellent ability to manage ongoing projects simultaneously
 You have exceptional communication skills and get pumped speaking with customers
 You’re a self-starter who can take charge of tasks with minimal direction (we’re not fans of micro-management)
 You’re accountable for your work! You take the time to invest in research, learning, and practice to make yourself an expert in your field!

 About Us: Resolver
 Resolver is one of Canada's Great Workplaces. Culture isn't just something we write about (although we do), we live our values and challenge each other to be our best selves. We invest in Resolverites who will grow with us.

 Team: we have smart, talented and curious people you'll work with and learn from. We collaborate a lot too, which means bonus points for people who love cross-functional learning.
 Impact: we solve complex challenges for some of the world's most recognized organizations. Our customers use our software to help reduce the frequency and severity of negative events to protect people, product and organizational success. What we do matters.
 Professional development: we have an external learning budget to help you grow and develop. We also have great online learning internally for you to tap in to.
 It's a Scale-up: what does that even mean? We have the best elements of a start-up blended with the stability and process design of an enterprise. There is still a lot of white space though, so people to take initiative to help us get better!
 Vacation: it's open, which means we don't worry about an accrual clock. Open vacation has been called a bit of scam, so we'll tell you that most Resolverites enjoy between 3-4 weeks off a year.
 Parental leave: best-in-class top-up for new parents - 100% for 15 weeks new parents and a bonus 5 weeks for birth Moms.
 Great benefits: 100% paid by us for health and dental from day one. And our vision care is every 12 months! We also offer a wellness/fitness reimbursement, that can go towards things like gym memberships, yoga classes, soccer membership fees or a bike.
 Office perks: coffee/tea/lattes…snacks and more. Ping-pong, games night, beer o'clock, chess, Switch, foodie bake-offs, and salad days are great ways for people to come together.

 Over 1,000 of the world’s largest organizations depend on Resolver’s cloud software product to protect their employees, customers, supply chain and brand. We do this by using data to manage risk and security in a single solution. As a high-growth scale-up, we have the agility, autonomy and experimental drive of a start-up with the stability of an enterprise (minus the bureaucracy). We’re a flat organization – in value and by design. There are no offices, we want dialogue and ideas to flow throughout our org so we can get better, faster.
 Interested?!
 If you want to work in a highly collaborative environment and are committed to making a difference, we’d like to meet you. Click here to get the process rolling.
 We truly appreciate all interest and will happily reply to qualified candidates.  Resolver is committed to providing accommodations for all persons with disabilities. If at any point in the recruitment process you require accommodation, please notify the applicable recruiter or contact us directly at talent@resolver.com

Title: Business Systems Senior Analyst
Description:
Business Systems Senior Analyst
-
(
220000EU
)


 Description




A growing global company. Endless career and development opportunities.



    When you join Ritchie Bros., you’ll be part of a diverse, global team that’s focused on delivering great customer experiences. Our culture is centered around people and guided by our core values of Integrity, Unity and Vision. Learn more about our culture and commitment to diversity and inclusion at Candidate Portal.
   


    If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are passionate about making a difference, we invite you to join our growing team. Whether you’re out in the field or back at your office, you’ll be helping us achieve our vision of becoming the trusted global marketplace for insights, services and transaction solutions for commercial assets.
   



   We’re looking for a 
   Business Systems Senior Analyst in 
   North America.
  


The Opportunity:



   The Business Systems Senior Analyst is responsible for the design and implementation of TI processes and cube design. They primarily work on the expansion and maintenance of integration processes for bringing data from operational data systems and EDW into cubes for budgeting, forecasting, and reporting. The Business Systems Senior Analyst will expand the scale and improve the sustainability of the enterprise planning and analytics environment, support budgeting and rolling forecast processes, as well as perform other business partnering and decision-support activities. The Business Systems Senior Analyst will have a finance and/or information systems background, Cognos TM1 expertise, tm1py experience, Cognos Analytics Business Intelligence expertise, ERP experience, strong written and verbal communication skills, and drive. The Business Systems Senior Analyst will have experience leading multiple moderate to high complexity financial planning and business intelligence project implementations.
  


In this role you’ll:




     Work closely with Planning Analytics team and FP&A analysts to architect, design and implement enhancements.
     


     Deliver software of the highest quality through good design, attention to detail, use of automated testing, and thorough unit/system testing.
     


     Planning Analytics technical skills: Rules and TI coding, security setup, report development, ongoing maintenance of existing models.
     


     Planning Analytics soft skills: gathering requirements for new projects, providing user training.
     


     Actively support the RB Unreserved Commitment to Safety: to send everyone home, every day, the way they came to work, by taking personal responsibility for your safety and safety of your team, co-workers and customers.
     



Here’s what you bring:




     Bachelor's degree in Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field.
     


     2+ years of experience developing Planning Analytics/TM1 is a must.
     


     2+ years of experience conducting analysis and data mining using SQL.
     


     1+ years of experience with Python or tm1py.
     



This job will require you to:




     Have a strong ability to develop and analyze requirements and to architect, design, and implement high-quality data models and reports to meet those requirements.
     


     Identify and investigate key requirements, solutions, and technologies.
     


     Collaborate with internal contacts to define requested solutions in technical terms.
     



What We Offer:



   Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:
  



     Comprehensive medical and dental benefits.
     


     RRSP / Pension plan and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match.
     


     Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.
     


     A multi-award-winning LEED gold-certified facility, in an exceptional park-like setting, featuring:
    



       A subsidized, multi-award-winning childcare centre.
       


       A subsidized cafeteria, dry cleaning services, and free parking.
       


       A workout facility, featuring advanced gym equipment, bike room, shower and changing facilities, and nutrition and fitness programs.
       


       Proximity to miles of Fraser River walking paths, plus shops, restaurants and services.
       






Ritchie Bros. has grown from a small-town auctioneer to a global asset management and disposition company. Through our family of companies, we help our customers buy and sell a wide range of used and unused equipment for construction, mining, transportation, agriculture, oil & gas, lifting & material handling, forestry & other industries.
Ritchie Bros. is an equal opportunity employer and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with all applicable laws. This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Candidate selection is made by Talent Acquisition. Only electronic applications can be accepted. No agency calls, please.
If you require any accommodation, please send an email to: careers@rbauction.com.

Title: Senior Pricing Analyst
Senior SAP BI Report Developer/Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Company Overview 
Motorola Solutions is there for our customers when everything is on the line. In extreme moments — when a hurricane lands or when a fire breaks out. And in everyday moments — when a package arrives just in time for the holiday or when a child doesn’t miss the school bus home. 

We unify voice, data, video and analytics in one integrated ecosystem to enable individuals, businesses and communities to work together in more powerful ways. To help people make better decisions, act confidently and be their best in the moments that matter. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions and connect with a career that matters. 
 Department Overview At Motorola Solutions we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems. 
  Job Description 
Motorola Video Solutions has been a driving force behind the security industry’s AI evolution and has continuously been a company that stands for innovation and growth. At Motorola, you will find a culture of thought-leaders who are passionate about creating exciting new solutions for security and surveillance. We seek problem-solvers who are eager to rise to the challenges of a continuously evolving technological industry, and those who want to make an impact on the safety of people and businesses globally. 

Responsibilities include: 

Contributing to the Business Intelligence platform through the design and development of reports, dashboards, scorecards, and analytical tools to support corporate BI initiatives 
Development of SAP BW models, data flows, and queries 
Development of SAP HANA calculation views and stored procedures 
Troubleshooting of reports using HANA Studio, Query Designer, and Business Warehouse 
Providing technical support for existing reports, and developing new reports in SAP Business Objects (Webi, Design Studio, Lumira) 
Providing ad hoc reporting in response to daily corporate information needs while adhering to service level agreements 
Investigating and resolving any identified data anomalies 
Developing automation or scripts to check the integrity and consistency of data 
Developing processes and procedures for managing test cases 
Monitoring and coordinating the resolution of Master Data issues with business teams 
Maintenance of the SAP Business Warehouse environment through proactive incident root cause analysis and problem resolution. Assure quality, security, and compliance requirements are met for the BI team. 
Contributing to and documenting new departmental procedures and user guides 
Providing system administration and coding best practices input through positive influence to peers and leadership 


Qualifications: 

Degree or diploma in a related IT area or discipline 
5+ years of experience as a BI report developer using the SAP BI platform 
2+ years of experience developing reports using Business Warehouse 
2+ years of experience developing BEx queries 
Experience with master data, data quality, or data migration projects and processes would be an asset 
SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC) experience is an asset 
Technically competent with various software programs and platforms. Experience with MS Office suite (Excel, Access, Word, Visio) is a must. 
Proven data analysis, data verification, and problem-solving skills 
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage to change priorities 
Detail-oriented, analytical, and very organized with the ability to multitask 
Ability to work under pressure and produce excellent results 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
A results-oriented individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment 


This role can be remote anywhere in Canada. 
 Basic Requirements 
Diploma (or equivalent experience) and 4+ years of SAP BI report experience 
 Travel Requirements None 
  Relocation Provided None 
  Position Type Experienced 
  Referral Payment Plan Yes

Title: Senior Analyst, Health Indicators and Client Support
Description:
Category


    Data Analysis
   




City


    Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada
   







Job Description


    Senior Analyst, Health Indicators and Client Support 
    
 Who we are
    
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
 CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
 At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include

 HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Benefits Pension)
 Retirement Planning Program
 Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
 Work-life balance
 Career Planning Program
 Learning and Professional Development Program
 Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts



 Why is this role important?
     The Health Indicators and Client Support area is responsible for the calculation and dissemination of various indicators of health system performance for hospitals and jurisdictions across the country. The Senior Analyst is a key member of the team and is contributing to the compilation, verification, analysis and dissemination of a set of indicators intended to provide health providers, health decision-makers, researchers and the public with reliable and comparable data on various dimensions of health care performance to promote quality improvement. The Senior Analyst also responds to client requests, works with other internal stakeholders to define data requirements and may also liaise with other external parties as required. 
    
 What you'll do
     1. Writes and executes computer analyses required for the computation, analysis, and/or verification of the indicators. This may include taking responsibility over a defined suite of indicators.
    
 2. Conducts the methodological reviews of the existing set of indicators, including the relevant data analyses and literature reviews.
    
 3. Assists with dissemination of health indicator data, including, but not limited to, data verification and preparation of the data for reporting.
    
 4. Participates in the design, development, and dissemination of policy-relevant information products targeted at specific stakeholder groups. 
    
 5. Prepares related documentation as required, including technical documentation, literature reviews and interpretive text.
    
 6. Conducts ad hoc analyses to support special studies, liaising with key stakeholders to fully define data and/or analytical requirements.
    
 7. Assists with other projects, special studies, ad hoc reports, articles for publication or presentations, as required. Participates on CIHI project teams as required.
    
 8. Develops and maintains knowledge of CIHI's data holdings, related data held by other organizations, and tools used by CIHI to access these data holdings.
    
 9. Maintains current knowledge about analytical techniques, health services and population health research, and stakeholder information needs.
    
 10. Assumes responsibility for other related duties as assigned. 
    
 What you'll bring to the table
    
Undergraduate degree in health sciences, health policy, health economics, social sciences, statistics or similar field. Graduate degree is an asset.

Three to five years’ experience working in a health care research or health policy, including the analysis, design and dissemination of research studies and related information products. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in one or more of the following:
 o experience with administrative health data (e.g. DAD and NACRS)
     o manipulating and analyzing large, complex databases 
    

Advanced knowledge and experience in using SAS for data manipulation and statistical analysis. SAS Certified Advanced Programmer for SAS 9 is preferred.


Working knowledge of Python is an asset


Experience in client support and preparation of statistical and descriptive reports.


Sound conceptual knowledge of determinants of health, the measurement of health status, and the Canadian health system.


Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.


Experience within a hospital decision support or quality improvement environment is an asset.


Experience with electronic health system performance measurement tools or business intelligence tools is an asset.


Fluency in English required, bilingualism an asset 

 Closing Statement
    
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
 We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


 Employment Equity
    
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.





Analyste principal, Indicateurs de santé et Soutien à la clientèle 
    
 Notre organisation
    
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
 Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
 L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants : 

une structure salariale concurrentielle
 un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
 l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
 un programme de planification de la retraite
 un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
 un programme de planification de carrière
 des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel



 Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
     La Division des indicateurs de santé et du soutien à la clientèle est responsable du calcul et de la diffusion des résultats de divers indicateurs de la performance du système de santé à l’échelle des hôpitaux et des provinces et territoires canadiens. L’analyste principal est un membre important de l’équipe. Il contribue à l’élaboration, à la vérification, à l’analyse et à la diffusion d’une série d’indicateurs qui visent à fournir aux dispensateurs de soins, aux décideurs de la santé, aux chercheurs et au grand public des données fiables et comparables sur diverses dimensions de la performance du système de santé dans le but de promouvoir l’amélioration de la qualité. Par ailleurs, l’analyste principal répond aux demandes des clients, collabore avec d’autres intervenants à l’interne afin de définir les exigences en matière de données, et collabore avec d’autres intervenants externes, au besoin. 
    
 Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
     1. Programmer et exécuter des analyses informatiques en vue de l’informatisation, de l’analyse et de la vérification des indicateurs, ce qui peut comprendre la prise en charge d’un ensemble défini d’indicateurs.
    
 2. Mener un examen méthodique des indicateurs existants, ce qui comprend les analyses de données et les analyses documentaires nécessaires.
    
 3. Participer à la diffusion des données sur les indicateurs de santé, y compris la vérification des données et la préparation des données pour les rapports.
    
 4. Participer à la conception, à l’élaboration et à la diffusion de produits d’information axés sur les politiques à l’intention de groupes d’intervenants ciblés.
    
 5. Préparer au besoin des documents pertinents, notamment des documents techniques, des analyses documentaires et des textes interprétatifs.
    
 6. Réaliser des analyses ponctuelles pour appuyer les études spéciales, et créer des liens avec les principaux intervenants dans le but de définir clairement les exigences en matière de données ou d’analyse.
    
 7. Participer à d’autres projets, études spéciales, rapports ponctuels ou articles destinés à la publication ou à des présentations, au besoin. Collaborer avec les équipes de projets de l’ICIS, au besoin.
    
 8. Cultiver sa connaissance des banques de données de l’ICIS, des données connexes détenues par d’autres organismes et des outils utilisés par l’ICIS pour accéder à ces banques de données.
    
 9. Rester au fait des techniques analytiques, de la recherche sur les services de santé et la santé de la population, et des besoins en information des intervenants.
    
 10. Assumer d’autres fonctions connexes, au besoin. 
    
 Que mettriez-vous à profit ? 
    
Baccalauréat en sciences de la santé, en politiques de la santé, en économie de la santé, en sciences sociales, en statistique ou dans un domaine connexe; diplôme d’études supérieures, un atout.

De 3 à 5 ans d’expérience de l’analyse, de l’élaboration et de la diffusion d’études de recherche et de produits d’information connexes dans le domaine des politiques ou de la recherche sur les soins de santé. La préférence sera accordée aux candidats ayant de l’expérience dans au moins l’un des domaines suivants :
 o données administratives sur la santé (p. ex. BDCP et SNISA NACRS);
     o manipulation et analyse de bases de données d’envergures et complexes.
    

Connaissance approfondie et expérience de l’utilisation de SAS pour la manipulation de données et l’analyse statistique. Certification « SAS Certified Advanced Programmer for SAS 9 », un atout.


Connaissance pratique de Python, un atout.


Expérience du soutien à la clientèle et de la préparation de rapports statistiques et descriptifs.


Bonne connaissance conceptuelle des déterminants de la santé, des mesures de l’état de santé et du système de santé du Canada.


Excellentes aptitudes pour l’analyse, les relations interpersonnelles et la communication.


Expérience dans un environnement d’aide à la décision ou d’amélioration de la qualité en milieu hospitalier, un atout.


Expérience des outils électroniques de mesure de la performance du système de santé ou des outils d’exploitation des données, un atout.


Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle, maîtrise du français, un atout. 

 Declaration
    
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
 Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
 La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.
 L’utilisation dans le présent document de la forme masculine ou féminine, selon le contexte, a pour seul but d’alléger le texte.


 Équité en emploi
    
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Business Effectiveness (Bilingual)
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   How you’ll succeed
 

 Scheduling support and partnership with frontline staff – Provide in-depth analytical, operational and tactical advice on matters related to schedule preparation and resource allocation using the automated scheduling tool. Provide consultation to banking centre leaders and market leaders on key drivers impacting banking centre performance, review their current staffing practices and share best practices to help improve operational efficiencies
 Analytical support Participate in monthly forecasting exercise and provide analysis support for strategic recommendations. Participate in ongoing projects while representing the WFM team and provide inputs in development and implementation of initiatives impacting banking centres



   Analysis Support
 

 Identify key drivers impacting a banking centre’s performance and work with leaders to implement best practices that help improve operational efficiencies
 Monitor monthly reports (transaction volumes, FTE, etc.) to identify trends that may impact certain banking centres’ and proactively provide support to mitigate potential challenges
 Perform in monthly workforce management analysis to review and validate forecasts generated and identify/correct any anomalies in the data
 Maintain ongoing reporting and dashboards on key metrics relating to banking centres
 Provide analytics support for strategic recommendations and projects



   Scheduling Support & Collaboration
 

 Provide scheduling support to BCLs/CGMs including troubleshooting on automated scheduling tool as required
 Partner with CGMs to help identify and implement resource sharing opportunities within the community for better coverage and client experience
 Extend 1:1 support to help new leaders setup and generate schedules using the automated solution
 Communicate potential changes/upgrades in scheduling tool to leaders and provide learning support as required
 Participate in projects/initiatives while representing scheduling team. Provide inputs in development and implementation of initiatives that impact banking centres
 Ensure knowledge, experience and best practices are shared within the team and frontline business partners



   Who you are
 

 You put clients first. Your first thought is about what our clients want and expect from us today and tomorrow
 You challenge the status quo. You wonder why things are the way they are and have ideas about how we can change them to simplify and add value
 You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and are an early adopter of new technologies
 You're passionate about people. You enjoy building relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity
 Experience. Have preferably 1-2 years of experience working in a client facing role at a banking centre
 At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1 day per week on-site, while other days will be remote.



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Communication, Customer Experience (CX), Management Reporting, Operational Effectiveness, Taking Initiative, Workforce Planning

Title: Inventory & Logistics Analyst
Description:
Do you have a passion for wine and enjoy working in a dynamic industry? Are you ready to embark on an exciting new phase in your career with a growing company and enthusiastic culture? If so, then this may be the right opportunity for you.
Diamond Estates (TSXV: DWS) is the third largest producer of VQA wines in Niagara, Ontario and is proud of the award winning, high-quality wines. Production is centralized in a state-of-the-art facility with various tasting and retail sales facilities throughout the Niagara Region. The Company operates a satellite winery, Backyard Vineyards in British Columbia and a National sales agency business, Trajectory Beverage Partners (“TBP”) that represents foreign and domestic beverage alcohol suppliers across Canada. The company is looking for their next team member in the Finance department for the role of Inventory & Logistics Analyst.
Reporting to the Director, Finance, this role is responsible for inventory data management, analyzing performance, identifying problems, and developing recommendations that support logistics management. Some travel may be required between offices located in Niagara on the Lake and Oakville.
Summary of Responsibilities

Oversee the OTC (Order to Cash) process for Buy/Sell inventory with leading meetings to provide updates about the market and shipment status.
Update and maintain various reports such as forecasting documents, issued purchase orders, inventory and open orders reports, etc…
Manage warehouse transfers as needed
Provide support to the Ontario Sales team to mitigate any out of stocks within system
Transact within the ERP system to receive/adjust inventory as needed.
Assist with month end inventory reconciliations for various warehouses
Assist with on/off boarding suppliers
Liaise between Brand/Sales teams and suppliers

Requirements

Post-secondary education ideally in business or supply chain
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel – Advanced Excel experience; lookup, pivot tables, etc.
Two+ years logistics or inventory analyst experience an asset, but not required
Strong analytic and quantitative skills, with business acumen
Strong knowledge of logistics and inventory management – procurement to cash process
Knowledge in inventory and logistics planning concepts
Ambitious, with a drive to continuously improve processes with thorough recommendations
Experience in the Ontario Wine / Beverage Alcohol industry an asset, but not required
Communicate results and findings in a clear and concise manner, collaboratively with other departments.

We thank all applicants for applying, however only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
Diamond Estates and its divisions is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with differing abilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

Casual dress
Company events
Dental care
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Flextime
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Profit sharing
Store discount
Vision care
Work from home

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:The company has a full vaccination policy against COVID-19 to ensure the health and safety of employees, guests and customers.
