Title: IM/IT Senior Business/Systems Analyst
Description:
Req ID: 134167 Company: Nova Scotia Health Location: Central Zone, Abbie J. Lane Memorial Building - QEII Department: IMIT Telecom Application Support Type of Employment: Permanent Hourly FT (100% FTE) x 1 position(s) Status: Management/Non Union Position Posting Closing Date: 4-Jul-22
 Nova Scotia Health is the largest provider of health services in Nova Scotia, with some specialized services also offered to clients throughout Atlantic Canada. We’re on a mission to achieve excellence in health, healing and learning through working together, which is reflected in the hospitals, health centres and community-based programs we operate across the province. Our passionate team of professionals provides a variety of high-quality inpatient and outpatient services including academic, tertiary, and quaternary care, as well as continuing care, primary health care, public health, and mental health and addictions. Join a diverse team of innovators, collaborators and creative thinkers today.

 Nova Scotia Health employs professionals in all corners of our beautiful province. We believe there's a place here for everyone to call home, from vibrant cities with exuberant nightlife to quaint towns with picturesque trails. The work-life balance that comes with an Nova Scotia Health role means you'll have the time to explore, discover, and participate in that coveted Atlantic lifestyle. Visit us today and check out www.novascotia.com to see why more people from across the globe are moving here.



 Responsibilities



      Business Analysis and Recommendations
     

Review and analyse business requirements with stakeholders.
Evaluate alternative vendor and in-house solutions, which take into consideration Provincial multi-departmental impacts and the complexities of various solutions.
Present recommendations to stakeholders.



      Application and Systems Management
     

Design and implement clinical communication application solutions in accordance with customer business requirements including a range of activities - from programming to configuration of turnkey software in consultation with relevant vendors.
Provide in-house maintenance for application software and/or liaise with the software vendor to ensure that upgrades and enhancements are applied and tested.
Assist user departments in defining their requirements for complex software applications, which often have multi-departmental impact.
Develop, implement and maintain application security. Install and maintain updates as required. Identify, apply, and test patches and upgrades to database, application and web server software.
Follow NSH Change Management policies and procedures
Become familiar with the operating environment of the hardware platform on which the application system resides.
 Documentation and User Support
     

Work with vendors and clients to develop user manuals and training materials.
Participate in training sessions for super users and staff.
Assist users during implementation and throughout the life of their applications.
Document automated and manual application management procedures associated with the application for the customer and Voice Services use.
Develop triage and troubleshooting procedures and processes.
Trains users in the operation of application software.



      Quality Assurance and Control
     

Unit, integrated, and user acceptance testing.
Assisting or managing application changes including scheduling, implementation, monitoring, documentation, and communicating to all stakeholders.
Participate in user department quality improvement and risk management projects to improve departmental procedures and workflows, as they apply to the application system.



      Triage and Issue Management
     

First point of contact for responding to and resolving application issues.
Triage and coordinate resolution of issues with vendors, IT resources, and clients.
Track resolution progress and escalate to management when appropriate.



      Supporting Responsibilities
     

Under the direction of the Clinical Communication Services Manager, assist or lead projects or initiatives as assigned. Duties include the development, evaluation, and maintenance of all associated documents such as: Project Plans, Request for Proposals, Work Breakdown Structure, Scope Definition, Statement of Work, Negotiation of Support Processes and Risk Management Plans
This position is required to provide after hours on-call support on a rotating schedule.



Travel to various sites through Nova Scotia will/may be required.





 Qualifications



A University Degree from a recognized university with a specialization in Computer Science, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in advanced Clinical communication applications in large enterprise environment
Minimum 10 years’ experience in Clinical communications systems preferred.
Demonstrates skills in the area of decision making, problem solving, and communications.
Knowledge and skills in the areas of needs analysis, hardware and software selection methodology and applications design.
Knowledge of project management tools and techniques.
Knowledge and skills in the areas of clinical communications, including, but not limited to, private branch exchanges (PBXs), significant experience with nurse call systems, RTLS, ACD and Call Centre Solutions as well as knowledge of paging technology includes the management of private paging networks and applications of the public paging network technologies.
Extensive knowledge of clinical integration engines; Nursecall (HillRom) and Centrak RTLS Systems.
Previous experience programming clinical interfaces
Experience supporting communications systems in a complex health care organizational environment considered an asset.
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task to meet tight deadlines
Strong interpersonal skills
 High level of accuracy and attention to detail
    

Understanding of IT communication tools and telehealth
Ability to execute through effective delegation, motivation and oversight
Experience in data analytics for decision support
Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Excellent verbal, written communication and influencing skills
Clearly communicates the NSHA vision, mission and values
Experience in working with patient care leaders
Ability to earn confidence, trust,and respect from colleagues; present ideas clearly and concisely and follow through on commitments.






 Hours of Work



 Full time permanent position; 75 hours bi-weekly





 Salary Information


 $35.27 - $44.09 hourly



 Once You've Applied
 Thank you for your interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

 This is a Management/Non Union bargaining unit position. Preference is given to bargaining unit employees for unionized positions. Employees are encouraged to view their seniority hours and dates in their SuccessFactors online profile. Successful applicants changing unions, bargaining units or employment status, are advised to seek clarification regarding their seniority, benefits, and vacation entitlement and/or usage, prior to accepting the position.

 As per the COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination Protocol in High-Risk Settings, Nova Scotia Health requires all team members to be fully vaccinated by November 30th, 2021.

 Nova Scotia Health is committed to being a workforce that is free of discrimination, values diversity and is representative, at all job levels, of the people we serve. Our priority groups are Indigenous, Black/African Nova Scotians, Persons of Colour, Immigrants/Newcomers, Persons with Disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+. Title: Analyste, Gestion de la Configuration & Données / Configuration & Data Management Analyst
Description:
Role and Responsibilities
 


 (English will follow)
 


   Role et responsabilités:
 

 Cueillette et compiler une variété de métriques en utilisant PowerBI
 Créer et maintenir les rapports de métrique pour l'analyse d'amélioration continue
 Supporter l’équipe de la Gestion de Configuration (GC) dans la revue et des processus, procédures et plans de GC
 Exécuter des tâches de GC avec compétence comme dirigé par le chef de groupe QA/CI.
 Supporter les systèmes de GC utilisés par les projets en suivant les procédures de base et de résoudre les questions et des problèmes des utilisateurs associés à l'utilisation du système.
 Enregistrer et identifier les artéfacts des projets tels que COTS logiciels, matériels et documents, qui comprendront des éléments qui sont achetés pour le projet ainsi que ceux fournis par les clients (Customer Équipement Meublé).
 Participer aux réunions pour la gestion de configuration (CCB) et de gestion du changement : examiner et approuver les modifications touchant les éléments de la configuration ; Veiller à ce que l'intégrité des baselines existantes n’est pas affectée ; Faire le suivi sur les questions et les actions attribuées aux membres du projet au cours de la (CCB) jusqu'à la fermeture.
 Supporter les procédures nécessaires de sauvegarde du système de rétention pour assurer le stockage approprié des supports de sauvegarde et la livraison des projets médias et documents livrables.
 Fournir un soutien aux gestionnaires et aux équipes de projet dans le suivi et le contrôle des données de configuration nécessaires à des projets de gestion et de garder les clients informés.
 Maintenir la voûte pour les éléments de configuration physiques créés / utilisées par les projets. (Par exemple, les médias, les lits, les licences documents, dessins, etc.).
 Soutenir et promouvoir les objectifs, les principes et les actions nécessaires pour faire que la GC soit partie prenante dans la culture de l'entreprise.
 Effectuer des audits sur la gestion de configuration et de faire les rapports sur les résultats.
 Identifier et communiquer les lacunes/problèmes, créer les demandes d'action corrective, et faire le suivi sur celles-ci.
 Effectuer les rapports de projet sur le statut des baselines et les demandes de changement.
 Vérifier les baseline sets des projets selon la réglementation des produits contractuels.
 Améliorer de façon continue les processus et les procédures CM et superviser l'automatisation des procédures CM, le cas échéant, à répondre aux besoins du projet.
 Supporter le rôle de gestion lors de la construction des versions des logiciels qui comprennent : Aider à l'élaboration, l'analyse et la maintenance des outils qui soutiennent et automatisent les processus pour le matériel ou les versions du logiciel produit. Aider à l’écriture des scripts et programmes d'installation pour l'installation des produits. Compiler et assembler des logiciels à partir du code source. Valider les journaux (logs) et travailler avec les ingénieurs de développement pour dépanner et les corriger les erreurs de construction.
 Exécuter les activités de GC conformément au plan de GC approuvé.
 Interpréter la documentation contractuelle relative aux exigences de GC.
 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les clients et l’équipe de projet concernant les questions de CM.



   Profil recherché:
 

 Bilinguisme (français et anglais).
 Diplôme universitaire en informatique, ou toute combinaison équivalente d'études et d'expérience, ainsi qu'au moins deux années d'expérience en développement de logiciels ou en gestion de la configuration.
 Connaissance du cycle de vie du développement de logiciels et de systèmes ainsi que des méthodes associées.
 Connaissance des procédures et des processus liés à la gestion de la configuration.
 Connaissance des procédures relatives à l'assurance de la qualité.
 Maîtrise des outils Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.).



   ******
 


   Here is the essential duties and responsibilities:
 


 Gathering and compiling metrics on a variety of business fonction using PowerBI.
 Creating and maintaining metric reports for Continuous Improvement Analysis
 Support the CM team in the review and establishment of CM processes, procedures and plans.
 Execute CM tasks competently as directed by the CM Lead as described in Configuration Management documentation.
 Support configuration control systems used by Projects by following basic procedures and resolve simple user questions and problems associated with system usage.

Log, tag and track project assets such as COTS Software, Hardware and documentation, which will include items that are procured for the project as well as those provided by customers (Customer Furnished Equipment).

 Participate in Configuration Management and Change Management boards to: Review and approve Engineering changes affecting configuration items; Ensure that the integrity of existing baselines is not affected;; Follow-up on issues and actions assigned to project members during CCB through to closure. Support system backup and retention procedures necessary to ensure proper storage of backup media and packaging of project deliverable media and documentation.

Provide support to Project Managers and teams in tracking and control of configuration data needed to management projects and to keep customers informed.
Maintain vault for physical configuration items created/used by projects. (E.g., media, COTS, licenses documentation, drawings, etc.).

 Support and promote the goals, principles and actions required to make CM part of the company's culture.
 Perform configuration audits and report on findings.
 Produce CM work products including baseline reports, audit reports, monthly CM activity reports, and Configuration Control Board (CCB) reports.
 Identify and communicate baseline deficiencies, raise corrective action request, and follow-up.
 Perform project reporting on the status of baselines and changes requests.
 Verify product baselines for compliance to contractual product regulations.
 Continuously improve CM processes and procedures and oversee the automation of CM procedures, when appropriate, to meet project needs.
 Support the Build and Release Management role on projects which include: assisting with developing, analyzing and maintaining tools that support and automate processes for hardware or software product release. Writes installation scripts and programs for installation of products. Compiles and assembles software from source code. Validates build logs and works with development engineers to conduct trouble-shooting and correct build errors.
 Execute CM activities in accordance with the approved CM plan.
 Interpret contractual documentation pertaining to CM requirements.
 Work closely with customers and the project team regarding CM matters.



   Qualifications:
 

 Bilingualism in both French and English is required.
 University degree in computer sciences, or equivalent combination of college education and experience, and at least two years of experience in software development or configuration management.
 Knowledge of systems/software development life cycle and development methodologies.
 Knowledge of Configuration Management processes and procedures.
 Knowledge of Quality Assurance procedures.
 Proficiency in MS Office productivity tools (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Visio).



   Position Type
 

 Regular
 

   CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.
 


   Equal Employment Opportunity
 

   At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.
 


   As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.
 


   At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.
 


   The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Reporting
Description:
FNF Canada is a leading service provider to financial institutions in the area of mortgage processing, tax and appraisal services, and title insurance. We pride ourselves on our relentless focus on enhancing the value of our services to our clients through continuous improvement and innovation.
Reporting to the Director, Strategic Initiatives & Project Implementation, the ideal candidate will be a client focused, highly professional self-starter with demonstrated experience in a similar function. They will also have a positive attitude with a high level of quality workmanship and attention to detail. The incumbent will have the overall responsibility for the strategy, design and delivery of information required to make key business decisions, monitor and measure performance, and to fulfill client reporting and analysis needs.
Duties and Responsibilities 

Recommend and establish business intelligence tools/systems, methodology and processes to support overall business reporting and analytics strategy
Develop scalable business intelligence processes for delivery of reports
Investigate and resolve data and reporting issues
Gain a detailed understanding of information and intelligence requirements of various stakeholders, prioritize and execute upon
Execute on reporting and analytics requests:


Gathering and documenting business requirements
Collaborating and coordinating with IT Application Development to fulfill requests
Deliver on business needs to specification and within committed timelines


Develop and maintain scorecard and dashboard requirements and specifications
Establish standards for reporting query criteria to ensure consistency, accuracy and alignment across various reports
Review quality control and accuracy, and implement controls to ensure deliverables meet high quality standards
Develop operational process to add, remove, and update metrics, reports, and scorecards
Establish internal service level agreement for the delivery of reports and analysis
Handle requests for routine reports to internal and external clients - ensure accuracy, timeliness and consistency
Respond to ad-hoc requirements for analysis and information
Responsible for data model development, testing and data management of complex reporting involving multiple sources and channels
Proactively analyze information and highlight key points, trends and issues
Assist with review and preparation of responses to RFP's, RFI's or RFQ's involving reporting requirements
Assist Implementations with defining new client or program reporting requirements and execute on same
Work directly with business partners and other data professionals to create reporting using reporting tools

Qualifications

University Degree preferred
5 years in a role with similar responsibilities in Analytics and Business Intelligence reporting
Working knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as Business Objects and any of the Microsoft BI Suite of tools.
Previous experience developing dashboards using any of the above tools
Ability to proactively solve & manage complex data, programming and reporting problems delivering business intelligence and data analytics
Client focused
Highly professional self-starter that can work independently
Strong analytical skills
Technical acumen
Expert knowledge with SQL, Python, Power BI and other relevant tools.
Experience in data gathering and analytics
Attention to detail and high level of quality
Knowledge of mortgage and title insurance industry would be a definite asset

Why work at FNF Canada: 

Comprehensive salary, bonus and benefits package
Working in a fun, entrepreneurial and dynamic workplace culture
Flexible work/life balance options.
Opportunities for professional learning, development and growth.

FNF Canada offers a competitive compensation and benefits package along with career growth opportunities with a Fortune 500 Company
Disclaimer: FNF Canada is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations for candidates with disabilities participating in our selection process are available upon request.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:

Casual dress
Dental care
Disability insurance
Discounted or free food
Employee assistance program
Employee stock purchase plan
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care
Wellness program

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Mississauga, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Title: Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics
Description:
Requisition ID: 143018  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is and we continue to evolve on what it can be, using technology to create innovative, forward thinking banking solutions with our clients’ needs in mind.
 We are made up of high performing, curious, energetic and collaborative individuals who thrive in our high trust agile environment to deliver best in class solutions for our customers. We believe in giving people hands-on challenges and the responsibilities that come with them, allowing them to grow, evolve and create opportunities to build their career.
 Are you ready to make the change and become part of an established disruptor with the backing of a highly engaged team? If so come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 Department Summary:

 The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.

 Role Purpose:

 The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics reports to the Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics. The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics is responsible for defining, investigating, and developing solutions to support the systems used in the Tangerine FIU (including but not limited to the Transaction Monitoring, Name Screening and Case Management systems). Additionally, the role will be leading and participating in initiatives to identify and action opportunities for local improvements to productivity, decision effectiveness, and the user experience.
 The Senior Business Analyst will work closely with IT, Business Intelligence, AML Operations/FIU, and the Tangerine AML to ensure successful delivery of objectives.

 Role Accountabilities:
 Responsibilities to support strategic and tactical deliverables


 Support the ongoing and periodic evaluation of existing and new FIU Systems tools and solutions to address changing business needs and emerging threats.
 Perform ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions.
 Perform the monitoring and maintenance of FIU strategies to address evolving trends.
 Institute and manage a disciplined change process for regular testing and deployment of FIU rules.
 Perform analytics and reporting to generate an accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and volume.
 Drive robust processes to enhance FIU Systems performance.
 Maintain thorough understanding of FIU Systems capabilities, gaps and opportunities.
 Provide analytic support in the development and implementation of FIU strategic plans.
 Ensure accuracy and effectiveness of FIU systems and drive periodic enhancements as needed.
 Execute a variety of technical testing including Business Acceptance Testing and User Acceptance Testing
 Assist the team in proposing, creating and presenting communications to management, stakeholders, and other departments on changes introduced as a result of new initiatives
 Maintain a thorough understanding of AML/ATF and sanctions system capabilities, gaps and opportunities
 Other duties as assigned


 Tangerine FIU Project Responsibilities:


 Support the Manager, FIU Strategy and Analytics to manage requirements-related activities and deliverables throughout the project life cycle (e.g. change requests, issues, risks, schedules, status reporting etc.)
 Conduct data mining and analyses to generate insights and intelligence to support initiatives and commitments
 Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and workflow analysis
 Write requirements / specifications using standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely
 Assist in the development of Test Plans and documentation to support testing
 Identify, anticipate, assess, manage and resolve issues and risks related to requirements' activities and deliverables
 Assess project issues and identify solutions to meet productivity, quality and goals
 Participate in regular status meetings with all stakeholders, to review project deliverables and deadlines, keeping the stakeholder’s needs and requirements continuously in view
 Produce high quality artifacts through effective business analysis, process mapping, and requirements generation


 Minimum Qualifications:

 Education/Experience

 University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
 Minimum 3-5 years of work-related experience within the Financial Services industry
 Minimum 2-year experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
 Experience in consumer banking products (credit, deposit and cards)

 Professional Certification

 ACAMs certification is considered an asset
 International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) certification is considered an asset

 Specialized Knowledge

 Knowledge of Compliance and AML/ATF systems and troubleshooting experience


 Technical Skills

 Strong and proven analytical skills
 Strong working knowledge of data mining tools
 Strong working knowledge of programing languages (Visual Basic, SQL)
 Strong technical solution management experience and skills
 Demonstrated experience using the MS Office Suite, in particular MS- Excel, MS- Word and MS-Visio
 Strong business analysis skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
 Experience with statistical modeling and data science methods
 Experience in business intelligence and analytics platforms 

Abilities

 Ability to work autonomously under tight timelines
 Ability to work in a dynamic environment where processes and procedures are consistently refined
 Strong presentation, facilitation, analysis and problem solving skills
 Strong capability to work with senior business leaders
 Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously 

Attributes

 Strong verbal, written and communication skills
 Strong attention to detail and organizational skills


 Working Conditions:
 The Senior Business Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior HR Forecaster/Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We acknowledge that Providence Health Care & the new St. Paul’s Hospital site is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the x?m?θkw?y??m (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and S?l?ílw?ta?/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
 The Opportunity:  Providence Health Care’s HR Systems & Reporting team is currently looking for a Senior HR Forecaster/Business Intelligence Analyst.
 What does the HR Systems & Reporting team do?
 This team oversees the analysis of Human Resource data in order to identify trends in the workforce and opportunities for the organization to improve our processes. This team also ensures integrity of the HR Systems data, and supports accurate reporting for analysis and presentation. 
What you will do:  Working alongside Juveth Loresco (Manager, Workforce Planning & Data Analytics) you will be responsible for leading planning, design, and optimization of People Services (HR) and Workforce Scheduling business application solutions including data warehouse development and/or enhancement of the data warehouse architecture to support departmental business needs in a sustainable and scalable manner. Some specifics include:

Working closely with Clinical and Operational Leaders, People Services teams such as Workforce Scheduling and other organizational stakeholders to determine business requirements and analyze their metrics.
Conducting statistical analysis, produces business models and forecasts, and develops and maintains performance indicators, comprehensive reports and tools using current business analytical methods and software.
Recommending and participating in the implementation of interventions to optimize workforce utilization and talent acquisition planning both on a short-term and long-term basis to ensure Providence Health Care has the right staff, in the right place and the right time.
Providing input into the development and implementation of policies and procedures for data stewardship and data governance.

About you:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field.
Five (5) years of recent, related experience in data warehousing, significant experience using Microsoft BI Suite (SSMS, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS), forecasting and analytics 
Ability to understand business requirements and translate requirements into technical specifications.
Ability to foster collaborative working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

The following skills/experience would be considered an asset:

Experience with HR and health care data.
Software development experience.
Experience working with Tableau or other data visualization software.

About us:
 Driven by compassion and social justice, we are at the forefront of exceptional care and innovation. Our organization, Providence Health Care, is a proud winner of three prestigious awards:

2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employers
2021 BC’s Top Employers
2021 Canada’s Top Employers for Young People

What we offer:

The salary range for this role is $77,822 - $111,869 per year, depending on experience.
A comprehensive health benefit package, including dental, vision, and life coverage.
An orientation session and comprehensive onboarding to all new hires.
A chance to grow professionally and personally, as part of a supportive team driven by innovation and the desire to address the future health needs of patients, families and our communities.

We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent. If your experience is close to the qualifications listed here, please still consider applying.
 Providence Health Care is committed to creating an equitable and inclusive workplace for all employees. We strongly believe in an environment where everyone feels valued and respected, which is reflected in our motto “how you want to be treated.” We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, and encourage applications from underrepresented communities, including (but not limited to) BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+, immigrants, and people with disabilities.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Business Systems Analyst
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 Senior Business Systems Analyst (PL08)What is the opportunity?You will be responsible for business analysis activities on medium to large size projects utilizing Agile best practices and frameworks. The role demonstrates advanced knowledge and ability, and can apply the competency in new or complex situations and guides other professionals with minimal or no guidance in the full range of typical situations. The role is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery- planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, management, and support - for changes to Retail Investments Business Areas and Technology.

 What will you do?

 Facilitate collaborative sessions with various of business stakeholders to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review
 Lead 1:1 elicitation sessions and apply various techniques to get a more in-depth understanding of problem-domain and prepare requirements for agile team
 Analyze and document scope of the business solution using RBC and industry-standard requirements techniques
 Analyze and document detailed business and system solution requirements, using enterprise requirements methodology
 Prepare requirements for review applying various communication techniques and lead requirements walkthrough and sign off sessions
 Conduct coverage analysis to ensure relationship between scope, detailed requirements, testing through to implementation
 Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates and manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties
 Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members and stakeholders


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline (minimum)
 Proven ability to gather Business and Systems requirements independently, having strong business analysis and systems analysis skills.
 Working knowledge of Requirements methodology (planning, elicitation, documentation) - such as Waterfall, Iterative and/or Agile
 Experience in Requirements analysis and quality documentation: Scope Modelling, Business Process Modelling, Use Cases, Data Requirements, Business Rules Analysis, Non Functional Requirements, User Stories, Story Decomposition, and Story Mapping, Acceptance and Evaluation Criteria Definition
 Excellent collaboration skills, attention to detail, gap analysis, and ability to work on multiple projects at the same time.
 Excellent communication skills required; will be working with BU stakeholders and IT stakeholders


 Nice-to-have

 Masters Certificate in Business Analysis
 Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA), or Project Management Institute –Professional in Business Analysis (PMI – PBA) Certification
 Experience with JIRA and Confluence
 Experience in Retail Investments in Mutual Funds and GICs


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies


 RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Client Master, Wealth Business Architecture
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

    The Data Strategy team is accountable for leveraging data strategically to drive growth and realize business efficiency and effectiveness while satisfying regulators. We work closely with our business, technology, and operations stakeholders to deliver high quality data that is integrated, accessible and shared across Wealth. We provide industry thought leadership in data analysis, leveraging data to develop deeper insights to further improve legendary customer and employee experiences. 
   


Job Description

    The Client Master is a common repository securely storing Client and Account data which is leveraged by other capabilities within Wealth and other consumers within the TD Enterprise.
    
 The Business Analyst will:
    

Support the Business Architect to Drive Innovation & Strategic Transformation by:

 Designing the target state for the capabilities owned demonstrating how it will achieve strategic business outcomes
 Develop the long-term roadmap of initiatives that will achieve the target state
 Continually enhance capability expertise by staying abreast of industry and competitive drivers and participation in industry committees and/or conferences

 Individual Accountabilities:

 Act as the Product Owner for projects related to assigned capabilities to ensure that outcomes meet the target state vision.
 Communicate progress on work packages in a concise and timely manner. Escalation of issues where appropriate
 Own the Product Backlog in an Agile environment.
 Provide ongoing prioritization of the product backlog utilizing an objective framework to ensure the appropriate focus of what's being delivered across multiple stakeholders interests
 Provide recommendations and direction based on the end to end customer experience when making decisions
 Own the facilitation and end-to-end delivery of business requirements following an agile and structured approach to determine how requirements are constructed, traced and prioritized to maximize business value.
 Ensures accuracy of business requirements documentation throughout the project to mitigate against project changes and reduce/manage cost to the project.
 Provide leadership, guidance and support in defining the business needs, business benefits, or problem/opportunity statements based on strategic drivers and identifying potential solutions
 Proactively identify and track requirements risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, constraints and anticipate and effectively manage risks related to requirements.
 Collaborate with technology partners and provide recommendations to support development of: system requirements and design, testing plans, artifacts/deliverables to ensure business needs are met.
 Identify risks or issues with technology solution or design which may impact realization of project benefits and provide guidance and support to stakeholders in making good decisions to pro-actively resolve or mitigate potential risks/delays to the project
 Support Quality Assurance activities which include review test plan, test cases and provide guidance on testing and defect reporting
 Support change management and overall project readiness activities
 Contribute to personal and team development of skills and capability through training, mentorship of junior/peer Business Analysts, and contribution to the BA practice
 Oversee data extract, data review, mapping, cleansing, insuring uniqueness, integrity, accuracy, consistency, and completeness
 Act as key knowledge leader for Client and Account data while providing support to consumers.

 Shared Accountabilities:

 Work with the Data Steward to achieve improvements in data governance and management within Wealth
 Meet project forecasts, as agreed with technology partners
 Support implementation activates





Job Requirements

Qualifications / Skills:

 BSA skills a strong asset as this is a technical team.
 Strong understanding of Agile methodology
 Strong time-management and organizational skills to manage multiple deadlines and priorities
 Ability to perform SQL queries.
 In depth understanding of the Wealth Management industry, competition and the factors that differentiate TD
 Ability to lead, facilitate and document processes in support of continuous improvement and new capability introduction activities
 Ability to integrate the broader organizational context into advice and solutions for Wealth
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team
 Solves complex problems requiring analysis of multiple variables.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate processes clearly
 Self-motivated individual with excellent team spirit
 Operate with a Lean mind set determining a fit-for-purpose approach to drive rapid delivery excellence

 Education/Accreditation:

 Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
 Proven track record of success with ability to influence and drive results.
 7+ years of experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified
 7+ years of experience in a variety of projects/markets on multidisciplinary teams
 Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) certification and Agile delivery experience considered an asset
 Business Analysis Accreditation is an asset




Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Actuarial Analyst – Retirement – Consulting | Analytical Services
Description:
WHO WE ARE?
 We’re Mercer - a global consulting leader in health, wealth and career. Mercer has more than 25,000 colleagues based in 44 countries. We help clients worldwide from small businesses to Fortune 1000 companies advance the health, wealth and performance of their most vital asset – their people. 

The Wealth Consulting Business brings together our Retirement and Investment consulting businesses to help develop holistic and integrated solutions to financial wellness.

 The Wealth Analytical Services (WAS) is a global team delivering exceptional analytical services across Wealth solutions that make a difference in our consultants, our clients and their members lives. We use our analytical skills to promote a higher level of consistency, quality and efficiency.

 WHAT WE VALUE?

 Strong analytical skills and working knowledge of Excel and others MS-Office software programs
 Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
 Intellectual curiosity; seeking opportunities to develop new skills
 Ability to work in teams and be flexible to work under tight deadlines and changing client needs
 Superior organizational skills and strong attention to detail
 Bilingualism (English/French)


 WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME? 

Be challenged to deliver impactful solutions for organizations of any size and varied industries and have a direct impact on their employees.
 Be part of our great training and development programs, including our actuarial education program
 Opportunity to work with the best tools, resources and some of the smartest people in the industry
 Be part of a work environment that promotes social connection and work-life flexibility
 Be provided opportunities to personalize your role and career
 Be rewarded for your achievements


 WHAT A TYPICAL DAY LOOKS LIKE?

 Perform retirement and post-retirement benefits actuarial valuation including validation of data, analysis of the plan’s gains and losses, analysis of the plan’s asset performance, and preparation of the valuation report and related forms
 Production of year-end accounting disclosure and projection of expenses for plans under various financial reporting standards including IFRS, CPA and FAS
 Complete benefit calculations, review plan documents, produce employee benefit statements and prepare annual government forms
 Participation in the design and pricing of client’s employee pension plans and executive pension benefits, including cash flow modelling, demographic projections and evaluation of liabilities within an asset-liability framework
 Production of various experience studies to refine demographic and financial assumptions used in actuarial valuations
 Designing and implementing strategies to manage defined benefit pension plan volatility, including funding strategy, plan design and risk transfer solutions
 Work in an integrated team of professionals from different offices to resolve modern actuarial problems in the Canadian pension landscape, including union negotiations, risk transfer and public policy


 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS?

 A bachelor's degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, finance, administration or a related field


 JOIN US
 At Mercer, we believe that diversity and inclusion are vital components of our future and our goal is to leverage the unique skillsets that each person brings to the company. We provide our employees with a supportive, collaborative environment that leads to innovative ideas and the ability to make an impact. If you thrive on a challenge and enjoy connecting with people, we’re looking for you!

 WHAT’S NEXT?
 Please provide a cover letter, your resume and your most recent transcript, via our website at www.mercer.ca (Careers Section). We will review application submissions and you will be contacted if you are selected for an interview.

 Mercer’s roots are in Canada – founded 75 years ago and continues to be one of the elite Canadian business and employment brands. Currently, the Canadian business earns $340+M CAD in revenue and employs 1,000+ colleagues across Mercer’s core services areas. Along with Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Mercer is one of four Marsh & McLennan businesses with a significant Canadian presence.

 Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 25,000 employees are based in 43 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 81,000 colleagues and annual revenue of $19 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit https://www.me.mercer.com/. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer.

 At Mercer, we’re creating a culture where you can bring your authentic self to work. When you join us, you bring your inclusive energy and enthusiasm to a team that values you personally and professionally – regardless of who you are, what you look like, where you were raised or born, who you love or what your religious beliefs are. You are welcome here.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
What makes DHL great? Our People! We know each employee’s individual contributions make us the #1 Express Delivery and Logistics Company in the world.  DHL Express is committed to maintaining an environment that empowers every team member to make the greatest possible impact on our business. Our corporate culture is about personal commitment – to our business, to each other and to our global communities. DHL is dedicated to being a great place to work. In addition to competitive compensation packages, our employees enjoy a range of programs, services and benefits that bring the best to their personal lives.   Start YOUR career with DHL today…  DHL Express currently has an opening for a Business Intelligence Specialist in our office in Mississauga, ON. This role reports directly to the BI Manager and works in the Commercial department. The successful candidate can work independently, and has attention to details.
How will you contribute to the success of DHL?

Use strong database knowledge to execute business analysis using various internal data sources to support understanding customers, business drivers to support Commercial results
Use strong reporting skills to craft insightful dashboards for critical business decisions
Conduct and facilitate business requirements and process walkthrough with Commercial business stakeholders 
Support lead generation and sales campaign-related activities mining data and identifying target prospects / customers for successful deployment of campaigns
Perform other duties as assigned



Do you have what it takes?

BA/BS Degree
Business acumen and knowledge of DHL’s services an asset
Proficiency in using MS SQL
Database proficiency 
Proficiency in reporting tools (PowerBI, SSRS, Excel)
Proficiency in Office 365 (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams)
Good working knowledge of Office 365 (Power Forms, Power Apps, PowerAutomate, SharePoint)
Data oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong collaboration and service mindset
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Ability to problem solve, multi-task and prioritize while working independently to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment


We are an equal opportunity employer and believe we will gain through the recruitment and development of staff who represent the broad diversity of the Canadian workforce.

Title: Production Controller Senior Analyst
Description:
Production Controller Senior Analyst

    Contact us Apply for this job 
   







Job information

Reference number
JR-0019853
Job function
Finance & Controlling
Position type
Full time
Site
Drummondville 4591 Blvd. St Joseph, Drummondville, QC J2A 0C6








Your responsibilities and tasks:


Act as a Finance leader to 1 manufacturing facility.
Serve as sparring partner to the Plant manager & production leaders to help drive cost efficiencies.
Attend daily plant production meeting and perform walkthroughs of the plant with the General Manager to discuss production and costing issues. Review labor cost, material costs, manufacturing overhead, distribution cost, returns and inventory levels.
Responsible for maintaining perpetual inventory. Manage cycle count programs. Ensure accuracy of the physical inventory and reported results. Investigate and explain book to physical adjustments. Assure compliance to excess and obsolete inventory policies.
Calculate and manage material, labor and overhead standards based on forecasted manufacturing capacity.
Perform audits of bills of materials to ensure product costs are accurate and accounted for properly.
Support the Sourcing department forecast and manage raw material inflation.
Support/validate plant cost productivity projects for labor, raw material and overhead reductions.
Support/Validate projects to reduce inventory turns and maximize supplier payment terms.
Forecast/manage plant CAPEX budgets
Monitors spending on key categories to include maintenance, supplies, and consumables, and support company initiatives to reduce spending.
Help the accounting team reconcile inventory and reserve accounts related to the plant financials.
Help divisional finance business support team to understand manufacturing capacity based on order backlog with the achievement of budget/forecasting financials.
Prepare presentations to Board of Directors and Senior Management Team
Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis








Your profile and qualifications:


5+ years of progressive responsibility in Supply Chain and standard costing Analysis. Qualified candidates must be able to demonstrate the ability to execute complex analysis, prepare comprehensive, clear, concise and action-oriented reporting.
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, demonstrating a working knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and financial analysis principles (IFRS knowledge a significant plus)
Strong working knowledge of ERP/Financial Systems & Applications
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office, including advanced Excel skills required
SAP experience needed
Access or other multi-dimensional analysis experience (able to build a relational database and queries) a plus
Strong data analysis experience, demonstrating the ability to understand business needs, obtain & validate data, interpret results, root cause anomalies and generate meaningful results
Manufacturing experience required
Finance or accounting professional certification, such as a CPA is a plus
Project management skills and demonstrated ability to balance multiple priorities
Ability to work independently, with minimal direction/supervision
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Travel Required: Up to (15%)

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Sales and Operations Enablement (SOE) Team
Description:
Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Barrie, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Calgary, AB, CA 
    







     Req ID: 25773 
    







     Jobs by Category: Operations 
    







     Job Function: Planning and Analysis 
    







     Status: Full Time 
    







     Schedule: Regular 
    







Description




Join our team

 The Sales and Operations Enablement (SOE) team of the Customer Experience Operations & Enablement (CEOE) organization is looking for a dynamic, enthusiastic and driven Senior Business Analyst, to join our team to deliver on complex, transformational systems projects. If you are interested in building IT solutions that drive the achievement of operational goals – this is the role for you!

 How will you drive business success? The SOE team members are the product owners for consumer pre-sales systems, which include field sales support tools, fibre drop management applications, and more. The capabilities we deliver are on platforms such as the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), mobile apps and Salesforce.com. Through strategic projects with agile development we ensure systems capabilities work seamlessly end-to-end and perform optimally so that our channel and operational partners can serve our customers in an efficient and cost-effective manner. Our goal is to reduce operational costs and improve revenue & yield.

 Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 As a Senior Business Analyst you will be the Product Owner accountable for maximizing business value delivery for our pre-sales systems and improving sales outcomes through projects focused on fibre drop and inventory data improvement initiatives, ultimately driving operational efficiency and increasing revenue. You will challenge the status quo and collaborate on finding the best way to deliver systems functionality with the user experience at the forefront of consideration. You will be accountable for the overall success of your project portfolio and your performance will be measured by the successful realization of your portfolio’s targeted business case benefits.






 Qualifications




Here’s how



Lead the development and implementation of system changes for project launch, including: 
      
requirements elicitation and user story definition
business case development
risk assessment / mitigation
stakeholder update presentations
user interface and processes design
test strategy development and testing

Be accountable for timely resolution of post-launch support issues engaging required technical experts
Develop a broad understanding of systems architecture and integration points to guide solution direction
Liaise technical subject matter experts and business stakeholders on cross-functional implementation activities to meet deliverables and influence decision making
Proactively identify and assess opportunities to deliver value to stakeholder teams
Ensure open & ongoing communication to support change management.
Ensure that business impacts are accurately captured and communicated to stakeholders while providing input, expertise and guidance to project teams on potential impacts the projects have to the Customer Experience
Track and measure post-implementation benefits to validate value has been delivered


 
You’re the missing piece of the puzzle and what you will bring



Passion for business analytics and systems analysis
Enjoy project work with cross functional team members
Proven track record in managing multiple projects from start to finish
Ability to quickly learn new technology and applications
Outcome focused, forward thinking, and willing to try new ideas
Creative mind and the drive to initiate your own projects
Thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment
Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Confidence in handling conflict and difficult conversations
Strong competency in the Google and Microsoft (MS) Office suite of productivity applications
Graduate Certificate or Degree in Management Information Systems, Business Analysis or equivalent experience

Title: Senior Manager, Business Analyst, VP

The Business Analysis Senior Manager is a senior management-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.  Responsibilities:

 Resolve issues that have impact beyond own area and apply in-depth understanding of concepts and procedures within own area and basic knowledge of other areas

Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. 
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
