Title: Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
We’re thrilled that you are interested in joining us here at the Amynta Group!
 
 The Application Development Manager is a management level position responsible for delivering results through the leadership of a team to establish and implement new or revised application systems and programs. This position reports directly to VP of Information Technology. The incumbent will have expertise in directing system architecture, analyzing business requirements, developing applications, business intelligence and presents logical solutions by planning, assigning, directing software design, development, and implementation.
 
   Position Functions:
 


 Responsible for the support and management of key information technology applications for SYM-TECH.
 Develop, maintain, and publish application systems related design documentation, standard operating procedures, policies, and knowledge base documents. Provide knowledge transfer to other IT teams to enable them to develop and assist in supporting the Application systems and environments.
 Day-to-day engagement with information technology application delivery and support team to ensure application delivery milestones and operational goals are met on time and on budget.
 Perform various project management duties. Assigning and managing resources for project related tasks. Drive completion of quality project deliverables. Prepare time and cost estimates for completing projects for management's review.
 Champion and demonstrate the reduction of technical debt.
 Ensure essential procedures are followed and contribute to defining standards.
 Personnel management of application team(s) including conducting performance evaluations, counselling/coaching, as appropriate, ensuring ongoing development and education, and participating in the staffing/recruitment process.
 Foster an environment of skills development of sub team members.
 Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the organizations reputation and safeguarding Sym-Tech, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability.
 Ensure that the highest level of customer service is provided by the applications team. Assure the applications team responds to help desk requests in a timely fashion. Work closely with IT Help Desk, DevOps, and other IT teams to analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve issues.



   Minimum Qualifications:
 


 Bachelor’s degree in Computing Science, Information Systems, or Business.
 Set clear expectations and define key performance indicators for self and team


 Excellent time and workload management skills
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
 Coach, mentor and manage assigned application development, implementation, and support personnel
 Act as liaison to business leaders with respect to the Application mandate.



 Technical


 5+ years of Application Development Management experience.
 10+ years of relevant Microsoft enterprise full stack solution development & technologies experience.
 Proficient on modern stack solution development including, but not limited to, jQuery, Angular, Bootstrap, Node.js, DAPR, Power BI, SSRS and Microsoft SQL Server.
 Experience on design of Microsoft Azure cloud technologies and microservice architectures.
 Excellent understanding of application development environments and techniques and the key operational activities to maintaining enterprise level applications.
 In depth knowledge of project management methods, techniques, and tools.


 A broad understanding of business technologies, standards, applications, and solutions relevant to a mid-size corporation.
 Experience working with vendors and managing external relationships.
 Certified Scrum Master certificate is an asset.

Title: Senior Analyst, Database Services #2022-0451 Information Technology, Laboratory Services Division
Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Analytics
Description:
Our client is a fast growing E-commerce company. This is a lead role for the Business Intelligence team. The Business Intelligence Team is responsible for providing a fully self-service single source of truth that empowers users to answer complex questions and drive actionable insights. You will be accountable for making data accessible, consumable and trustworthy for Business Intelligence and analytics. In this role in addition to coaching individual analysts, you will work directly with analytics engineering, data engineering, product management and business stakeholders to ensure we are meeting their data needs.
What is our Stack?
Looker and unit testing with Spectacles
DBT and LookML for modeling
Airflow for ETL and Orchestration
PostgreSQL and Redshift for storage and query processing
Fivetran for ETL and Hightouch for Data Activation
What will you do? 

Act as a subject matter expert on company's data assets, business intelligence and analytical tools.
Recommend and implement improvements to our tech stack that will help analysts do their work more efficiently and effectively.
Advise analysts on data modeling methods and best practices for building and maintaining end-to-end reporting pipelines
Manage and accelerate analytics careers, build teams, and hire candidates that raise the standard
Provide opportunities for knowledge sharing, to teach business stakeholders to self-serve with SQL and Looker.
Design, build and maintain trusted data sources - in the form of dbt transformations, Redshift/Postgresql tables and Looker views.
Review and approve LookML and dbt code submitted by others prior to merging changes into production.
Troubleshoot and help to resolve disruptions to business critical reporting.
Contribute to data documentation, including but not limited to data dictionaries, data lineages, metric definitions, and process and systems diagrams.
Build cross-functional relationships with business and technical stakeholders to understand the data, tools, and governance needed and deliver on those needs.
Seek diverse perspectives to drive innovation and create buy-in across stakeholders.
Proactively identify and implement technical and process improvements to drive our data platform forward with a metrics-driven, continuous improvement approach.
Skills and Qualifications

Qualifications

Minimum 5 years experience in a data or analytics role, working with significant autonomy and managing teams in either a formal or informal capacity (ie direct reports or cross-functional project teams).
Experience in data modeling and experience with dbt.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and any other programming language such as Python.
Experience with git
Experience in data warehousing methodologies such as normal forms, star/snowflake schema, Kimball, as well as when and how to apply these methods.
Comfortable interfacing across all organizational levels and functional roles.
Experienced in requirements gathering, project management, and other aspects of staying organized.
Strong business acumen; good written and verbal communication skills; and adept at creative problem-solving.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Pay: $135,000.00-$200,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Dental care
Life insurance
Vision care

Flexible language requirement:

French not required

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

data or analytics: 5 years (preferred)

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence - Payments and Merchant
Description:
Requisition ID: 155223  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Reporting to the Senior Manager Business Intelligence, the Manager contributes to the overall success of Retail, Small Business and Payments in Caribbean, Central America & Uruguay (CCAU) by creating business reporting and collaborating with CCAU countries on data inputs required to develop and execute Business Strategies, Plans and Priority Initiatives in the Region by working with multiple stakeholders across International Banking. Analyze and evaluate business reporting from each country in CCAU to ensure data integrity and alignment of all information. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

 Accountabilities:


 Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
 Generates and analyzes retail, payments and merchant execution data and reports across countries to ensure integrity of cumulative CCAU retail data reports.
 Support the business leverage data and identify opportunities for improvement, detect trends, recognize potential issues, and offer solutions with the goal of improving efficiency, increasing productivity, and generating profit for the business.
 Requirement to combine data from different data sources (data marts, excel, among others) to integrate a combined CCAU level reporting in excel and Power BI format. SQL required
 Development, optimization, and implementation of data models according to business needs, for proper data management and reporting implementation, complying with the regulations established by IT Toronto, PIA Data Office and Global Analytics.
 Structures required executive reporting and works with multiple countries and stakeholders across the CCAU to develop, receive and deliver such reporting on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.
 Collaborates with IB Consumer and Small Business and IB strategy stakeholders to ensure CCAU targets and reporting is aligned with their expectations and delivers such reporting to them on timely basis
 Manages strategic focus and execution maintaining with a clear understand of Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture to be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Ensure the levels of satisfaction of internal customers in relation to the requirements received (delivery time, quality of information, SLA, etc.)
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
 Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
 Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.

 Education and Experience:


 Master’s degree in Analytics, Business, related field
 Proven capacity to work with different groups of stakeholders and manage multiple tasks
 Regional experience is required
 Expert in Excel, excel formulas (vlookup, match, index, pivot tables), and attributes, references, etc.
 Expert level knowledge in SQL
 Expert in Power BI
 Expert communication skills across all levels of the organization
 Experience in working with financials and business cases
 Strong understanding of Retail business line and related metrics
 General understanding of how to work with data from servers, data mart mapping, and other data sources
 Strong understanding of Retail related operational processes and controls, including knowledge of organization and infrastructure.
 Bilingual in English & Spanish is preferred


 This role can be filled in any of the CCAU Countries

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Sr Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Welcome to 
ivari

 Let us introduce ourselves. With 300 employees across Canada, ivari is a company that’s making a difference in the world of life insurance. How? By finding and hiring employees who are passionate about helping people protect their families, and by giving them the best, most supportive workplace possible.
 At ivari, everyone is welcome! It is our mission to attract, develop, and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and the communities in which we do business. We offer an inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported.


 Here’s the job opportunity…



 We are hiring a Senior Business Systems Analyst for a 12-month contract opportunity. In this role, you will be responsible for the system analysis, design of solutions, and operational support to address business needs related to the company’s financial systems. As part of the team, you will design, configure, and deliver quality business requirements for requested changes to business processes, functions and/or products.
 

   You will also work with the business, IT and Project Management Office (PMO) stakeholders to develop requirements and ensure these are reflected in system and business process deliverables. You will develop solutions, investigate, analyze, design and test requirements for projects, products, system change requests, and production fixes.
 

   The Business Systems Analyst will:
 

 Provide end-to-end support through all the phases of application systems solutions development to delivery in order to support the approved business requirements.
 Participate in gathering of business requirements and documentation of business processes as they relate to interaction with the application system.
 Conduct required analysis to arrive at solutions through use of JAD sessions and/or related research gathering processes.
 Work closely with business partners, business sponsor(s), subject matter experts, Business Analyst, Quality Assurance Analysts, Programmer Analysts and other IT staff, to design solutions and ensure the solution is viable, supportable and meets the customer’s needs.
 Document solutions using the Design Specification Document.
 Coordinate and perform functional testing to ensure individual requirements have been met.
 Provide implementation support, production support, and problem resolution for the application systems and associated test environments.
 Act as subject matter expert on application(s) supported. This includes products, processes and data.
 Secondary duties may include business analysis and quality assurance.



 What we are looking for…


 3-5 years as a Business Systems Analyst supporting finance or actuarial systems (JD Edwards or AXIS preferred)
 Experience in insurance or financial services industry, along with familiarity with financial systems and applications; an understanding of accounting principles would be an asset.
 Experience with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) would be an asset.
 Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills, negotiation and influencing skills.
 Ability to facilitate business meetings and application design sessions within all levels of the organization.
 Good ability to work independently and collaboratively in larger groups.
 Ability to create clear documentation and explain complex process flows.
 Experience with data query tools such as SQL / Infomaker, XML.
 Knowledgeable in data driven analysis or data mapping or design flow practices.
 Ability to create work breakdown structures and estimations.
 Knowledgeable in Solutions Delivery LifeCycle processes.
 Background knowledge in Waterfall methodology; understanding of Agile framework an asset.
 University degree or post-secondary accreditation in preferred areas of study such as computer science, information technology, actuarial science, or related field.



 What's in it for you…

 At ivari, it's important for us to keep our people motivated, recognized and rewarded. We offer competitive base salaries plus a bonus, one of the many reasons ivari is a great place to work.
 We also offer health and dental benefits for the entire family from Day 1! But that’s just the beginning. When you join the ivari team you also get…

 A fantastic vacation plan and time off
 A pension plan with 100% match by ivari
 Employee savings plan with 75% match to help you save even more
 Flexible and hybrid work arrangements
 Opportunities for professional development
 Recognition programs to cheer you on, motivate and reward
 Wellness programs to keep you healthy and happy


 Who you are…
 Someone who enjoys a culture where everyone is genuinely respectful and you can be your authentic self every day. Your contributions and opinions are not only sought, but valued. You know the importance of, and live by, our core values of…

 Bringing clarity and focus to your work
 Taking ownership and doing what you say you will
 Remaining flexible
 Collaborating with others


 Does this sound like you? We’re looking for great people to join our team!
 Our commitment to inclusivity is reflected in the safeguards, policies and commitments we have in place to remove barriers and provide equal opportunities to prospective and current employees, without discrimination.


 To apply, please email your resume to: human.resources@ivari.ca
 


 A Human Resources representative is available to consult with applicants who require accommodation in the application or recruitment process. Any information shared by the applicant about an accommodation will be treated as confidential. If you do require an accommodation, please email human.resources@ivari.ca.

Title: Manager, BI Solution Delivery
Description:
Position Overview
 Number of Positions: 1
 Language: Bilingualism in English and French is an asset.
 Work Model: Hybrid
 Alternate Title: n/a
 Additional Information: The work location for this role is flexible to Burlington, Guelph, Montreal, Quebec City.






Our Business Intelligence team empowers decision making using leading edge science and analytics. We champion a scientific culture through our passion for continuous learning, diversity and innovation. We strive to deliver a single version of truth, by providing our business partners with access to comprehensive data and valuable insights to help our organization achieve operational excellence. As the Manager of Business Intelligence Solution Delivery you will lead a team in building and deploying advanced Business Intelligence (BI) solutions to meet organizational needs. You will define informational requirements and contribute to projects, to ensure delivery of high quality solutions and reconciliation standards.


 What you’re responsible for:

Managing operational activities to ensure effective delivery of BI solutions, including planning, project management, solution design, development, and testing. 
Establishing comprehensive project plans and ensuring projects are executed within cost and time constraints. 
Collaborating with your team to develop BI solutions including analyzing, interpreting various data sources, understanding related business processes, extracting data and validation. 
Ensuring BI development strategies, architecture and design, and best practices are applied to BI solutions. 
Coaching and developing your team, recruiting and selecting talent, managing and rewarding performance, and fostering an agile culture to deliver on strategic objectives.  

What to expect:

You will travel occasionally. 
As a leader, strict confidentiality is required with respect to sensitive matters and employees’ personal information. 
You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.  

To be successful:

You build trusting relationships and provide feedback to enable the successful development of your team and colleagues. 
You foster innovation and continuous improvement with a focus on client experience. 
You facilitate the adoption of change and create a high-performance culture through alignment of your team’s work with organizational goals. 
You successfully convey messages and demonstrate openness to exploring alternative points of view. 
You use critical thinking to guide decision making and apply a strategic mindset to adjust business plans based on shifting priorities.  

To join our team:

You have five years of experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics, Actuarial, or Information Technology. 
You have a post-secondary degree in Math, Statistics, Actuarial, IT, Finance or a related discipline. 
You have an in-depth understanding of data design, programming languages, project management, and analytical techniques and tools. 
Having the Associate Casualty Actuarial Society (ACAS) or Fellowship Casualty Actuarial Society (FCAS) designation(s) would be an asset. 
Having a MSc or MBA would be an asset.


What we offer:

Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Employers. 
Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs. 
A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture. 
Paid volunteer days to give back to your community. 
A comprehensive total rewards package, including competitive salary, bonus, pension and benefits. 







Interested in applying?
 Click 'apply now' to submit your current resume and cover letter. Tell us a bit about yourself, your professional experience and how you think you can make a difference at Co-operators. We look forward to learning more about you and we welcome you to follow us on LinkedIn.
 Co-operators is focused on fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible work environment and we encourage individuals from all identity groups to apply. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact the hiring manager.

Title: Senior Payment Analyst
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
 


   At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
 


   To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
  
   CIBC.com
  



   Job Description
 


   What You’ll Be Doing
 

   The Senior Payment Investigation Analyst within Global Money Operations (GMO) is responsible for the delivery of efficient operational support, accurately processing service inquiries and requests while upholding compliance with internal controls and procedures. The role uses judgement regarding priorities and approaches to obtain complete and accurate information of client issues, provides clients with detailed explanations of their recommendations, and verifies their understanding of the issue. The incumbent demonstrates strong technical and system knowledge to review and analyze data to ensure quality assurance of transactions and maintain customer satisfaction. In addition, the role assists in the management of day-to-day operation and overall efficiency of the unit, while seeking opportunities to streamline existing processes and procedures.
 


 At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.



   How You’ll Succeed
 

 Critical and Analytical Thinking – As a GMO team member you will ensure complete and timely review and action for wire payment inquiries and identify root cause where possible.
 Cross training & flexibility – You will enhance your knowledge of the many types of payments received at financial institutions, learn how to handle diverse payment inquiries, and problem solve. You will cross train to support and understand multiple processes and be able to jump from task to task all the while acting as a subject matter expert (SME)
 Relationship Building - Required to interact with internal business partners, external business partners, and correspondent banks globally. You represent yourself professionally and can clearly articulate your thoughts. You are able to foster mentorship relationships with your team and with others across the bank.



   Who you are
 

 You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
 You’re goal oriented. You’re motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make a difference.
 You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You connect with others through respect and authenticity.
 You love to learn. You're passionate about growing your knowledge. You have a strong sense of curiosity.
 You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing Mutual Funds License (Canadian Securities Course or Investment Funds in Canada).
 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.



   What CIBC Offers
 

   At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
 

 We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
 Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
 We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.



   What you need to know
 



     CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
    
     Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
    



     You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.
   



   Job Location
  CALG-855 2 ST SW., 10th FL
 
   Employment Type
  Regular
 

   Weekly Hours
  37.5
 
   Skills
 
 Communication, Data Analysis, Operations Management, Quality Assurance (QA), System Knowledge

Title: Business Development Rep - Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you ready to make a BIG impact with TD SYNNEX?

 We are the world's largest IT distributor, striving to lead the next generation of technology and talent. Whether you're applying for your first role or you're a seasoned executive, seize this opportunity to develop your career in the technology industry alongside our network of best-in-class vendors and caring and collaborative co-workers across the globe.
 
 In addition to a competitive benefits package, we provide our co-workers with opportunities to get involved in well-being seminars and programming, employee-led Business Resource Groups (BRGs), leadership development tracks, special industry events, and much more.
 
 Take the next step towards a rewarding career and apply today. We're excited to meet you!
 

Overview:

 The mission of the Business Intelligence function is to identify and translate market opportunities into actionable recommendations to achieve individual, team and, most importantly, the sales goals of the SMB Division. This analyst will support the SMB sales team in finding new ways to attract new customers, maximizing value of existing customers, and retaining the most profitable ones. Close collaboration with the SMB Sales Manager in the development of sales campaigns, target setting and post campaign measurement and reporting.
 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities Required:


 Build or develop Tech Data's market knowledge with a focus on understanding available market potential (i.e. SAM) and opportunity and market penetration (i.e. Share Of Wallet)
 Collect & analyze relevant pieces of customer information
 Cross-check internal and external information sources (eg NPD)
 Ensure adoption of consistent process/methodologies/source data (modelling, assumptions, use of external data sources)
 Initiate and coordinate SAM collection activities
 Determine the customer's lifecycle and value to the organization -
 Integrate internal / external customer level data to measure / track customer value and buying behavior
 Proactively identify actions to capture incremental business (i.e. retain, develop and acquire)
 Establish intuitive reporting methodologies, perform ad-hoc market analysis as required to support strategy and analyze performance -
 To allow management to drive sales force activities
 To maximize revenue opportunities via detailed customer knowledge
 Liaise between Sales and Product Marketing, as a central coordination function, to ensure sales agent activity is directed towards areas of maximum profitable revenue.
 Continuously produce actionable information for Sales Teams in support of Retain, Develop and Acquire initiatives
 Work with vendor partners in preparation of customer lists for campaigning, ensure appropriate customer segmentation, and validation of campaign offerings
 Help sales prioritize target groups for customer reactivation activities based on predefined criteria (e.g. Credit status, SAM intelligence etc)
 Support Sales in customer acquisition through targeting prospects via segmentation techniques and campaign generation
 Measure and provide feedback on effectiveness of Sales campaign activities
 Validate sales agents' call capacity, ensure all campaign elements are in place before campaign can be executed
 Release campaigns for execution or next level of approval and ensure deployment onto sales floor
 Maintain and update customer, contact and profiling information
 Collaborate with Marcom, Product Marketing and Sales to;
 Ensure all data sources are leveraged to maximize value
 Review data findings, analyze results and share recommendations
 Work with support depts (i.e. IT and Ops) to continuously evolve reporting and tool development including the tracking and measurement of impact.


 Other Duties & Responsibilities:


 Additional duties as assigned
 Meets attendance and punctuality standards


 Qualifications:

Title: Supply Chain Governance Senior Analyst
Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

 McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 12 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
 
 At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
 

Job Summary

 Reporting to the Senior Director, Supply Chain Management and Governance, the Supply Chain Governance Senior Analyst, is responsible to:
 

 Support the end-to-end supply chain process stream aimed at ensuring flawless execution of service level performance targets.
 Implement a LEAN governance system to drive accountability and alignment of key performance indicators.
 Implement and lead multi-disciplinary planning reviews aimed at promoting effective communication flows to ensure optimal cross- collaboration.
 Orchestrate root cause analysis and problem-solving initiatives to pro-actively manage risk and reduce potential banner related penalties.
 Work in close collaboration with various cross-functional stakeholders to drive efficiency through continuous improvement initiatives and innovation.
 Be an advocate to communicate a clear vision and need for change within the organization that generates excitement, enthusiasm, and commitment to the process.
 Conduct benchmarks and instill best in class supply chain business.
 Consolidating relevant information and synthesizing it for executive level awareness, including, making good sense of data, and performing in depth analysis, socializing challenges with Procurement Operations stakeholders.

 Key focus areas include good service levels, healthy inventory, accurate forecasts, and timing of launches (ex: promotions, new modular/planogram events, etc...) that are all in-line with the company’s financial targets.
 

Section A – Specific Responsibilities

 Governance and Communication (40%)
 

 Prepare and support governance meetings to report on results, banner contractual and internal KPIs, risks and challenges with management team.
 Understands, values, and communicates enterprise interdependencies and leverages this insight to enable informed decision making.
 Works in collaboration with key internal stakeholders including but not limited to; Promotion Planning/Demand Planning/Planogram/Supply Planning/Operations/Sales and Customer Service to drive flawless execution of Supply Chain plans.
 Liaises with the key internal and external (banner) stakeholders to ensure flawless execution of supply chain plans, customer commitments and enhance collaboration on past and forthcoming inventory quantities.
 Prepare presentations to the senior management team.

 Data analytics (40%)
 

 Monitors and masters raw service level performance and engages with key stakeholders with the goal of collaboration and commitment to improvements.
 Based on banner contractual agreement regarding penalties, analyses penalties and provides inputs on areas to further discuss with the banners and the Account Management team.
 Anticipates challenges on service levels and establishes contingency plans to address issues before they impact performance.
 Enhances reporting capabilities, in collaboration with System & Analytics team, to illustrate a clear picture of fill rate performance as part of the governance.

 Process improvements and Strategy Setting (15%)
 

 With the help of analytics and various support teams, identifies risks in the supply chain and develops the appropriate contingency plans to overcome them
 Collaborates closely with the Supply Planning team to propose inventory parameter adjustments and placing and monitoring of Rush orders where required.
 Collaborates closely with the Demand Planning team for forecast development internally and externally (suppliers and customers).
 Considers the long-term impacts of decisions and actions; spots new trends, potential problems, and opportunities early and communicates to governance team.
 Constructively challenges the standard way of doing things and helps identify areas for process improvement; applies creative problem solving and resourcefulness when everyday issues arise.
 In collaboration with internal stakeholders, leads sessions to improve processes leading to higher service levels and healthier inventory.

 Change Management (5%)
 

 Effectively engages stakeholders, minimizing risk to efficient adoption and maximizing benefits through a focus on the organizational, cultural and people aspects of business transformations.
 Applies change management principles and methodologies for stakeholder adoption.
 Generates excitement with the team to create engagement and commitment to improving.

 Other (5%)
 

 Maintains relevant business knowledge of product categories and stays abreast of market and industry trends and conditions.
 Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.


 Section B – Position Requirements

 Working Experience
 

 7+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management, Sales & Operations planning and customer service, and / or procurement.
 Retail/Wholesale experience an asset.

 Education
 

 Bachelor’s Degree in Supply chain related field, Business Administration, Operations Management, or equivalent.
 MBA or MSc, CPIM or SCMP designations are assets.
 Lean Six Sigma Green Belt is an asset.
 PMP certification is an asset.

 Personal Development and Soft Skills
 

 Demonstrates the ability to solve complex problems and create effective and innovative solutions in order to develop solid strategies
 Strong analytical skills, detail oriented, focused, rigorous, and committed to meeting deadlines
 Strong business acumen.
 Demonstrated leadership.
 High proficiency in French and English (written and spoken).
 Strong communication skills; adapts to the audience, active listening
 Comfortable interacting/presenting to a large group of individuals.
 Good change management skills.

 Technical Skills
 

 Proficiency with ERP systems and Replenishment systems an asset.
 Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).
 Knowledge of process and project management.

 Other Skills and Capabilities
 

 Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.
 Ability to identify operational and strategic issues and proactively drive solutions.
 Ability to work as part of multi-functional teams.
 Minimal travel might be required.
 #LI-JT2


 Worker Type
 Regular

Description of Services: 
This role is responsible for identifying, gathering, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of end-users in a particular area of the business, and for IT projects or initiatives. These include interviewing stakeholders, capturing the “to-be” state, process improvements, and identifying the associated business requirements. These results convey to the Architecture, Change Management and Quality Assurance teams the breadth and nature of the end users’ needs and environment, thereby driving their solution design, change management and testing efforts.

Facilitate requirements gathering and validation workshops.
Develop and document project visions and approach.
Analyze and define business requirements for determining roles relationships and data structures to meet business security privacy and operational requirements.
Analyze and define data and information requirements needed to address business requirements used by data modelers and architects responsible for developing logical and physical data models and/or analyzing and designing class models to meet business requirements.
Work with business clients and technical teams on the design development and implementation of business applications.
Document, analyze, and manage business requirements.
Develop business cases.
Produce deliverables within specified quality standards.
Escalate issues and risks as appropriate.
Prepare and execute tasks in accordance with a defined project plan.
Review and provide input on test strategies plans and test cases to ensure they adequately cover the defined business requirements.
Execute tasks in accordance with control processes, including schedule management, status-reporting issues, risk and change management at the project and or program level.
Attend necessary meetings to review schedule, status, issues, risk, and change management.
Support project team members in the analysis of issues.
Prepare status reports, meeting minutes, change requests, and other documents.
Undertake management detailing tasks and review the timelines associated with the execution of those tasks.
Obtain signoff on the deliverables from the appropriate program project sponsors.

Title: Jr. Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
For over 70 years, Chicago Title has proudly provided security for Canada’s real estate transactions. We understand the true value of our insureds’ properties, they represent more than just numbers on a statement. When it comes to our clients’ peace of mind, no detail is too small to overlook. From offering better value than anywhere else, and unmatched customer care, we will safeguard the real estate industry, one property at a time.
Owned by Fidelity National Financial, North America’s largest title insurer, we are an industry leader in title insurance solutions, customer service, and real estate technology. Our focused, Canadian-based organization lets us respond quickly to our clients’ needs. We’re not just in the title insurance business, we’re in the client success business.
We put the customer first, listening carefully to hear your unique needs and provide creative solutions. We strive for results, providing world-class products and services while continually innovating to improve what we offer. Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions

Description:

Description




Join our team

 The Sales and Operations Enablement (SOE) team of the Customer Experience Operations & Enablement (CEOE) organization is looking for a dynamic, enthusiastic and driven Senior Business Analyst, to join our team to deliver on complex, transformational systems projects. If you are interested in building IT solutions that drive the achievement of operational goals – this is the role for you!

 How will you drive business success? The SOE team members are the product owners for consumer pre-sales systems, which include field sales support tools, fibre drop management applications, and more. The capabilities we deliver are on platforms such as the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), mobile apps and Salesforce.com. Through strategic projects with agile development we ensure systems capabilities work seamlessly end-to-end and perform optimally so that our channel and operational partners can serve our customers in an efficient and cost-effective manner. Our goal is to reduce operational costs and improve revenue & yield.

 Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 As a Senior Business Analyst you will be the Product Owner accountable for maximizing business value delivery for our pre-sales systems and improving sales outcomes through projects focused on fibre drop and inventory data improvement initiatives, ultimately driving operational efficiency and increasing revenue. You will challenge the status quo and collaborate on finding the best way to deliver systems functionality with the user experience at the forefront of consideration. You will be accountable for the overall success of your project portfolio and your performance will be measured by the successful realization of your portfolio’s targeted business case benefits.






 Qualifications




Here’s how



Lead the development and implementation of system changes for project launch, including: 
      
requirements elicitation and user story definition
business case development
risk assessment / mitigation
stakeholder update presentations
user interface and processes design
test strategy development and testing

Be accountable for timely resolution of post-launch support issues engaging required technical experts
Develop a broad understanding of systems architecture and integration points to guide solution direction
Liaise technical subject matter experts and business stakeholders on cross-functional implementation activities to meet deliverables and influence decision making
Proactively identify and assess opportunities to deliver value to stakeholder teams
Ensure open & ongoing communication to support change management.
Ensure that business impacts are accurately captured and communicated to stakeholders while providing input, expertise and guidance to project teams on potential impacts the projects have to the Customer Experience
Track and measure post-implementation benefits to validate value has been delivered


 
You’re the missing piece of the puzzle and what you will bring



Passion for business analytics and systems analysis
Enjoy project work with cross functional team members
Proven track record in managing multiple projects from start to finish
Ability to quickly learn new technology and applications
Outcome focused, forward thinking, and willing to try new ideas
Creative mind and the drive to initiate your own projects
Thrive in a fast-paced and changing environment
Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Confidence in handling conflict and difficult conversations
Strong competency in the Google and Microsoft (MS) Office suite of productivity applications
Graduate Certificate or Degree in Management Information Systems, Business Analysis or equivalent experience

Title: Senior Analyst, Database Services #2022-0451 Information Technology, Laboratory Services Division
Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Analytics
Description:
Our client is a fast growing E-commerce company. This is a lead role for the Business Intelligence team. The Business Intelligence Team is responsible for providing a fully self-service single source of truth that empowers users to answer complex questions and drive actionable insights. You will be accountable for making data accessible, consumable and trustworthy for Business Intelligence and analytics. In this role in addition to coaching individual analysts, you will work directly with analytics engineering, data engineering, product management and business stakeholders to ensure we are meeting their data needs.
What is our Stack?
Looker and unit testing with Spectacles
DBT and LookML for modeling
Airflow for ETL and Orchestration
PostgreSQL and Redshift for storage and query processing
Fivetran for ETL and Hightouch for Data Activation
What will you do? 

Act as a subject matter expert on company's data assets, business intelligence and analytical tools.
Recommend and implement improvements to our tech stack that will help analysts do their work more efficiently and effectively.
Advise analysts on data modeling methods and best practices for building and maintaining end-to-end reporting pipelines
Manage and accelerate analytics careers, build teams, and hire candidates that raise the standard
Provide opportunities for knowledge sharing, to teach business stakeholders to self-serve with SQL and Looker.
Design, build and maintain trusted data sources - in the form of dbt transformations, Redshift/Postgresql tables and Looker views.
Review and approve LookML and dbt code submitted by others prior to merging changes into production.
Troubleshoot and help to resolve disruptions to business critical reporting.
Contribute to data documentation, including but not limited to data dictionaries, data lineages, metric definitions, and process and systems diagrams.
Build cross-functional relationships with business and technical stakeholders to understand the data, tools, and governance needed and deliver on those needs.
Seek diverse perspectives to drive innovation and create buy-in across stakeholders.
Proactively identify and implement technical and process improvements to drive our data platform forward with a metrics-driven, continuous improvement approach.
Skills and Qualifications

Qualifications

Minimum 5 years experience in a data or analytics role, working with significant autonomy and managing teams in either a formal or informal capacity (ie direct reports or cross-functional project teams).
Experience in data modeling and experience with dbt.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and any other programming language such as Python.
Experience with git
Experience in data warehousing methodologies such as normal forms, star/snowflake schema, Kimball, as well as when and how to apply these methods.
Comfortable interfacing across all organizational levels and functional roles.
Experienced in requirements gathering, project management, and other aspects of staying organized.
Strong business acumen; good written and verbal communication skills; and adept at creative problem-solving.
